story:
Short Summary

My name is Shanice and I've been a professional stylist for 14 years 16 if you count my schooling. I owned my own salon for almost 7 years, but had to walk away from it due to health issues.  Because of my health I know what it is like to struggle that is why I'm volunteering a month of my time to service those who can not afford grooming services. I will be gathering a team and will visit different locations(shelters, orphanages and nursing homes) for a full month servicing individuals who can not afford to go to a barber shop or salon to get their hair done.


What We Need

The funds I receive will go towards finishing out the interior and exterior of the Rv. We need new flooring, some plumbing and electrical work done, some minor painting, a shampoo bowl, and our logo decals for the outside of the vehicle. Some of the funds will also go towards paying the stylist who participates in providing free servives for a month.  

 

The Impact

I've been in this industry  long enough to know that when people look good they feel good. I believe everyone deserves to look good regardless if they can afford it or not. It makes me feel really good to see the look on people's faces after services are rendered. That's why a selected team and I  will be servicing  those who can afford  it free of charge for a month.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you come across our campaign  and  you're not able to contribute we ask for you to please pass our information  on to those that are able and willing. If you are not able to contribute  financially  but you are a stylist in the DFW area please contribute by volunteering  your time to the cause, and service those who will benefit.

story:
The Mission

In cities across America, thousands of youth-oriented organizations work every day to help young people learn, grow -- or simply survive.

In many ways, our country's future depends on the sustainability of these groups, which often operate on shoe-string budgets, and/or on the backs of courageous, selfless volunteers.

Over the course of 100 days, Chris Strub (that's me!) will visit, and volunteer with, 50 different organizations: one in each U.S. state. The journey begins May 15 in Greenville, S.C., and winds clockwise around the country before finishing Aug. 21, in Asheville, N.C.

Chris is a 29-year-old kid at heart from Long Island, N.Y., currently living in Greenville. In 2014, he completed a 48-state, 90-day solo road trip; this year, he's determined to use his influence and the power of social travel to effect significant societal change, and positively influence the lives of youths in need.

What We Need & What You Get

To complete this exciting journey, Chris needs your help. Travel costs are significant and life on the road is often unpredictable. This campaign will help me fund an expensive, risky proposition. $10,000 will cover fuel, maintenance on my vehicle, and air travel to Anchorage and Honolulu, and help defray the costs of lodging and food.

If the goal of $10,000 isn't reached, Chris will still make every effort to complete the entire journey.

Any funds beyond the goal will be used to help further the mission of the organizations I visit by improving our ability to tell their stories in a robust, informative fashion.

The Impact

The impact that a volunteer, coach, teacher or mentor can have on a child's life is immeasurable. On this journey, Chris will set out to tell the stories of as many of these heroes as possible, raising valuable awareness for each organization on both a local and national scale.

Exhibiting real-life examples of the needs of each organization will help two-fold: it will inspire individuals to volunteer and contribute their own time and energy to these needy causes; and it will encourage financial and/or in-kind donations from those in a position to do so.

Media coverage of the journey from traditional and nontraditional sources will help further raise valuable awareness for each organization along the way. I'll also spread the word about Pay Away the Layaway, my inspiration for wanting to work with youth orgs nationwide.

Risks & Challenges

Solo travel is inherently risky. The journey is expected to span more than 15,000 miles behind the wheel, primarily on unfamiliar roads and highways. Vehicle maintenance can be costly and time-consuming.

Coordinating a solo journey with separate youth organizations in 50 states is, to my knowledge, an unprecedented challenge. Your words of support will undoubtedly help me complete this difficult adventure. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to contribute financially, that's OK! There are numerous ways you can support this journey:

  • Follow @ChrisStrub on Instagram, SnapChat, Meerkat, Twitter and YouTube
  • Tweet @ChrisStrub with any questions you have along the way, using #TeamStrub
  • 'Like' Chris Strub - #TeamStrub on Facebook
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools to spread the word about the mission.

story:
Short Summary

简介

My name is Shawna Lee Campbell, I am an artist and educator starting a children's publishing and production company, Scribbles & Rhymes. Scribbles & Rhymes will be a small company focusing on children's literature, film, music and art.  Our aim is to inspire a love of literacy, passion for the arts, a belief in magic and wonder about the Earth.  

我的名字叫肖娜.李.坎贝尔，一名成立儿童出版和创作公司涂鸦&押韵公司的艺术家和教育者。涂鸦&押韵将会是一个专注于儿童文学，影像，音乐和艺术的小公司。我们的目标是激发那些对文学素养的热爱，艺术的热情，魔法的信仰和对地球的好奇等方面的儿童群体。

The first book, entitled "Henrietta", to be published by Scribbles & Rhymes is written by the lovely and talented writer Lucy Rose with illustrations by myself, Shawna Lee Campbell.  "Henrietta"is a beautiful fine art book about a young girl and her magical adventure around the universe with flying dolphins!

涂鸦&押韵公司即将要出版的第一本书被命为“Henrietta”亨丽埃塔，它是由我们可爱和才华横溢的作家Lucy Rose写作并由我本人完成插图部分。“Henrietta”是一本非常精美的美术书，讲述了一个小女孩和飞行的海豚环球冒险的奇幻之旅。

Working in publishing is a dream career both myself and Lucy have dreamed of and aspired to since we were children.  Real books in literature are something we are both extremely passionate about and we hope you are too.  

从事出版业是我和Lucy从儿童时期就一直梦想和渴望的职业。我们对真正的文学书刊都有极高的热情，我们希望你也一样。

"There is no friend as loyal as a book." Ernest Hemingway. 

We are also working on an audio book for Henrietta, performed by Phoebe Batteson-Brown, a very talented actress from London, England.  The audio play will be released in August on Itunes. 

At Scribbles & Rhymes we deeply value and respect the environment.  All books and print products will be printed to the highest environmental standards and will be manufactured in Canada. http://books.friesens.com/a-legacy-of-green/

“书籍比朋友对你更忠诚.” 欧内斯特·海明威.我们现在在忙于Henrietta的音频书，由来自英国伦敦的一个非常有才华的女演员Phoebe Batteson-Brown配音。音频播放将会于8月份在Itunes上发布。Scribbles & Rhymes公司内部非常重视和尊重环境。所有即将要被印刷的书籍和印刷作品都会以最高的环保标准在加拿大生产http://books.friesens.com/a-legacy-of-green/

Future publications include titles such as  "There's a Polar Bear In The Kitchen" a humorous but critical story about climate change, and "MiMi" an illustrated biography of an inspiring kitten I rescued in China. We have some children's songs including "Go Away Monster" and "Monkey Child" with collage-animation short films/music videos  in the works.

未来将要出版的作品包含像“厨房里有一只北极熊”，一个幽默但又不失关于气候改变讽刺意味的故事，”MiMi” 一个关于一只我在中国救助的励志小猫的插图传记。我们同时还有一些儿童歌曲包括"Go Away Monster" 和"Monkey Child"，歌曲里面配有拼贴动画短片或音乐视频。

We are also happy to be accepting submissions from new children's authors and illustrators for future publications. Being a small and new company, authors and illustrators can submit directly to us, no agent needed. 

我们也很乐意接受新涌现的儿童小作家和漫画家为将来的出版物投稿。作为一家小规模的新公司，作家和漫画家可不用通过中介直接向我们投递稿件。

What We Need & What You Get

我们的需求&你的收获

We are trying to raise $10,000 for production and marketing costs of Scribbles and Rhymes debut book "Henrietta". 
Our initial goal is to print and sell 5000 books of "Henrietta", which will cost approximately $7150.00.  The remaining $2850.00 will go to both the costs of this campaign, and marketing costs to sell "Henrietta".
Contributions are rewarded with a variety of perks including a copy of the audio book, copies of the book, as well as print acknowledgements, illustrated post cards, fine art prints and original custom paintings. 
If our goal is not reached in entirety, our priority with the money raised is printing costs with a smaller print run. 
Proceeds from the sales of Henrietta post-campaign will fund future projects mentioned. 

我们正在筹集10，000美金用于涂鸦&押韵公司发行的第一本书籍"Henrietta"亨丽埃塔的出版和宣传费用。我们的首期目标是印刷和销售5000本，这些所需费用估算约为7150美金。结余款2850美金将会全部用于销售"Henrietta"所涉及的相关宣传和活动费用。捐赠者将会获得像音频书籍复本，书籍复本，还有印刷致谢篇，插图明信片，精美艺术印刷和原创定制绘画等多种不同的奖励。如果我们的目标没有全面达到，我们将会优先将所筹集的资金用于较小数量的印刷费用。"Henrietta"书籍销售后所得收入将会用于之前所提到的将来的一些项目的资金。

The Impact

影响

Scribbles & Rhymes is a company dedicated to inspiring children and the adults in their lives.  We wish to share our love and passion of art and environment with you and in the lives of our readers. 

涂鸦&押韵公司是一个致力于在生活中激发儿童和成人的公司。我们希望和你还有我们生活中的读者一同分享我们对艺术和环境的的爱和热情。

Scribbles & Rhymes will be founding a literacy charity, "Turning Pages" where we will be donating initially 5% of each print run to literacy charities in Canada. As our business continues to grow and thrive we plan to expand our donor amounts to contribute as much as possible.  While we at Scribbles & Rhymes DO value the gift of digital technology, we believe children must read real books.  We believe there's a power in the experience of Turning Pages and want to keep the art of the book alive for generations to come. 

涂鸦&押韵公司将会成立一个文学慈善基金，届时我们将最初向加拿大的文学慈善基金捐赠每本印刷本5%的善款。随着我们业务的持续增长和壮大，我们计划尽可能的扩大我们所能够的捐赠金额。在涂鸦&押韵公司我们重视数字技术方面的天赋，我们坚信儿童必须阅读真正的书籍。我们坚信阅读体验的力量，并且希望为我们将来的后代延续书籍艺术的生气。

Risks & Challenges

风险&挑战

My name is Shawna Lee Campbell, the Founder and Creative Director of Scribbles & Rhymes and the Illustrator of "Henrietta".  I am currently completing my bachelors degree in Early Childhood Studies with a Minor in Psychology at Ryerson University. As a full-time student, I am committed to the success of Scribbles & Rhymes and relying very much on the success of this campaign to fund the publication of "Henrietta".  Starting this small publishing company is a life long dream and I am excited to introduce these new book titles and beloved characters to the readers of the world. 

我的名字叫肖娜.李.坎贝尔，Scribbles & Rhymes公司的创始人和创意总监，并且还担任了"Henrietta"书籍的插画师。我近期正在Ryerson瑞尔森大学完成我的儿童早教专业学士学位和辅修心理学。作为一名专职学士，我致力于Scribbles & Rhymes公司的成功和非常信赖这个项目的成功为"Henrietta"的出版提供资金，组建这个小的出版公司是我一生所追求的梦想，我非常激动向全世界的读者介绍这些新书籍的名字和心爱的人物角色。

Other Ways You Can Help

其它方式的帮助

All contributions are valued and appreciated, no matter how small. Even if you are only able to spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, associates and colleagues.  It would be amazing and incredibly helpful if you can post this campaign in your social media and help us spread the magic of Henrietta and her flying dolphins.   

所有的捐款都会被重视和感激，无论它又多小。即便你只是和你身边的朋友，家人，伙伴和同事通过分享来传播这个活动。如果你能把这个活动发布在你的社交媒体圈和帮助我们传播亨丽埃塔的魔法和她的飞行海豚，那将会是对我们难以置信的帮助。

NOTE: All perks can and will be delivered anywhere in the world provided there is a mailing address. 

注意：所有的津贴可以并将在世界任何地方递送提供有一个邮寄地址。

Even if you are only able to spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, associates and colleagues.  It would be amazing and incredibly helpful if you can post this campaign in your social media and help us spread the magic of Henrietta and her flying dolphins.   


所有的捐款都会被重视和感激，无论它又多小。即便你只是和你身边的朋友，家人，伙伴和同事通过分享来传播这个活动。如果你能把这个活动发布在你的社交媒体圈和帮助我们传播亨丽埃塔的魔法和她的飞行海豚，那将会是对我们难以置信的帮助。


NOTE: All perks can and will be delivered anywhere in the world provided there is a mailing address. 
注意：所有的津贴可以并将在世界任何地方递送提供有一个邮寄地址。

story:
The Idea Behind Death Horizon

A group of friends got together during lunch to write a story and after many months of writing, the first draft of Death Horizon was complete.

The story comes from Hyper Nova Studios (HNS), the heart and soul of Alec Jiu. Alec has written multiple stories for HNS in the past, including several of the older versions of Death Horizon and the much more recent fan film, 95th Annual Hunger Games. In addition to creating those short films over several days of hard work, HNS has also successfully produced several videos that were filmed in one day's time. Keeping in mind that HNS has previously worked with only small crews and very basic equipment, it has still found a way to move forward and continue creating many beloved videos. After a bit of down time though, everyone behind HNS has chosen to step up their game and make a bigger story come to life.

It's been 6 years since the original script was completed and since then, Death Horizon has seen many changes. Now Hyper Nova Studios wants to step up their game. Enter Death Horizon, rewritten from the ground up to contain new, exciting action and a gripping story, while still maintaining some of the original plot points. The film takes place in a modern day Las Vegas, two months after a mysterious plague overtook the world. It's up to the characters to find their own way out of the city.

To us, this film is not only a new, fresh start, but it is a stepping stone for many more projects to come. We are a relatively small crew, running with starting level equipment, and introducing a cast of completely new actors. And yet, a successful campaign would not only help us make the film as a whole better, but also improve the film studio exponentially. 

Funding Time

So when we think of funding for TV shows, movies, or even web series, we think big. Multi-million dollar projects. While these are all different, their funding all goes to the same relative things.

We aren't asking for anything close to those big-budget projects, simply enough to make a polished film that people can enjoy and share with friends. Simply put, $2,000 should allow us to get the project moving. Where exactly is your money going though? The $2,000 is going to be used for getting better camera equipment, costuming all of the characters to fit the world, and getting props to better dress the sets we will be working in.

Want to get a little more specific?

Equipment: We're talking microphones to pick up crisp clean dialogue, lights to see whats going on, batteries to avoid wasted time during recharging periods, and a very important one, a tumble mat so we can accomplish some awesome looking stunts without expensive hospital bills as a result.

Costuming: Let's just say, having everyone costume themselves is a bit too...loose. We end up with everyone wearing things that don't exactly fit the story. So, we are looking at getting some nice outfits to fit the apocalyptic world. 

 Props: Death Horizon revolves around action and we need guns... a lot of them. So, the best bet is Airsoft, and while they do look and feel like the real thing...they aren't cheap (especially for really nice ones). Although a big portion of the prop budget will go to weapon props, it is not the only thing we will be getting. The story will also call for a few props to dress up the vehicles, people, and scenery. All in all, the prop budget will be the smallest part of the film.

Perks!

If we do not reach our goal, don't fret! The money that we raise will still be going into the same areas listed above, just in smaller quantities. We will still attempt to make the best film possible even without the full funding. However, fulfilling our funding goal would mean a better finished result...and going over our goal...well that could lead to even better equipment and crew to help us deliver the project we think you deserve. 

The Campaign

This project's life will be dependent on the funding raised by the community. Without the funding, the film will be difficult to complete. While we can do our best to make this happen, it won't be the same quality as the vision we currently hope to reach. That's where you come in! Contributing will help raise the quality standard for the film and could make it better than we ever expected!

While we have never attempted a project of this scale, we have completed a smaller 3 day shoot, keeping in mind that it was a non-stop shoot for all three days.The budget for that project was around $500-$600 and was funded mostly by the people working on it. However, we have gained much more experience and are now comfortable to take on a project much larger and deliver something many people could find enjoyment in. 

At the point of writing this campaign, we have already raised awareness for the project with people we have previously worked with and we will continue to do our best to get the word out, but having some extra help never hurts! In addition, we have the camera crew and a large percentage of the talent already lined up and ready to work. All we need now is the funding to make it all come together.

Risks & Challenges

Number one is quite simply...funding. That's why we are here running this campaign. We can always get things done without the funding, but that will slow production and immensely cut down the quality.

We are a small company, so we are prepared and have planned ahead for some possible delays either in filming or post production. However, if this happens you will all be the first to hear about it as well as be notified about the speed with which we will get back on track. 

Copyright is another huge factor that has to be taken into account. While we will be filming and making everything ourselves, one may still think of music and sounds that need to accompany the film. We can't afford to get contracts from big music groups, so instead we will look to newer upcoming artists to contribute to the soundtrack.

Want to Help Out?

Want to make this project a reality but can't afford to contribute? No worries! Just share the campaign with as many friends and family as you can! Sharing with just one person could help the campaign out immensely.

From all of us here at Hyper Nova Studios, thank you for taking interest in our next project  and we hope to see you out there on the big screen!

story:
Short Summary

Renovation process may cost you much more than you can even imagine. Finding the right products is #1 on homeowners’ list of challenges in the renovation process. Currently people spend weeks and even months walking through the shops and trying to find products they really like, and they will really use.

So, if you are a homeowner willing to renovate or redesign your home, Home Planning is just what you are looking for. This is a great tool for you to easily change or create your home decoration.

Home Planning (www.homeplanning.me) will make possible to provide information about the existing materials in the market, advice and expertise to the interested individuals, at the same time promoting the companies that sell and import/export products needed for home planning activities.

We are working on a customer friendly website with a database of interior design items existing in the market, which will help you to make the design by your own without leaving the apartment.


What We Need

We are looking for a US $95 thousand. This capital will be invested throughout the website development and meeting the marketing needs.

If we won't reach the desired funding, the money will anyway invested in the website development.


What we will offer to our costumers

We will help you to:

Get an improved picture of how your apartment will look like after the renovation;

Get an improved picture of what is available in the market;

Find and select your desired or required materials without leaving the apartment;

Be updated on new arrivals in the market;

Get on-line consultancy from professional designers.


Why will costumers use our product?

It’s FREE;

No sophisticated and expensive software;

No costs for software upgrades;

Time-saving process;

A comprehensive (growing) on-line database of the market products.


Few Screenshots

story:
Imagine a Mashup of the Smithsonian Institution, Disneyworld and Comic-Con that's being built during the time of VR. Welcome to the Mediaverse.net, the First VR MuseuCON.

A VR World for all Things Pop Culture and Fandom.

It’s a place born into the digital VR age of the Internet and like it's predecessors, it’s a museum and a destination that examines and celebrates our culture and it’s creators from our modern era (1950-2050) The era when POP culture and Media has been our main area of production and consumption. We lived much of our lives in the virtual Mediaverse, now its finally time to make it seem real;) A perfect way to use Virtual Reality and to learn about our past and think about our future.

Help us Build it. Join us.

What is the Mediaverse MuseuCON ?

Located “online” in Cyberspace, the Mediaverse MuseuCON, in the 3D form of a Construct of Genre Specific Spheres, will offer a 24/7 virtual environment that can be viewed on multiple platforms and by first or third person avatar experiences.

The Mediaverse MuseuCON is to be a VIRTUAL PLACE on the Internet, that combines the text of Fandom Wikipedias, with videos and images and 3D environments and artifacts that span the POP culture universe. It’s an ever expanding VR structure that “lives” in Cyberspace, that's composed of a central entrance atrium core, that opens up and links to 12 or more POP Culture Media Spheres that encompass the history of the different Genres that have made our Fandom culture for over 60 years.

It’s the Fandoms you love:

The preliminary Genres of fandom we look to build contain experiences, exhibits and stories about the worlds, the characters, the universes that we all love. How will we choose which ones get priority to create? Well. we have a plan for that, and it includes YOU!  More on that later, for now, here is the list of where we think we’re headed, which Genres we'll focus on.

The 12 CyberSpheres Planned:

1. Comic Book Culture

2. Horror and Monsters

3. Science Fiction and Fantasy

4. Toys and Games

5. Pop Music

6. Food and Fashion

7. Technology

8.  Art and Photography

9. Comedy and Humor

10. Advertising 

11. Design + Architecture

12. Animation and Anime

These 12 Worlds will include the inside stories and history of TV shows, the Movies, the Songs, the Actors, the Artists, and the Things that gave our culture  it’s media identity for over 60 years.

It’s the History you Lived:

An Edutainment Environment, the Mediaverse MuseuCON will focus not on the “fictional narratives of the content you know” but on the unknown stories of it’s Creators.The Artists and Artisans who created the TV. the Music, the FILM. and the Narratives of the last 60 years.

The Mediaverse will take a layered approach to learning about the media that has shaped us all. The worlds environment will be fun and entertaining, but the information and true stories contained within the exhibits will provide us all with the realities behind the virtualities of the media we all grew up in.

Each Zone will be Hosted and Curated by an Expert in that Genre from our Core Mediaverse Team. They will help decide with your help hopefully how content is displayed and chosen. What events take place, what contests might happen, and how your thoughts and ideas can be added to the Mediaverse so that it reflects both the creators and viewser's contributions.

In the future we want to hold virtual meet ups, grow them into VR conventions. and eventually hold large global fandom events. Offer schools to have VR Class trips. And eventually allow members to build and have VR Club Houses within the Genre zones and cyberspheres. It’s a lot to think about and to do. But we think we can make it start NOW.

We think the time is right to begin to build this VR place on the Internet. A VR Portal to all things Fandom. New 360 cameras and HMD's are all getting produced for direct consumer markets in 2015. This means everyone can visit and contribute to this VR world. For years Cube3 had been creating digital projects that were ahead of their time, but now, the Mediaverse has caught up, and now's the time to build the future on our past.

The Project Plan :

We plan to take a modular approach to building and designing the Mediaverse MuseuCON..

The first crowdfunding success will be targeted to preliminary design, gathering of curated content, team building and a limited VR environment to explore and meet up at in Virtual Reality.

If we pass certain milestones, we will increase our production and scope to build out the Mediaverse quicker and with more and more of Fandoms wants. Should we build a Dr. Who Tribute World first?, or a Star Wars Zone? Maybe a Zone dedicated to Female Characters and their Creators in Science Fiction and Fantasy? Should we create a Punk Rock Club that celebrates places like CBGB's that are no longer with us? What about a Full Sized Godzilla? You tell US.  Join the Indiegogo and Vote!

The First VR Space to be Designed and Produced from this  first stage crowdfunder would be the Central Entrance Core, which would offer a VR meeting place for all visitors and fans/members.  It’s design and existence will provide a taste of the entire Mediaverse MuseuCON to come. It also will serve as a VR meeting space to all members to discuss and learn about the Mediaverse's construction.

After the Central Core is built, we’d focus on the Science Fiction or Horror Genre Zones most likely due to our teams current expertise and what we all would think would be  Fandom's  desire first.. But, we want you, contributing fan members, to help decide each other sections order of construction and focus and we want to make that part of the funding plan.

What Platforms will Support it, How will it be built ?

Cube3 has been working with virtual reality and real time 3D for over 25 years. Over that time there have been many platforms and tools that have come and gone. What stay’s is the “3D Designs and Content Built ”  For that , we’ll use long time professional tools from companies like Autodesk and Adobe. As we work on this project we’ll examine popular current 3D engines like Unity or the Unreal engine, and look to Support VR on the plethora of new HMD’s that are arriving. As the project moves forward, we expect 360VR video and WebGL to also play a larger part in presenting content in the Mediaverse. Of course, legacy platforms like Personal Computers, Mobile Phones and Tablets are all targets for delivery as well. If anything, over the years, we’ve learned that the best experiences come from the match of scope and content too the platforms used. Whichever 3D engine we finally use , or multiple techs we use will all depend on what’s ”the best thing” as we release and grow the Mediaverse. Our goal is to make a VR world that’s easy for all to use, accessible to all, and most of all, fun and entertaining to experience and learn in.

How can I Help? 

YOU , the “Viewser” of the Mediaverse. We need YOU. This type of project can’t be done by anyone else but YOU. No one Company owns the culture, Not one cultural foundation of the past is ready to build this type of experience yet. But  with crowdfunding, you and a dedicated team of designers and developers can make this happen.

We plan to build the perks into funding that reflects your interest in the POP Culture things you love. This crowdfunder on Indiegogo is the first step. Please join us. Contribute and choose a level and check out the Perks.

We already own the URL Mediaverse.net and it will serve as the web portal to the Project and VR World. We have the tools to build all the 3D Worlds. The experience of over 25 years doing precisely these type of projects, AND we are Media Crazy People to boot.

View the Galleries to see some of the VR Work we've done and Ideas we've had. Check back for Updates and let us know what you think.

Best, LarryR.

larry@cube3.com

Chief Builder of the Mediaverse MuseuCON

www.cube3.com

www.mediaverse.net

story:
INTRODUCTION

When passion for adventure in Bangkok, Thailand evolves into an intensive exploration of the Kathoey community, questions ensue.

What is the difference between Eastern and Western culture as it pertains to the acceptance of either a transgender woman or an effeminate gay male?  In LADY BANGKOK BUDDHA BOY, IDA Films takes you into a world that many believe is only visible in a dream.  Join us as we explore a handful of Kathoey stories, their family bonds and severances, the tragic reprimands given to them for supposed crimes committed and the spiritual moments that make up their lives. 

IDA FILMS

IDA FILMS is a New York and Stockholm based  based independent production company established in 2012 by Swedish born Director Stefan Blomquist and Co-founders Kojenwa Moitt and Lauryn Garza. The company focuses on developing ideas and producing works in both non-fiction and fiction filmmaking with a strong focus on social issues, human rights and underdog protagonists.  At our core we are all anthropologists and our combined curiosities for other cultures lead us to explore beloved places like Thailand, India, Cambodia, Vietnam and North-Africa to name a few. This together with our cumulative background in the Arts, PR, Marketing and Business makes us a unique and passionate team to work with. 

Our first film Miss D premiered at the Short Film Corner at the Cannes Film Festival in 2012 and later went on to screen in over 20 countries. 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

The funds raised on INDIEGOGO will cover the Production and Post Production phases of the project.  Most of the funds will be used for our DP related costs, Equipment Rental and Post Production. A full Budget breakdown is available upon request as well as a copy of our Development Package, Budget Sheet and Project Timelines.  

As a supporter for this project you will not only be supporting this film but also a young film company that stays true to our VISION; To continually strive towards producing a unique and visually flawless quality of film that advocates anthropology while exposing social issues or raw human nature that is generally hidden.

THE IMPACT

With this film we hope to contribute to the ever evolving Liberal Revolution.

Our key objectives include: clarifying misconceptions regarding the transgender community and raising social awareness particularly in areas where freedom of expression is still suppressed. 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

If we were not to raise our complete fundraising goal the funds raised through INDIEGOGO  would be put aside solely for the completion of this project at a later date. The IDA TEAM is fully committed to completing LADY BANGKOK BUDDHA BOY and we are aware of our upcoming challenges and face them with great respect and excitement. 

We are confident that we can take this project to the International Film Festival Circuit with and intended Theatrical Release and Distribution Deal. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools on your social media accounts!

We greatly appreciate your support and Thank you in advance!

Sincerely, THE IDA FILMS TEAM
story_txt:
INTRODUCTION

When passion for adventure in Bangkok, Thailand evolves into an intensive exploration of the Kathoey community, questions ensue.What is the difference between Eastern and Western culture as it pertains to the acceptance of either a transgender woman or an effeminate gay male?  In LADY BANGKOK BUDDHA BOY, IDA Films takes you into a world that many believe is only visible in a dream.  Join us as we explore a handful of Kathoey stories, their family bonds and severances, the tragic reprimands given to them for supposed crimes committed and the spiritual moments that make up their lives. 

IDA FILMS
IDA FILMS is a New York and Stockholm based  based independent production company established in 2012 by Swedish born Director Stefan Blomquist and Co-founders Kojenwa Moitt and Lauryn Garza. The company focuses on developing ideas and producing works in both non-fiction and fiction filmmaking with a strong focus on social issues, human rights and underdog protagonists.  At our core we are all anthropologists and our combined curiosities for other cultures lead us to explore beloved places like Thailand, India, Cambodia, Vietnam and North-Africa to name a few. This together with our cumulative background in the Arts, PR, Marketing and Business makes us a unique and passionate team to work with. Our first film Miss D premiered at the Short Film Corner at the Cannes Film Festival in 2012 and later went on to screen in over 20 countries.

THE IMPACT
With this film we hope to contribute to the ever evolving Liberal Revolution.Our key objectives include: clarifying misconceptions regarding the transgender community and raising social awareness particularly in areas where freedom of expression is still suppressed. 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES
If we were not to raise our complete fundraising goal the funds raised through INDIEGOGO  would be put aside solely for the completion of this project at a later date. The IDA TEAM is fully committed to completing LADY BANGKOK BUDDHA BOY and we are aware of our upcoming challenges and face them with great respect and excitement.

story:
About

Charley Tucson is the story of a man on the verge of a mental breakdown with nothing more to live for. Written and directed by filmmaker Derick Crucius, the film follows Charley on his final two days before he commits a public shooting, and examines in an artistic and experimental way the issues of mental health and gun violence in America. Based on actual people and events, Charley Tucson is a cautionary telling of what can happen if firearms fall into the hands of the wrong people.

Who We Are

We are Dead Pixel, a video production company started in Philadelphia, PA in 2015 with a direct focus in producing and collaborating on independent cinema, and showcasing creativity and artistic works in the visual medium.

Derick Crucius is a Writer/Director from Philadelphia. Ever since he was young, he's always had a passion for cinema and writing. He has always been interested in pushing the envelope and experimenting with painting & filmmaking. After graduating from The Art Institute of Philadelphia with his Bachelor Degree in Filmmaking, he went on to screen short films at The International House of Philadelphia, Anthology Film Archives, The MoMA & The Boston Underground Film Festival. Derick is deeply influenced by outsider art and tends to make films that cross the boundaries of surrealism & reality, while focusing on those who are outside of society.


Ryan Regan is an Executive Producer/Script Supervisor living in Philadelphia, PA. Storytelling has always been one of his greatest passions in life. He grew up in small town Pennsylvania and moved to Philadelphia for university. He then moved to Glasgow, UK to complete his Bachelors of Fine Art Photography from the Glasgow School of Art, and then returned to the U.S. to receive his Bachelors Degree in Communications with a focus in Video Production from Arcadia University. The thirst for continual knowledge and understanding is his main driving force, and is one that will not be so easily quenched. Ryan is also an actor, writer, & photographer for DEAD PIXEL.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for a total of $4,000 in order to make this project come to life, and here is a rough breakdown of how that money is going to be spent.

-Main Talent Fee's 

-Supporting Talent's Fees

-Crew Travel Per Diems

-Props & Special FX

-Cast Travel Per Diem

-Craft Services

-Prizes & Rewards

-Film Festival Entry Fee's

-Crew Fee's

-Additional Expenses/ Gear Rental

Working on shoe-string budgets in the past has worked for us; however, we would like to show what we are capable of doing with an actual  budget. Our plan is to bring you a film that is both artistic & challenging, but makes a statement on society today. We plan on offering great prizes such as a digital download of the film, the film's poster, a DVD copy of the film, and a Producer credit in the film.


Impact

By contributing you are helping us tell an important story, and helping us achieve our goals of making this our lives. With your help we know that we can make something incredible and impactful, that will get people talking and thinking about the issues involved. We will be eternally grateful and will give back to you with some of our amazing rewards!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! If you cannot contribute monetarily than simply passing the information along is just as helpful!

story:
LOGLINE: When a deadbeat dad thinks he’s killed his daughter’s new pet llama on her 6th birthday, he must spend the afternoon working with his ex-wife's new boyfriend to replace it before she comes home.

Shooting this June, this film will be my greatest undertaking in my time at Tisch. In addition to leading a crew to upstate New York where we will be shooting and lodging on a ranch, we will be working with live animals and a cast and crew of at least 22 people across three locations. I believe with this amount raised, plus our school allotment, this story can reach its full potential and play out beautifully on screen.

Along with this campaign I have started a blog titled Nearly Wrapped to mark the closure of nearly a decade of work but hint towards the years of work that lie ahead of me. I could not have gotten to this point without my parents’ and siblings’ support, and now I’m asking for yours. I will be updating both my campaign and blog weekly with notes, stories, pictures, and videos of my progress, and I hope that people follow.

Thank you for all of those who took the time to read this and thank you in advance to those who offer their continuous support.

Every little bit helps!

What We Need 

The funds I receive for this film will go towards lodging, transportation, the renting of the llamas and their trainer, and food, all of which are integral parts of the making of this film. I'll need about $5300 for lodging (where our crew will stay) and food , $2,200 for the live animal rental (yes, we're using a real llama), $2,500 for transportation.

The Impact

This story is reminiscent of all our experiences as a child and parent or sibling. The time when one birthday can make an impact on your child's perception of you as a parent. So you'd rush to the toy store after work before it closes, wait in a line for two hours to meet their celebrity crush, or bring home that long awaited puppy.  Or the feeling of being in the shadow of a sibling and will go lengths to be recognized and appreciated. Although these moments don't last long, their effect ripples long past adolescence and into adulthood. Those formative years become such a huge part of how we interact with our family and vice a versa. Through this film I revisit my own childhood and I hope by helping me create my vision on screen, you will revisit some of the dramatic and often comedic moments of your own.

The greatest challenge is obvious: how will I obtain these live animals and an onsite trainer. Fortunately I have the support of a crew of producers to help me overcome these challenges. Through the hard work of my producing team we have found a llama and trainer through Animal Actors, that will come on set to work with us.

We've also been given free access to all three of our locations. The final steps are getting our crew out there, with a place to stay, and putting a payment down to secure our llama.

Other Ways You Can Help

One of the best ways to contribute is to spread the word! Please share on Facebook, Twitter, and any other outlet. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo tools! Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Short Summary: 

A struggling, neurotic, desperately-needs-a-therapist screenwriter living with his cougar mother in Brooklyn, David Mars hasn’t written anything worth mentioning in years. To cope with his lackluster, woefully celibate, frustratingly timid lifestyle, he writes an episodic diary; television content reflecting his every day life.

Pitch after pitch, David can’t seem to sell a screenplay. But when an up-and-coming agent gets a hold of his real material, the aforementioned “Life On Mars,” David must reveal his private and humiliating shortcomings with the world, in the form of a television show.


Why We Need The Funds:

Funds for this project will go towards paying for a variety of expenses that include:

Locations

Permits

Food

Transportation

Camera Equipment

Props

Costumes

And more


Risks & Challenges:

Every production has its challenges, but we are so dedicated in this script that we are certain we will overcome every obstacle we are faced with. 

At the University of Miami, we are not given the funds to produce a project. This will be our very first film that we are writing, producing and editing. We have no doubt that we will recruit a great production team that will help make our dream a reality.


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you cannot contribute help us by sharing our page! 


MEET THE CREW: 

JAKE GILLMAN (CO-CREATOR AND WRITER) 

Jake Gillman is a graduating senior at the UNIVERSITY of Miami, with a concentration in Screenwriting. He's had experience working as a hired screenwriter for a former HBO executive, wrote an adaptation screenplay for, "The Things They Left Behind," a Stephen King short story, which is set for production this May, and also co-created Reel Humor YouTube channel, and hosted the Reel Humor Children's Miracle Network Comedy Show last December. He also goes under the alias, "Jew Chainz".


ANDIE ISAACS (CO-CREATER AND EXECUTIVE PRODUCER)

Andie Isaacs is a graduating senior at the University of Miami majoring in Public Relations with a minor in Motion Pictures and Psychology. She got her first production experience working on ABC's new sitcom, Black-ish, in the summer of 2014. This past year, she worked on the new HBO series "Ballers" airing June 21st. She is also a member of Delta Gamma. On the side, she has worked on various short films and has a huge passion for producing.


ALEXA PROSNIEWSKI (EXECUTIVE PRODUCER)

 

Alexa Prosniewski is a graduating senior at the University of Miami, majoring in both Motion Pictures (screenwriting focus), and Art. She's been involved with the local non-profit organization "INDIE FILM CLUB MIAMI" as the team's Outreach Coordinator. She is also a member of Delta Gamma Fraternity. After being approached about involvement with the project, she immediately fell in love with the script and is thrilled to be on board.


BRANDON BAER (DIRECTOR)

Brandon is an LA-based director of both film and theater.  Most recently, his short films “Relative Persuasion” and “Laugh Along the Way” have premiered as official selections of LA Independent Film Festival, LA Reel Film Festival, IndieFest, and Pasadena International Film Festival.  Another short of his, Slice the Musical, spoofs movie-musicals and has been featured on several blogs.  Theatrically, his productions of “Little Shop of Horrors”, “Tick, Tick…Boom!”, “Dirty Rotten Scoundrels”, and “Merrily We Roll Along” have each earned him StageSceneLA Awards for Best Director.  In the fall, Brandon will be directing a production of Amy Herzog’s award-winning play, “4,000 Miles”. 


MASON THIBO (DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY)

Mason is a fourth generation filmmaker whose great grandfather was a sound troubleshooter and inventor of the production sound cart at Fox, grandfather was a 1st assistant cameraman turned operator for Laszlo Kovacs ASC, and whose father currently works as a 1st assistant cameraman for shows and movies including "Glee" and "CSI: CYBER”.  Mason is a graduate of Chapman University with a B.F.A in Film Production with an emphasis in Cinematography. He has worked on scores of professional and amateur sets from no budget youtube films to mega budget motion pictures and television shows such as Christopher Nolan's "Interstellar" and "CSI: New York".


OTHER CREW MEMBERS:

ROB COMBS (PRODUCTION COORDINATOR)

JULIA LEVY (CAMPAIGN MANAGER)

story: As some of you may know, my father has been struggling with health complications for quite awhile. For the most part, he's always been able to cope through the pain and maintain it. However, at the age of 60 he was given a curve ball and was faced with a severe infection that had him hospitalized for over a month. Being the strong man that I know he is, he found the strength and optimism to get through the worst of it and has finally been discharged! He is now getting daily care in the comfort of his home. The thing is, my dad had high hopes of being able to move back to his beautiful hometown in New Brunswick this summer, however, with the recent turn of events.. he might not be able to afford it. For those of you who know me personally, you know that my dad is held as a very high priority to me! He is the strongest man I've ever known and despite being in pain.. he'd always manage to make people laugh! Now, my dad is most definitely not a charity case, in fact he's always found a way to get by on his own and rarely asks for favours. But hey, life happens and unfortunately can make goals a bit more challenging! Any help from you guys would be greatly appreciated from both myself and most definitely my father. It would mean the world to the both of us to get him back home to be with his family and childhood friends. Thanks so much you guys!

story:
What is Wavelength?

Imagine one day you come home to discover that you have been robbed. Everything you own has been stolen...and replaced with exact replicas.

It’s an eerie concept, isn’t it? That, in it’s most simplified form, is the premise of my film “Wavelength”. 

[Wavelength Mood Board]

Wavelength is a short Surreal Horror film about a girl who has just that happen to her. She begins to investigate to find out who would have done this and why, but the deeper she questions the matter, the stranger and more difficult the answers become. Is she losing her mind? Is someone trying to hide something?


As a surreal horror, the film exudes an enigmatic spookiness, forgoing rationality for a focus on building a world, a tone within the film that creates unease and tension. "Wavelength" is a mysterious and ominous world of oppressive power, droning synths, a crackling psychic energy through which a disturbing puzzle is formed in the viewers minds. This is not a typical horror movie. Something is terribly wrong, but like our main character, you are desperately trying to find out what it is.

In a more personal sense, this film is important to me. I've been working on it for over two years now, in an effort to get absolutely everything right. I want this film to take my last film, Blotter, and blow it out of the water in terms of story, cinematics, sound, and overall value. My skills, experience, knowledge, and audience has expanded so vastly that I feel the need to create something that will reflect that. 
I want to make something that will advance me even further, to help get my career as a professional filmmaker going in the most powerful way possible.

Who We Are

My name is Karl H. Weimar and I am the writer/director of Wavelength. You may know me from my last short film I wrote/directed/edited "Blotter: a Film Noir...on Acid!". 
You may know me from my student Emmy-Nominated comedy television/web series "The Grog Show", or any of the award-winning "Grog Movies" videos from our channel.
Or you may not know me at all. Which is fine. Hi! Nice to meet you.
In order to create for you my film, I am collaborating with an excellent and dedicated team of filmmakers and artists including Ryan Geffert, M. Tyler Borbe, Anton Thallner, David Hartman (and many more), some of which I have worked with before, some of which I never have, but always wanted to.


What We Need 

The setting, the atmosphere of this film is largely responsible for conveying the tone, inciting the necessary discomfort and fear. It is important for us to get the "feeling" of a space just right, to the best of our ability in translating this strange world into a visual experience in the truest way possible to the original idea. Without any money, this is just not possible. This is why we need your help!


Your money goes largely towards directly building the "world" of this film: the art direction, the sets, the set dressing, the costumes, props, and special effects etc. 

YOU are directly responsible for our ability to convey the most important visual aspects of this film on screen. 

 FOOD IS IMPORTANT! One of my weak points on my last film was the failing to provide for my cast and crew in a way so as to keep them satisfied and motivated. It's what keeps the production running smoothely, and since many of the dedicated team I am working with are purely doing so out of the passion for creating, the desire to help out, and for the Credit and Experience that comes along with it, the VERY LEAST I can do is feed them. I must feed these people with (of course) the customary film-set pizza and coffee, but also providing healthy options alongside the easy cheap sort of snacks. 

Thankfully, much of the high-end production equipment is taken care of through some miracle of our team's job benefits which contributes to such a low campaign goal/total budget. 
There may also be a need for paying some of our actors, particularly if there is a role that we discover can only be played by a professional who charges for thier services.
Additional expenses go to pre-production costs, transportation, music/media, location fees, additional equipment rental fees (if "free" is not an option in certain cases) , merchandise/merchandise shipping,  crowdfunding fees, post-production costs and distribution.


What You Get

Your donations go towards my greatest creation yet. And of course this contribution cannot go unnoticed, unrewarded. 

Aside from the personal satisfaction you get from helping a team of great artists bring a vision to life, with the help of IndieGogo we have many exciting rewards for your contributions, which range anywhere from copies of the film (both digital and physical formats), to exclusive behind-the scenes/special feature content, to memorabilia and posters, to original concept artwork, to props from the film itself, all the way up to roles in the film and Producer credits!


The Impact

I strongly believe that the landscape of film is changing. In an age of instant access to any film, song, image, or idea imaginable, Hollywood is losing money. Hollywood films are sticking to specific story formats, tried-and true franchises, remakes and reboots to put as much "meat in the seats" as possible, which contributes to a certain lack of originality.

Meanwhile, in the realm of the internet, artists have access to audiences that they never could have before, ways like Indiegogo, kickstarter, seed&spark etc to find funding for their art without having to go to some producer, or compromise the vision in any way. With digital video technology progressing so exponentially and become more and more affordable I believe we can expect a booming Independent New Wave of Film arising from similar conditions not seen since the late 1960's, as well as a de-centralization of the filmmaking world.

In the larger sense, this film is my contribution to this independent new wave. I will participate in it through it's creation, but any artistic movement needs its patrons. You are the patrons, and you can evoke change.

And consider this: if this project goes well, you are assuring that many many more great things will come to you from me, this will help me get my feet on the ground running in a way that I had never had quite such an opportunity to before.

Risks & Challenges

I funded my last project through Kickstarter and had great success, so why did I choose Indiegogo for Wavelength?

Making a movie is risky enough. On the final day of my fixed-funding campaign for "Blotter" I needed only $35 to reach my goal, or I would get nothing. Though I did make out fine in the end, the fear I felt of not reaching my goal was almost too much to handle.

The way I see it, I AM GOING TO MAKE WAVELENGTH NO MATTER WHAT, if I make fifty dollars or if I make fifty thousand dollars, it's going to happen! 

But the more that I make, the clearer and more true the adaptation of my vision becomes. The more that is contributed, the better the final product I give back to you will turn out.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to donate even our $5 minimum contribution, but still want me to be able to make this movie, TOO BAD.

So share it around on social media, direct your friends, family, coworkers and businesses here, surely at least one of them can afford to/want to help out. Help get the word out into the greater collective consciousness.

EDIT: I've discovered that asking people to "share" provides the comfort of having helped, but the evidence shows that this, does not in fact help. You can spare five dollars. I know you can.
story_txt:
What is Wavelength? Imagine one day you come home to discover that you have been robbed. Everything you own has been stolen...and replaced with exact replicas.

It’s an eerie concept, isn’t it? That, in it’s most simplified form, is the premise of my film “Wavelength”. 
[Wavelength Mood Board]
Wavelength is a short Surreal Horror film about a girl who has just that happen to her. She begins to investigate to find out who would have done this and why, but the deeper she questions the matter, the stranger and more difficult the answers become. Is she losing her mind? Is someone trying to hide something?







As a surreal horror, the film exudes an enigmatic spookiness, forgoing rationality for a focus on building a world, a tone within the film that creates unease and tension. "Wavelength" is a mysterious and ominous world of oppressive power, droning synths, a crackling psychic energy through which a disturbing puzzle is formed in the viewers minds. This is not a typical horror movie. Something is terribly wrong, but like our main character, you are desperately trying to find out what it is.
In a more personal sense, this film is important to me. I've been working on it for over two years now, in an effort to get absolutely everything right. I want this film to take my last film, Blotter, and blow it out of the water in terms of story, cinematics, sound, and overall value. My skills, experience, knowledge, and audience has expanded so vastly that I feel the need to create something that will reflect that. I want to make something that will advance me even further, to help get my career as a professional filmmaker going in the most powerful way possible.
Who We Are
My name is Karl H. Weimar and I am the writer/director of Wavelength. You may know me from my last short film I wrote/directed/edited "Blotter: a Film Noir...on Acid!". 
You may know me from my student Emmy-Nominated comedy television/web series "The Grog Show", or any of the award-winning "Grog Movies" videos from our channel.
Or you may not know me at all. Which is fine. Hi! Nice to meet you.
In order to create for you my film, I am collaborating with an excellent and dedicated team of filmmakers and artists including Ryan Geffert, M. Tyler Borbe, Anton Thallner, David Hartman (and many more), some of which I have worked with before, some of which I never have, but always wanted to.



   What We Need  The setting, the atmosphere of this film is largely responsible for conveying the tone, inciting the necessary discomfort and fear. It is important for us to get the "feeling" of a space just right, to the best of our ability in translating this strange world into a visual experience in the truest way possible to the original idea. Without any money, this is just not possible. This is why we need your help!



Your money goes largely towards directly building the "world" of this film: the art direction, the sets, the set dressing, the costumes, props, and special effects etc. 
YOU are directly responsible for our ability to convey the most important visual aspects of this film on screen. 
 FOOD IS IMPORTANT! One of my weak points on my last film was the failing to provide for my cast and crew in a way so as to keep them satisfied and motivated. It's what keeps the production running smoothely, and since many of the dedicated team I am working with are purely doing so out of the passion for creating, the desire to help out, and for the Credit and Experience that comes along with it, the VERY LEAST I can do is feed them. I must feed these people with (of course) the customary film-set pizza and coffee, but also providing healthy options alongside the easy cheap sort of snacks. 
Thankfully, much of the high-end production equipment is taken care of through some miracle of our team's job benefits which contributes to such a low campaign goal/total budget. There may also be a need for paying some of our actors, particularly if there is a role that we discover can only be played by a professional who charges for thier services.Additional expenses go to pre-production costs, transportation, music/media, location fees, additional equipment rental fees (if "free" is not an option in certain cases) , merchandise/merchandise shipping,  crowdfunding fees, post-production costs and distribution.
What You Get
Your donations go towards my greatest creation yet. And of course this contribution cannot go unnoticed, unrewarded. 
Aside from the personal satisfaction you get from helping a team of great artists bring a vision to life, with the help of IndieGogo we have many exciting rewards for your contributions, which range anywhere from copies of the film (both digital and physical formats), to exclusive behind-the scenes/special feature content, to memorabilia and posters, to original concept artwork, to props from the film itself, all the way up to roles in the film and Producer credits!

Hollywood films are sticking to specific story formats, tried-and true franchises, remakes and reboots to put as much "meat in the seats" as possible, which contributes to a certain lack of originality.
Meanwhile, in the realm of the internet, artists have access to audiences that they never could have before, ways like Indiegogo, kickstarter, seed&spark etc to find funding for their art without having to go to some producer, or compromise the vision in any way. With digital video technology progressing so exponentially and become more and more affordable I believe we can expect a booming Independent New Wave of Film arising from similar conditions not seen since the late 1960's, as well as a de-centralization of the filmmaking world.
In the larger sense, this film is my contribution to this independent new wave. I will participate in it through it's creation, but any artistic movement needs its patrons. You are the patrons, and you can evoke change.
And consider this: if this project goes well, you are assuring that many many more great things will come to you from me, this will help me get my feet on the ground running in a way that I had never had quite such an opportunity to before.

Making a movie is risky enough. On the final day of my fixed-funding campaign for "Blotter" I needed only $35 to reach my goal, or I would get nothing. Though I did make out fine in the end, the fear I felt of not reaching my goal was almost too much to handle.

story:
Principal Crew

Brandon G. holds an honours degree in Political Science from the University of Toronto. He is a journalist who has reported from Syria for publications like Adbusters and Anarkismo. He is the producer and second camera operator on this project.

Nadim Fetaih is a documentary filmmaker and editor. His first feature - a Tale of Two Revolutions - dug deep into the Egyptian revolution, it's history, and the inspiration it caused around the globe. This is Nadim's second feature length documentary. He is the director, editor, and camera operator for this project.


Brandon and Nadim are bound to this project by a loyalty to the everyday people all around the world who are rising up and giving everything to change their societies for the better. After meeting within the Occupy movement, they became passionate about the need to record and disseminate the crescendos and tragedies of these historic groundswells of political struggle, particularly around the Mediterranean Sea, in the hopes that this contributes to the success of these struggles.  

Contributors like you will help give the soldiers and citizens of Kobane, some of the most tenacious fighters for freedom in the world, a voice in the West that they otherwise would be denied. This project will employ local media activists and ensure they receive due compensation and credit for their work.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding campaign will complete the production and post-production of this film. Our goal of $50,000 will cover the costs of airline tickets for our principle crew as well as sound operator, translators, and local fixers. Due to the difficulties of reaching the city of Kobane some lighter weight equipment is required on top of the base equipment already in our arsenal. The editing and graphics will, with your support, be done professionally to accentuate the intense personal stories of the people in Kobane, Syria. Finally the remaining funds will be used to promote the film and ensure it is well distributed.

By donating to this project you will be helping spread the word that people in one of the most dangerous and oppressed places on Earth are able to come together and form a liberatory movement that emphasizes freedom, community and liberty. Additionally depending on your donation, you can receive a free digital copy of the film, a dvd of the film, or choose from a selection of photograph prints of life in Kobane embedded in this page amongst others.

If we fall short of the $50,000 the existing funds will pay the airline travel and translation to ensure the film is completed. The rest will come from the personal funding of the crew.

The Impact

Kobane has had about 80% of its infrastructure destroyed and has been largely cutoff from aid and supplies. While struggling to cope with the military and civilian casualties of the war without proper supplies, the June 26 raid by ISIS targetted the hospital complex and several of the precious few doctors and nurses were murdered. Amidst such tribulation, people like Dr. Dorpec continue to build a tight-knit democratic community in an ocean of despotism and bloodshed. 

Showing this diamond in the rough to audiences in the West will bring nuance and compassion to their view of the region and ultimately, we hope, solidarity when it is needed. 

Risks & Challenges

Filming in this region poses deadly risks for the crew. If they are captured by ISIS the best they can hope for is a quick death while the horrific fate of many heroic journalists at the hands of ISIS demonstrates some of the worst case scenarios. Unexploded ordinance also continues to claim lives. 

Reporting and filming in Egypt and Syria has given the crew a critical knowledge base that allows them to stay in the eye of the storm and return home with footage in hand. All thanks is owed to the mutli-ethnic People's Protection Units (YPG) and the Women's Protection Units (YPJ) for protecting civilians and journalists. Additionally, the crew has befriended a network of trusted media activists local to the area that have hosted over 800 foreign journalists during and after the siege without incident.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are hard up for cash but want to help SHARE SHARE SHARE! Post, retweet, and tell people about this film so the word spreads.

story:
What is the Lighthouse?

The Lighthouse has been a beacon of hope for many people living with HIV in Malawi, one of the poorest countries in the world. Since its beginning in 1997, the Lighthouse has been growing through the initiative of the Malawian health personnel and has become one of a few institutions in Malawi that excel in treating HIV and creating awareness, reaching out to even remote places in rural Malawi,  sending medical personnel on motorbikes or in cars to communities.

The view to the Lighthouse main entrance.


Motorbikes at the Lighthouse for Outreach



High demand of the Lighthouse

The Lighthouse provides HIV testing services, treatment for Tuberculosis and community home based care. And the Lighthouse services are high in demand: more than 25.000 people per year come to the Lighthouse to seek help.

The Lighthouse has continued to grow and has made it possible for so many people in Malawi to live with HIV and receive a life-saving antiretroviral therapy.



The Lighthouse needs you!

Through the Lighthouse many people in Malawi have got access to life saving treatment for HIV and good care  - but only with the support of caring people, like you. 

More than 200 patients come to the Lighthouse every day to seek medical help for themselves and their children. Living an active life with HIV has become possible in the recent years. With only a few tablets each day and regular checkups, people can return to their families and communities to lead an active life. Even HIV infected mothers can give birth to children without transmitting HIV to their baby - if young mothers are able to use the services of the Lighthouse. 


Patient checking in at the Lighthouse.

Service at the Lighthouse are in high demand and the Lighthouse recently started to offer screening for cervical cancer for women, as well as it started to offer family planning services - which has been greatly appreciated by the women! However, the Lighthouse runs out of clinic space. 

More room is desperately needed to accommodate these clinical services and to expand the blood drawing area for lab tests to keep services running for all the people seeking treatment at the Lighthouse.


Current blood drawing area.


Family Planning Services at the Lighthouse HIV Clinic


Why are we doing this?

The Friends of the Lighthouse is a registered association in Germany and has been supporting the Lighthouse from the very beginning. Many scientists and medical doctors in Germany are supporting the association already. We have been working on making progress with the Lighthouse and we have already come a long way. You can check out our website at: http://www.lighthouse-freunde.org and the website of the Lighthouse: http://www.mwlighthouse.org/
Join in now and become a part of this!

Medical doctor at the Lighthouse clinic.

Counselling Reception


What We Need & What You Get

The plans are ready for the clinic extension and almost half of the necessary funds are available! So we are on the last stretch to cover the building costs for the new clinic space - only 20.000 US $ remain to be covered until the end of this year to do this. The Lighthouse has proven that it can and does deliver these services. So be the one to give a final push to make this happen!
If we should collect more, we will be able to provide the Lighthouse with necessary medication and medical equipment. We will keep you updated with this campaign, on our Facebook page and via Mail, if you want to.

You can help people how are in dire need of your support - donate now and support the Lighthouse HIV Clinic today so it can continue to offer its services to people in need. Get on board to put an end to the AIDS epidemic!
Learn more about the Lighthouse HIV Clinic: http://www.mwlighthouse.org

Zikomo kwambiri! 
(Chichewa for "Thank you!")
