story:
MEDIA RE-IMAGINED, AND WHY THIS MATTERS:

Almost all Canadian media is owned by large corporations, with their own agendas and interests. Canada lacks a national, independent media forum that can freely tackle our major social, economic, political, and environmental challenges. 

It's time for a change!

That’s why we are creating an independent, not-for-profit, alternative online media platform that focuses on Canadian issues and concerns.

In short, we are creating a new form of online video journalism!

OUR MISSION is to INFORM, EMPOWER and INSPIRE Everyday Canadians. 

WHY DOES THIS MATTER TO YOU?

Our society faces daunting challenges – accelerating poverty; economic inequality and instability; political uncertainty; climate change; environmental devastation; social unrest; technological transformations. Now, more than ever, we need access to innovative solutions. We need to be informed about issues that are important to us. We need to be engaged. But corporate-controlled media dictates the stories that are covered; how issues and options are presented. Mainstream media shapes and controls our worldview, and what we believe is possible.

We are offering an alternative. We want to provide deeper insights into issues that really matter, but are often ignored or only given “top down” media coverage. Our programs will give voice to social innovators, activists, educators, frontline workers, champions of the marginalized and excluded; community entrepreneurs…in other words, those who are knowledgeable, experienced and passionate about finding creative and just solutions. 

WHY DO WE WANT TO DO THIS? So you can have a better understanding of important issues and what is really going on behind the scenes. So you can be inspired to become more actively involved. So you can be empowered to make more informed choices.

HOW WILL WE DO THIS?

Through our informative and engaging videos we will:

- Provide well-researched information on important issues;

- Present alternative perspectives and solutions;

- Showcase innovative leaders, activists and change-makers;

- Stimulate discussion, social activism and community engagement.

We want to give you and your concerns a voice, and

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

With your help, we can create dynamic, informative, thought-provoking, and sometimes humorous videos designed to engage the Canadian public. 

Our programs will spotlight local, regional and national issues and people, and will be broadcast on our website and on social media.

"CANADA 101" SERIES:


"SOCIAL CHANGE-MAKERS" SERIES:


WHO WE ARE:

Our founder and Managing Director, Justin Douglas, LL.B - B.C.L, has been dedicated to human rights, social justice and community development for the past 15 years. 


Here's Justin's Story: 

"I was born in Montréal, raised in BC, have family from the Maritimes, and have lived in Toronto, so I am emotionally connected to the breadth of this country. While putting myself through school I worked with social justice organizations, including one that supports street and at-risk youth. I saw first-hand how police and municipal policies target the poor and homeless. I witnessed how no one was telling these peoples' stories or speaking for them. I wrote a paper about the criminalization of poverty which was published in a respected law journal. But still this topic was not covered by mainstream media.

Later I worked with immigrants and refugees wanting to come to Canada. I witnessed their hardships, made more difficult by the policies of an increasingly unwelcoming system. Few in mainstream media were speaking for these people. I also witnessed how the laws and rights of Aboriginal peoples have been ignored or trampled on. And I began to realize how voiceless and dis-empowered the vast majority of Canadians -- those without corporate ties and financial wealth -- really are. I would like to help change that.

I want to create a medium that gives voice to people and issues generally ignored or only given a mainstream slant. I want to give Canadians and others an opportunity to understand issues and concerns from the perspective of those directly involved. I want to help inform, educate, empower, and inspire -- and hopefully also create greater dialogue and civic engagement."

Justin has created a strong team dedicated to providing Canadians with a new, creative and independent voice.

OUR TEAM OF DEDICATED PROFESSIONALS INCLUDES:

A film producer, director, camera operators, film editors, photographers, interviewers, a historian/researcher, writers, a graphic artist, a web designer, animators, advisers, voice-over artists, and translators.

We made a special page just for the team on our website. You can check it out here. 


OUR PROGRAM FORMAT: 

CANADA 101: This is an animated short-video series that will inform Canadians about important issues in an engaging way.

SOCIAL CHANGE-MAKERS: This is a series of interviews with social, environmental and political activists, educators and innovators.

ROUND TABLE DISCUSSIONS: These are panels of informed Canadians sharing insights on healthcare, education, the environment, and other important concerns.

WHAT THE CANUCK?: These are a series of opinion, humour and public insight videos that both inform and entertain. 

With Your Support, we also want to create in-depth "issue" videos; independent, well-researched documentaries, and much, much more.


WHAT WE’VE ACHIEVED SO FAR:

With our team of volunteer professionals and a shoestring budget, we have created a series of pilot videos that we are launching online and through social media now, prior to the Canadian election on October 19.

These videos include an animated short on the political parties in Canada, and a series of both short and in-depth interviews with key change-makers and innovators. Many of these videos are posted on this page, or in Updates, to give you a better idea of what we're about.

Our upcoming series will range from poverty and homelessness to electoral reform; from social justice organizations to a behind-the-scenes look at Canada's film industry. And we have much more planned!

"SOCIAL CHANGE-MAKERS" SERIES:


WHAT YOUR FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR:

At Just in Canada / Juste au Canada we have the vision, skill and will. 

But we need your help to bring this vision to greater reality. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO:

Set up, launch and develop a fully functioning, not-for-profit media platform.

With up to $50,000 we can: 

Continue to build our audience base and create our next series of interviews, round tables and animated videos (with rented, rather than purchased equipment). Many of these exciting videos are already in the works! 

With $50,000 we can:

Set up an office/studio with purchased computers, filming, lighting, audio, and editing equipment. We will be able to expand our website, create even more animated videos, interviews and round tables, and begin our investigative series.

With $75,000 + we can:

Begin covering regional and national issues and news-makers. And we can start to create in-depth “issue” videos and documentaries.


Other Ways We Plan to be Funded As We Move Forward:

Since we are creating an independent, not-for profit, alternative media platform, we will not sell our programs to corporate networks. Instead, we will rely on the Internet, new forms of social media, and other avenues for our development and expansion.

We intend to collaborate and connect with small social and eco-business enterprises, community organizations, NGOs, and private donors to further fund and maintain full-time production. We will also market our channel to social justice and eco-businesses, as a vehicle for their promotion. Similar efforts will be made to attract alternative-minded investors.

WHY INTERNATIONAL SUPPORT FOR Just in Canada IS IMPORTANT:

We’re Just in but not just about Canada.

Historically, Canada has been a voice of reason on the world stage. Since our planet is more interconnected than ever before, and increasingly dominated by corporate media, independent media voices are more important now than ever.

If we create a successful alternative to establishment media in Canada, our success can be a template to inspire independent, alternative media and video journalism in other countries, including the U.S. This is one of our goals.

You can help make this happen!

HOW YOU CAN BECOME INVOLVED:

IN ADDITION TO YOUR FUNDING SUPPORT, WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SPREAD THE WORD:

Share this campaign with everyone you know who cares about independent media with a social conscience. Or just everyone you know!

Share, post, email, twitter your support! This project is for and about you!

ADD YOUR VOICE:

We need your help to find social, political, environmental, and eco-business innovators, community activists, educators, and alternative news-makers across Canada.

We also need your help in identifying issues and concerns that matter to you, and what you think matters to other Canadians.  

Email us at: info@justincanada.ca

PERKS:

WHAT YOU WILL GET FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS:

Please donate whatever amount you would like. The following are only suggestions, and every gift is appreciated:

$3 + Thank you for supporting independent media! In appreciation for your gift, we will add your name to our supporter wall, in our studio.

$10  Your gift will help us create a different kind of media. To show our appreciation, we will add your name to our supporter wall, in our studio. And we will send you a personal thank you postcard.

$25  Thank you for your gift in support of independent media! In appreciation, we will send you a packet of 5 postcards, a personal thank you post card AND add your picture (optional) as well as your name to our studio supporter wall.

$50  As a thank you for your support, we will give you all the previous perks, plus a fridge magnet with our logo.

$75  In appreciation for this gift, you will receive all the previous perks, plus a packet of 10 postcards.

$100  As a thank you for this gift, you will receive all the above, plus a T-shirt with our logo.

$500  As a thank you for this gift, in addition to all the previous perks, we would like to invite you to join us on set, as we film an interview or round table. Then join us for lunch. (Travel and accommodation are not included.)

$1,000 + In appreciation of this gift, you will receive all the previous perks, PLUS we will provide overnight accommodation for you and a guest after you join us on set in Montréal.

THANK YOU! Thank you for your gifts. Thank you for supporting this vision.
Your support truly makes all the difference!

 

SOME QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS: 

Is my contribution to Just in Canada tax deductible?

We are in process of registering for not-for-profit status, so your contributions are not tax exempt at this time.

What if the campaign goal isn't reached?

On Indiegogo, unlike other campaigns, we get to keep whatever funds we raise.

How will I get my perks? What if I don't want to receive any perks? 

We will be sending a survey at the close of the campaign to ask you for specifics. You are welcome to select any perk below the level you are donating, if you do not want the perk offered at your level of giving. You may also choose not to receive a perk and just donate. Or, if you'd like to donate above any perk amount, just select the perk closest to that amount.
story_txt:
MEDIA RE-IMAGINED, AND WHY THIS MATTERS:Almost all Canadian media is owned by large corporations, with their own agendas and interests. Canada lacks
a national, independent media forum that can freely tackle our major social,
economic, political, and environmental challenges. 
It's time for a change!
That’s
why we are creating an independent, not-for-profit, alternative online media platform that focuses on Canadian issues and concerns.In short, we are creating a new form of online video journalism!OUR MISSION is to INFORM, EMPOWER and INSPIRE Everyday
Canadians. WHY DOES THIS MATTER TO YOU?Our society faces daunting
challenges – accelerating poverty; economic inequality and instability; political
uncertainty; climate change; environmental devastation; social unrest; technological
transformations. Now, more than ever, we need access to innovative solutions. We
need to be informed about issues that are important to us. We need to be
engaged. But corporate-controlled media dictates the stories that are covered; how
issues and options are presented. Mainstream media shapes and controls our
worldview, and what we believe is possible.
We are offering an alternative. We
want to provide deeper insights into issues that really matter, but are often
ignored or only given “top down” media coverage. Our programs will give voice
to social innovators, activists, educators, frontline workers, champions of the
marginalized and excluded; community entrepreneurs…in other words, those who
are knowledgeable, experienced and passionate about finding creative and just solutions. WHY DO WE WANT TO DO THIS? So you can have a better understanding of important issues and what is really going on behind the scenes. So you can be inspired to become more actively involved. So you can be empowered to make more informed choices.HOW WILL WE DO THIS?Through our informative and engaging videos we will:- Provide well-researched information on important issues;- Present alternative perspectives and solutions;- Showcase innovative leaders, activists and change-makers;- Stimulate discussion, social activism and community engagement.We want to give you and your concerns a voice, and

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

With
your help, we can create dynamic, informative, thought-provoking, and sometimes humorous videos designed to engage the Canadian public. 
Our
programs will spotlight local, regional and
national issues and people, and will be broadcast on our website and on social media."CANADA 101" SERIES:"SOCIAL CHANGE-MAKERS" SERIES:WHO WE ARE:
Our founder and Managing Director, Justin Douglas, LL.B - B.C.L, has been dedicated to human rights, social justice and community development for the past 15 years. Here's Justin's Story: "I was born in Montréal, raised in BC, have family from the Maritimes, and have lived in Toronto, so I am emotionally connected to the breadth of this country. While putting myself through school I worked with social justice organizations, including one that supports street and at-risk youth. I saw first-hand how police and municipal policies target the poor and homeless. I witnessed how no one was telling these peoples' stories or speaking for them. I wrote a paper about the criminalization of poverty which was published in a respected law journal. But still this topic was not covered by mainstream media.Later I worked with immigrants and refugees wanting to come to Canada. I witnessed their hardships, made more difficult by the policies of an increasingly unwelcoming system. Few in mainstream media were speaking for these people. I also witnessed how the laws and rights of Aboriginal peoples have been ignored or trampled on. And I began to realize how voiceless and dis-empowered the vast majority of Canadians -- those without corporate ties and financial wealth -- really are. I would like to help change that.I want to create a medium that gives voice to people and issues generally ignored or only given a mainstream slant. I want to give Canadians and others an opportunity to understand issues and concerns from the perspective of those directly involved. I want to help inform, educate, empower, and inspire -- and hopefully also create greater dialogue and civic engagement."Justin has created a strong team dedicated to providing Canadians with a new, creative and independent voice.OUR TEAM OF DEDICATED PROFESSIONALS INCLUDES:A film producer, director, camera operators, film editors, photographers, interviewers, a historian/researcher, writers, a graphic artist, a web designer, animators, advisers, voice-over artists, and translators.We made a special page just for the team on our website. You can check it out here. OUR
PROGRAM FORMAT: CANADA 101: This is an animated
short-video series that will inform Canadians about important issues in an
engaging way. 
SOCIAL CHANGE-MAKERS: This is a series
of interviews with social, environmental and political activists, educators and
innovators.
ROUND TABLE DISCUSSIONS: These
are panels of informed Canadians sharing insights on healthcare, education, the
environment, and other important concerns. 
WHAT THE CANUCK?: These are a
series of opinion, humour and public insight videos that both inform and
entertain. 
With Your Support, we also want to create in-depth "issue" videos; independent, well-researched documentaries, and much, much more.

WHAT
WE’VE ACHIEVED SO FAR:
With our team of volunteer
professionals and a shoestring budget, we have created a
series of pilot videos that we are launching online and through social media now, prior to the
Canadian election on October 19. 
These videos include an animated
short on the political parties in Canada, and a series of both short and in-depth
interviews with key change-makers and innovators. Many of these videos are posted on this page, or in Updates, to give you a better idea of what we're about.
Our upcoming series will range from poverty and homelessness to electoral reform; from social justice organizations to a behind-the-scenes look at Canada's film industry. And we have much more planned!
"SOCIAL CHANGE-MAKERS" SERIES:

WHAT YOUR FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR:
At Just in Canada / Juste au Canada
we have the vision, skill and will. 
But we need your help to bring this vision
to greater reality.  
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO: 
Set up, launch and develop a
fully functioning, not-for-profit media platform. 
With up to $50,000 we can: 
Continue to build our audience base and create our next series of interviews, round tables and animated videos (with rented, rather than purchased equipment). Many of these exciting videos are already in the works! 
With $50,000 we can:
Set up an office/studio with purchased computers,
filming, lighting, audio, and editing equipment. We will be able to expand our website, create even more animated videos, interviews and round tables, and begin our investigative series. 
With $75,000 + we can:
Begin covering regional and
national issues and news-makers. And we can start to create in-depth
“issue” videos and documentaries.



Other Ways We Plan to be Funded As We Move Forward:
Since we are creating an
independent, not-for profit, alternative media platform, we will not sell our
programs to corporate networks. Instead, we will rely on the Internet, new
forms of social media, and other avenues for our development and expansion. 
We intend to collaborate and connect with small social
and eco-business enterprises, community organizations, NGOs, and private donors
to further fund and maintain full-time production. We will also market our
channel to social justice and eco-businesses, as a vehicle for their promotion. Similar efforts will be made to attract alternative-minded investors.

WHY INTERNATIONAL SUPPORT FOR Just in Canada IS IMPORTANT:
We’re Just in but not just about Canada.
Historically, Canada has been a voice of reason on the world stage. Since our planet is more interconnected than ever before, and increasingly dominated by corporate media, independent media voices are more important now than ever.
If we create a successful alternative to establishment media in Canada, our success can be a template to inspire independent, alternative media and video journalism in other countries, including the U.S. This is one of our goals.
You can help make this happen!
HOW YOU CAN BECOME INVOLVED:
IN ADDITION TO YOUR FUNDING SUPPORT, WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SPREAD
THE WORD:
Share this campaign
with everyone you know who cares about independent media with a social
conscience. Or just everyone you know!
Share, post, email, twitter your
support! This project is for and about you!


ADD YOUR VOICE:

political, environmental, and eco-business innovators, community activists,
educators, and alternative news-makers across Canada.
We also need your help in identifying issues and concerns that matter to you, and what you
think matters to other Canadians.  
Email us at: info@justincanada.ca
PERKS:

Please donate whatever amount you would like. The following are only suggestions, and every gift is appreciated:

$10  Your gift will help us create

THANK YOU! Thank you for your gifts. Thank you for supporting this vision.Your support truly makes all the difference!

Just in Canada tax deductible?
We are in process of
registering for not-for-profit status, so your contributions are not tax

story:
About the show:

The Indigo Show web-series is a fictional television talk show set in a future world reality. Transmitted to present day viewers through an unknown hacked satellite, the show is hosted by Indigo and her co-host puppet plant Stem. 

In a future reality where plants, animals and humans have evolved with the capability of communicating with each other, the show involves themes of inclusivity, performance, emotional transparency, imperfection, education, and identity. The first season will primarily focus on the new relationships between nature and humans while retelling history through comedic satirical sketches and advertisements. Many of the guests featured on the show are from various decades in popular history, visiting the set by way of a time machine. 

Angela Davis, Sacajawea, The Boogey Man, and Coopernicus are some characters featured for the upcoming season. Characters and advertisements are in collaboration with people, services, groups, and businesses in the NYC community. Those looking to participate can contact the show via our Email, Facebook and Instagram. 

What We Need:

The Set:

The show will require significant set design, including props such as a simulated time machine portal for our time traveling guests and skits. Additionally, much of the show is done using self-designed backdrops as well as a green screen for still and moving images.

Puppets & Costumes:

Constructed by fashion designer Sarah Lawrence of Grave X SL, puppet and wardrobe design for visiting decade-specific characters is a big part of the performance. 

Graphics and Animation:

Each episode plays with animation and graphic design in a different way. To make our world really come alive we've incorporated the special help of graphic designer Emalis Robateau. 

Performance:

Each episode will conclude with a performance from varying talents, we want to make sure we can provide any additional props or set alterations to accommodate different performance mediums.

Getting It Online:

The majority of the editing process will require the assistance of a Special Effects editor. Our show is prop and costume heavy creating a completely surreal experience for our viewers, and it's going to mean lots of help from many hands.

Rainy Days:

We will also have funds aside for any production emergencies such as equipment rentals, studio space reservations, transportation, and maintenance. 

Production:

Season 1 will be comprised of four episodes and a special Finale, that will air by January 2016. Production for the first season will begin early November 2015. 

During the months of November and December production will take place every other week. With that, the set props and simulated time machine will be designed and built, costumes for characters will be created by the episode and additional puppets will be added to the show. 

Editing will primarily take place weeks not dedicated to production, in order to release Season 1 online at once by January 2016.

Things to Consider...

In order to create our ideal future world, The Indigo Show TV will require significant set design, special effects, puppet repair and a reliable studio space for filming. Additionally we intend to cover all bases by creating an emergency fund for standard production challenges such as transportation, equipment rentals, and any issues brought up by inclement weather or alternative studio space.

story:
Short Summary

I am Majid Panahi an Iranian filmmaker  based on Turkey and Iraq.
During last year I've eye witness of living in war situation at once in one day.
I met lots of Iraqi and Syrian civilians in refugee camps both in Iraq and Turkey.
They just less than an hour to leave their childhood home and friends before fatal attacks of ISIS. So I saw how you can be convert from a normal civilian to a warrior or a refugee less than an hour.
My story is about Rafe a family man who becomes a sniper. He lost his family, his wife and son. But decide to stay at home and fight. NINEVEH'S SNIPER is about his 
Daily life, Dreams and nightmares in that situation.


What We Need & What You Get

The fund will spent  for :
- equipment rentals ( camera, grip,light, sound recording equipment)
- accommodation and travel costs for crew team ( 4persons) from Turkey Istanbul to Iraq ( Erbil) 
- food at set
- fixer 
- post production ( editing, VFX)

The Impact

Side effects of war is the most unseen part of wars, it is always covered under shadow of breaking news. It seems we forget war disaster very soon. NINEVEH'S SNIPER invites everyone to live for 10 mins in hell with Rafe a dentist, a family man who becomes a sniper. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share our project on your social network page and make others involved.

story:
A Film by 

Zeinab Tabrizy & Paliz khoshdel

                                                                     Synopsis
Mutiny Of Colours tells the story of day to day life and especially the art-life of five Iranian street artists in 4 episodes. Documentary is based on showing known Iranian artists' point of view, artworks and Idealism and the fact all the message they want to spread is about peace, love, children and women rights. These Iranian artists are risking their freedom while working on their projects and they are facing a continuous struggle with the police.

All film characters, they were willing to talk to the camera, only with their masks on their faces. The purpose of wearing masks is because they would not be recognized by security and intelligence service of Iran, as the artists are always at risk of being arrested and imprisoned. throughout the film, the Iranian police and security services are aiming to arrest and imprison artists of this film ...



In 2012, we began our researches on street art. We tried to contact some Iranian street artists whose identities were unknown and gradually we found out that this form of art presents many dangers for the artists involved. Because of high censorship on freedom of expression and art, street artists know that street art is the only way to express their believes. As they don’t need government’s permission to their art on walls. The government has got this art wrong and considers it as promoting satanism and slogans against the government and imprisons the street artists or even death penalty for satanism is waiting for the artists. So we took a serious decision to make this film. by making this film we want to change the look of street art and pave the way for street artists.

First thing will be to sign an international distribution contract so the film will have worldwide screenings. It is also important to us to have lots of screenings in U.S.A .

Duration: 70 Minutes 
Release Date: December 2016

Directors: Zeinab Tabrizy & Paliz Khoshdel 
Directors of Photography: Paliz Khoshdel & Mahan Khomamipor 
Editors: Paliz Khoshdel & Zeinab Tabrizy 
Music: Ashkan Faramarzy 
Sound: Mohammad Moussavi 
Poster: Artwork by Icy & Sot 
Photographer: Zeinab Tabrizy 
Associated Producer: Syros Pourlatifi 
Producer: Paliz Khoshdel 


 
Zeinab Tabrizy & Paliz Khoshdel
                 Previous Film 
             STREET SULTANS


The first film in collaboration of Zeinab Tabrizy and Paliz Khoshdel is a semi-long documentary called "STREET SULTANS". This 38-minute documentary tells the story of Iranian young men and women who founded "parkour" in Iran. After putting their lives into parkour more than 6 years they are still facing lot’s of problems with their families, society and the traditional culture of Iran which considers parkour an absolute waste. Even after canceling their Festival by the force of Police, they’re still fighting with the hard situation and willing to submit parkour as a global sport in Iran.

International Awards and Screenings:

- Won “Best Film” award at six weeks of Iranian art, Canadian film festival 2012. 
- Won “Certificate of achievement” at Canada’s 2nd Iranian film.
- Film screening at Docunight in Canada & United States 2015. 
- Film screening at Graffik Gallery , Iranian urban art exhibition, London 2015.
- Film screening at DHFEST film festival in Mexico city, Mexico 2014.
- Film screening at Cinéma(s) D'Iran Paris 2014. 
- Film screening at UCLA celebration of Iranian cinema, U.S.A 2013. 
- Participated at Media wave film festival, Hungary 2013.
- Film screening at Online women filmmakers (of Iran) Uppsala film festival, Sweden 2012.

Festival 2010. National Awards: 

It earned All major Iranian documentary film festival awards in 2010 and 2011. Including : 

- Won “Special award for the best film” from Iranian critics and writers association, 2010 
- Won “Best semi-long film” award from Independent “Image of the year” festival, 2010 
- Won “Best director” award in semi-long documentary section at “ International Iranian urban film festival, 2011 
- Won “Best semi-long documentary film” award from “Iranian cinema ceremony“ at Iranian house of cinema 2011.

Risks and challenges

This documentary film is a result of three years of research and shooting videos about culture incidents in Iran. 
We took all the necessary steps to make this film respectable and appealing to the audience even if we know that after we will finish this project our freedom is threatened. With all the risks we do strongly believe that a change is possible in the anti-cultural perspective of the government and the younger generation of Iran will benefit from it as well the Iranian street art. 
Unfortunately, three subjects of this documentary film have had emigrated from Iran and we do not have access to their art anymore. These street artists left Iran forever, because of many problems that they faced in their work and due to fear of arrest and imprisonment. Now we have a heavy burden on our shoulders feeling obligated to change the government’s look at the art. Unfortunately, due to financial problems, this project still has not come to fruition. we are responsible to prevent other artists to be forced to escape from Iran and by finishing this documentary film we hope to reduce the liability and this is possible only with your great help and support.


                                          Official Poster Artwork by ICY & SOT                

                                            Stickers Designed by LADY GREEN

                                                      URBAN FILM PACKAGE

On Underground is semi-long documentary about break dance in Islamic republic of Iran .
  Directed By Mahan Khomamipor
   Produced by Paliz Khoshdel 

                                      DVD Package (Design Is Not Completed)

"Dancer Woman" Size 28x22 inches , Original Artwork On Canvas by CK1 , Signed - Limited (4 left of 4)

"Peace and Friendship" Size 12x12 inches , Original Artwork on Vinyl by CK1 - Limited (6 left of 6)

"Marilyn Monroe" Size 24 H x 18 W x 1 in ,Print Artwork by CK1 - Limited (5 left of 5)


"Lost" Series Expectance Mixed Media On Fabric, Size 42x29.7 cm Artwork by Shaghayegh Cyrous , Signed & Numbered by the Artist - Limited (31 left of 31)

Persian Calligraffiti , Size 42x29.7 cm ,Printed Artwork by Ghalamdar , Signed & Numbered - Limited (35 left of 35)

                                                                        T-shirt

Directors: Zeinab Tabrizy & Paliz Khoshdel Directors of Photography: Paliz Khoshdel & Mahan Khomamipor Editors: Paliz Khoshdel & Zeinab Tabrizy Music: Ashkan Faramarzy Sound: Mohammad Moussavi Poster: Artwork by Icy & Sot Photographer: Zeinab Tabrizy Associated Producer: Syros Pourlatifi Producer: Paliz Khoshdel 



 Zeinab Tabrizy & Paliz Khoshdel                 Previous Film              STREET SULTANS
The first film in collaboration of Zeinab Tabrizy and Paliz Khoshdel is a semi-long documentary called "STREET SULTANS". This 38-minute documentary tells the story of Iranian young men and women who founded "parkour" in Iran. After putting their lives into parkour more than 6 years they are still facing lot’s of problems with their families, society and the traditional culture of Iran which considers parkour an absolute waste. Even after canceling their Festival by the force of Police, they’re still fighting with the hard situation and willing to submit parkour as a global sport in Iran.
International Awards and Screenings:- Won “Best Film” award at six weeks of Iranian art, Canadian film festival 2012. - Won “Certificate of achievement” at Canada’s 2nd Iranian film.- Film screening at Docunight in Canada & United States 2015. - Film screening at Graffik Gallery , Iranian urban art exhibition, London 2015.- Film screening at DHFEST film festival in Mexico city, Mexico 2014.- Film screening at Cinéma(s) D'Iran Paris 2014. - Film screening at UCLA celebration of Iranian cinema, U.S.A 2013. - Participated at Media wave film festival, Hungary 2013.- Film screening at Online women filmmakers (of Iran) Uppsala film festival, Sweden 2012.
Festival 2010. National Awards: It earned All major Iranian documentary film festival awards in 2010 and 2011. Including : - Won “Special award for the best film” from Iranian critics and writers association, 2010 - Won “Best semi-long film” award from Independent “Image of the year” festival, 2010 - Won “Best director” award in semi-long documentary section at “ International Iranian urban film festival, 2011 - Won “Best semi-long documentary film” award from “Iranian cinema ceremony“ at Iranian house of cinema 2011.


Risks and challenges
This documentary film is a result of three years of research and shooting videos about culture incidents in Iran. We took all the necessary steps to make this film respectable and appealing to the audience even if we know that after we will finish this project our freedom is threatened. With all the risks we do strongly believe that a change is possible in the anti-cultural perspective of the government and the younger generation of Iran will benefit from it as well the Iranian street art. Unfortunately, three subjects of this documentary film have had emigrated from Iran and we do not have access to their art anymore. These street artists left Iran forever, because of many problems that they faced in their work and due to fear of arrest and imprisonment. Now we have a heavy burden on our shoulders feeling obligated to change the government’s look at the art. Unfortunately, due to financial problems, this project still has not come to fruition. we are responsible to prevent other artists to be forced to escape from Iran and by finishing this documentary film we hope to reduce the liability and this is possible only with your great help and support.


                                          Official Poster Artwork by ICY & SOT                
                                            Stickers Designed by LADY GREEN

                                                      URBAN FILM PACKAGE




On Underground is semi-long documentary about break dance in Islamic republic of Iran .  Directed By Mahan Khomamipor   Produced by Paliz Khoshdel 


                                      DVD Package (Design Is Not Completed)

"Dancer Woman" Size 28x22 inches , Original Artwork On Canvas by CK1 , Signed - Limited (4 left of 4)

"Peace and Friendship" Size 12x12 inches , Original Artwork on Vinyl by CK1 - Limited (6 left of 6)


"Marilyn Monroe" Size 24 H x 18 W x 1 in ,Print Artwork by CK1 - Limited (5 left of 5)

"Lost" Series Expectance Mixed Media On Fabric, Size 42x29.7 cm Artwork by Shaghayegh Cyrous , Signed & Numbered by the Artist - Limited (31 left of 31)

Persian Calligraffiti , Size 42x29.7 cm ,Printed Artwork by Ghalamdar , Signed & Numbered - Limited (35 left of 35)

story:
Fund the Foundation of Islam in the West Indies

In the name of Allah Subhaana Wa Ta'aala, most benevolent, most magnanimous, most exalted.

As-salamu alaykum my dear brothers and sisters,

Islam has been in Saint Lucia since the ‘90s and has been growing at quite a rapid pace. We've been struggling to make ends within our current facility. The location cannot properly hold our congregation as most members have to sit outside during Jummah prayers. The heat outside can be so intense that one of our brothers actually suffered a near-heat stroke waiting to listen to the Khutbah outside.

Not Just About Faith, but About Giving Back and Sheltering

We conduct blood drives and food drive runs monthly under the guidance of the local medical schools. We also serve as a local soup kitchen for those homeless who walk the main street and all those who are in need of food or shelter. Our facility not only caters to Muslims but to all those that are in need of aid. It provides a shelter for all those in need of it. In order to compensate for the growing local population becoming more aware of Islam, we need to upgrade our food storage and kitchen areas. At present, we only have a single faucet, no bathroom, no air conditioning, broken ceiling tiles, no proper divider between the sexes, and no windows in the current musallah facility and, Inshallah, are looking to build these areas in the creation of the new mosque.


Condition of Current Facility (Click for Album)

There Is Reward In All That Is Good 

"The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed of grain which grows seven spikes; in each spike is a hundred grains. And Allah multiplies his reward for whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing." 2:261

The Rapid Spread of Islam in the Caribbean

The Saint Lucian community is a tight-knit one and the brothers and sisters here find love and unity through Islam, whether it be by helping their fellow locals through organized blood drives directed by the local medical schools or opening their doors for anyone to come in and enjoy a tasty meal. Our musallah is a place open to all, and provides assistance and guidance to many. We love one another and we hope that love can extend even further with your assistance. 

We have 3–5 new converts every month in Saint Lucia, and when you compare that to the entire population of 170,000 people, that's a whole lot of people finding light in Islam. As such, we can't contain the new members of the congregation within such a small facility. According to Prof. Ilyas Ba Yunus, 75 percent of converts to Islam convert back to their original faiths after a period of time.This tends to be due to lack of support from the community around them and the hardships of properly adapting. With a more established Masjid and full-time Imam, we can ease the transitions for the many converts who come within our halls.

  • Examples of such reversions taking place within the musallah:


Growing Numbers; Growing Thirst of Knowledge

The brothers and sisters here have reverted with the help of sources such as visiting Imams, senior members of the congregation, and Muslims from the American medical schools located here. The people of our congregation need a real learned Hafiz and Imam - an educator of Islam - to inform them of what is right and what is wrong according to proper fiqh and schooling.

With your assistance,we can guide and ease these people into the correct path of Islam and the appropriate way to live up to the Prophet's Sunnah. The hiring of an Imam is a much needed task to be accomplished, and the ilm/knowledge he will provide will help our congregation grow that much wiser, stronger, and unified. Some of the members of the congregation lack the proper vocalization of the Qur'an and will improperly recite it, skewering and misinterpreting the language of the Holy Book. With the assistance of an Imam we can host legitimate Arabic classes as well, which would allow for proper clarity. A large majority of our congregation is eager to see these classes come to actualization. With your funding, we can make these aspirations a reality.

The youth of the island also tend to partake in more reckless activities as the drug scene is rather widespread throughout the island. Establishing a Sunday School and a place where youth can gather would be a great way to avert them from dangerous behaviors. With the current musallah, this cannot happen, as the current location is farther away from the local schools and the max capacity for the building is quite small. The lack of air conditioning and the dirtiness of the area is unappealing to the youth here as well.

The Breakdown

The proposed property is in the city center just off the main street and it's visible and accessible to all along the main road. (It’s centrally located, next to the post office.) Its location is within walking distance for all local Muslims, young and old, in the southern part of the island and will make it easy to establish five times Salat on a daily basis. The protection and well being it will provide will be priceless. The new layout will provide a proper wudu station, an area for the women of our congregation, a bathroom for both sexes, a proper kitchen, proper storage, a larger prayer area, a platform for the imam, proper bookshelves, a fixed ceiling, more than one door for entry/exit, and an overall more homey environment.

Pledge, Share, Watch, Look

  • Pledge your support to help bring Islam to the Caribbean
  • Help raise awareness of the cause. Be a voice of change.
  • Watch the progress start to show
  • View the updated images of the construction of the mosque and the finished result that you helped bring about.

story:
Short Summary (that isn't so short...)

My name is Tom Johnson and as a part of my NCS social action project, I need to raise money for my team's chosen charity. The charity my group decided on was 'Visyon'. Visyon is a charity passionately committed to supporting children and young people’s emotional health and well-being. They provide a range of services to enable them to live happier, more fulfilling lives, to build stronger relationships and to be able to cope with life’s stresses. We decided on this charity because it touches our local community and we know it can affect anyone of us. I am contributing to my team by swimming 200 lengths within the time limit of 2 hours at the Jubilee 2 Swimming Center in Newcastle. I am asking your sponsorship to help support my charity. With the money we shall give so many people who are affected by this charity a much better quality of life. There aims are to preserve and protect a good health and in particular good mental health of young people, children and adults.

What We Need & What You Get

As this is a charity raised event, you won't really be getting anything back from this, but hopefully you will still donate. 

We hope to reach at least 50% of our target, as this will have a huge impact into our charity. 

The Impact

Our charity is in dire need of assistance and money from all kinds, so this is why we have chosen it. The impact it will have on our charity is that it will pay for more supplies, workers and counselling sessions for people in need. 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, there are some risks, i could hit my head and drown or i could just get tired and give up, but non of that is going to happen! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please, please send this page to as many people as possible. Or, if you wanted, you can even come down to the swimming pool and support me.

story:
Hello Indiegogos!

We are José André Sibaja and Ibai Vigil-Escalera, two independent filmmakers, that have been collaborating to make short films. 



Moving to New York and the love for the film brought us together. We found ourselves in a city full of immigrants through an eclectic mixture of cultures. People looking for new beginnings, and in a lot of cases, escaping from countries oppressed by their governments, society or religion. We were curious to find that most of us experienced this in so many ways, no matter where we came from. After hearing others story’s we had the urge to write Legacy. 

Legacy is a short film that speaks about New Babylon, a country oppressed under the dictatorship of Saduj Dormin, who is on the verge of death and fears losing power. In her years of leadership, she battled the sin of greed in human beings, and condemned the country to ruin.


Legacy is a coral piece driven only by female characters. We intend to portrayed how the women from New Babylon survive in times of misery.




We are going for a Surrealist Atmosphere, with the goal of creating a dark and deteriorated world, where its occupants live in hostility and agony. Animal instinct rules in this extreme environment. 

We found inspiration in German Expressionism to create a theatrical film shot in black and white. It references films such as The Cabinet of the Dr. Caligari (1919) The Holy Mountain (1973), The Cook, the Thief, his Wife and her Lover (1989), Titus (1999) and Dogville (2003).

 

    


Director, José André Sibaja. San Jose, Costa Rica. 1992.

As early as I can remember, I have been artistically aroused by decadent women in comics, films, books, and life. They were survivors, characters that no matter their origin felt alone in the world. Nowadays, as a filmmaker, I’m constantly trying to tell stories that portrays characters who suffer from the dark path of marginalization and ostracism. I have learned to admire their survival capabilities in a world that rejects them.

Director Photography, Ibai Vigil-Escalera. Zarautz, Spain. 1988. 

I first came into contact with photography as everyone does... childhood family albums. Moments frozen in time, of who we were, where we have been, those lost and those gained, which if it weren’t for photography, would be lost entirely to the inevitable decay of our memories. I view photography as documentation of the human condition. 



To make this film happen we would need $ 15,000! We would cover production expenses such as Set construction, since we intend to build every set from scratch to create a dreamlike world. 
If you can't economically help us, its not the end of the world! You can share our project to all your friends, and their friends! And if you are in New York, you can always join the adventure! 

   


$5 - You get our infinite gratitude! 

$10 - Our National Department of telecommunication will send you a private link so you can enjoy LEGACY at home!

$ 15 - This gets better and better, not only would you watch the film, you would also see your name at the credits! 

$30 - You will also enjoy of all the behind the scenes and promotional art work in an amazing PDF album! so you can check it out after you watch the film and show it to your neighbors. 

$50 - At this point, you deserve more than watch the film and the behind the scenes! You'll get a PDF with the complete Story Board! 

$80 At this point, you deserve to be part of our adventure! We would bring you to our set and you'll become part of the revolution! - Only for New Yorkers.

$100 You will own original Concept Art from the film! Seven collectible pieces Framed and ready to hang in your living room! Including, Private link to the short, pdf album, pdf storyboard and your name on the credit.

$250 - We need to meet you! You'll have a special home made dinner with crew and some cast members! 

$350 -We are so thankful that the director of the film will make you a portrait! in Ink! or acrylic! ... if your Paypal get delayed, maybe just pencil, but the mr Sibaja will immortalize you! 

$400- We need to keep your face forever in our hearts! so, we would give you a photoshoot! *only if you are in New York

$450 - We don't know how to thank you! that's why we are giving you SADUJ DORMIN's original wig! Yes, what you're reading! you will own the Dictator's hair!

$500- We really need to keep your face forever in our hearts! But this time, we will give you an extreme fantasy makeover! We will work in the look and you'll rock a personalized photoshoot! 

$700- You deserve to be one of our characters, so we would give you the entire wardrobe of one of our characters: The Colonel, Patria the Revolutionary or Gioconda! 

$1100 -  This is major! You will own Zelda's original costume for the film! made out of New Babylon's gold! 

$1,500 - It's time you rule your own country! And in order to do this, you must have Saduj Dormin's original costume from the film! 


If the project doesn't reach it's funding goal, do I get my money back?

We're doing a Flexible Campaign, so even if we fall short of our goal, we will nonetheless put whatever we raise towards to create LEGACY and you will get your perks. 

When will the perks be delivered?

Each perk has it's rough delivery month listed and we'll do our utmost to get them to you right away. 

Why do you need my shipping address if my perk isn't a shippable item?

From time to time we intend to mail out exclusive updates to our supporters.

Do the T-Shirts come in multiple sizes?

Yes. If you snag a T-shirt perk, we'll be sure to contact you to ascertain your t-shirt size.

I put the wrong e-mail address on Indiegogo and I'm afraid I won't receive my perk. How do I fix that?

Have no fear! Please send an email to LegacyFilm@gmail.com and we will update your new e-mail address manually to our database.

How do I update my shipping address?

Send your new address to legacyshortfilm@gmail.com and we will update our files accordingly. 

How will the funders be kept informed during and after the campaign?

We will be frequently updating our Indiegogo page!  Also look out for updates in your inbox from Indiegogo.

story:
We are seven walkers - starting in Norway House, Manitoba, we are walking to Prince Rupert, B.C. In honour of our lost relatives.

We left Norway House on July 18, 2015, and we hope to reach Prince Rupert, B.C. by September 5, a total distance of about 2,800 km.

There are more than 1,000 murdered and missing Indigenous women in Canada, but many of us have lost sisters, daughters, mothers, brothers, fathers and sons.

We are marching to promote awareness and as a call out to the government - that we need positive changes to all levels and systems of government.

You can read our story in the news here:

'You still hurt every day': Families walk for missing, murdered loved ones

Hope for change spurs walkers honouring missing and murdered

Walk to honour the missing and murdered makes stop in Edmonton

We have been warmly welcomed wherever we have gone as we travel across Manitoba, Saskatchewan and Alberta, with food, shelter, and fundraisers and fellow walkers.

Every day we have eight people two meals, water, Gatorade, snacks for the road, gas for two vehicles, 3 hotel rooms. We are hoping for donations to help pay for this.

We have also been wearing out our shoes and socks from walking, and now that we have reached the mountains, it is much cooler.

We are looking to get high-visibility weatherproof outerwear and maybe a fleece or two to stay warm.

The Missing and Murdered deserve to be remembered and honoured, and their families deserve peace and justice.

Every donation you make will be a real step on the journey to achieving our goal.

We are keeping the donation period short so that we can get the funds in time.

You can also donate via direct transfer to ohmyguiboche@gmail.com

We left Norway House, MB on July 18th 2015, and stopped in Cross Lake, Ponton, Grand Rapids, Fairford, Lundar, then stopped in Winnipeg. From there this our route:  

1. Winnipeg to Portage LaPrairie

2. Portage Laprairie to Neepawa

 3. Neepawa to Russell, Man

4. Russell to Yorkton, SK

5. Yorkton to Wynyard

6. Wynyard to Saskatoon

7. Saskatoon to North Battleford

8. North Battleford to Lloydminster

9. Lloydminster to Vegreville

 10. Vegreville to Edmonton

 11. Edmonton to Evansburg

 12. Evansburg to Edson

13. Edison to Hinton

14. Hinton to Jasper

 15. Jasper to Mount Robson Park

 16. Mount Robson Park to Valemont

 17. Valemont to Blue River

18. Blue River to Clearwater

 19.  Clearwater to Barriere

 20. Barrier to Kamloops

 21. Kamloops to Cache Creek

22. Cache Creek to 100 Mile House

 23. 100 Mile house to Williams Lake

24. Williams Lake to Quesnel

 25. Quesnel to Prince George

26. Prince George to Vanderhoof

 27. Vanderhoof to Stelako (Fraser Lake)

 28. Stelako to Burns Lake

 29. Burns Lake to Houston

 30. Houston to Smithers

 31. Smithers to Moricetown

 32. Moricetown to Kitwanga

33. Kitwanga to Terrace

 34. Terrace to Prince Rupert

Miigwetch. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

 SAFE is a suspense thriller that follows a young couple who move to a new town, only to find that not only can't they run from their troubles, but a whole new set of demons awaits them in their new home.  



The film follows a young married couple, Norah and Zeke Mayfield, who are struggling to have a baby after being victimized in their hometown. Seeking to get a fresh start, they move across the country into a quiet, suburban neighborhood where Norah instantly falls in love with their new home. But shortly after they move into the house, red flags begin popping up. 

Zeke discovers a locked drawer in the garage. When he goes through the house keys to unlock it, he realizes that every key he tries is the exact same key; the key to the front door. All of the other keys to their house are unaccounted for. Then their slightly creepy and way too forthcoming neighbor Dan, tells the couple that the previous owner packed up her kids and fled the home in the middle of the night without warning. But he says, "Other than that, nothing exciting goes on." 

Norah remains committed to settling in and establishing a sense of security. She claims there's nothing unusual about the keys or the former owner. Unfortunately, Norah soon finds out she can't escape her unconscious mind and starts to question if the sounds she's heard while alone in the house; footsteps on the gravel, a key unlocking the side entrance door, are real or just paranoia. Norah's situation escalates when she receives an unnerving phone call from a detective in her hometown. The fear she was running away from, grips ahold of her once more. Not wanting to alarm Zeke at work, she calls her sister Sara, who flies out to stay with the couple for a few days. 

What Norah, Zeke and Sara don't know is they are about to be in the greatest fight of their life when a terrifying intruder knocks on the front door. 


ABOUT REEL ARTISTS COLLECTIVE

We are a group of passionate, industry professionals who want to change the way people watch movies. Our goal is to create amazing movies through inspired artistic collaboration, outside the Hollywood studio system, that can be distributed globally online. 

Our suspenseful, thriller "Safe", featuring celebrity Alison Arngrim (Little House on the Prairie), is the start of that dream.

Going outside the studio system has risks and rewards. By helping to fund this project, you are allowing creative filmmaking and new media distribution to be the main focus of this movie, NOT a studio's bottom line. 

Imagine this, you pick up your cell phone and find our film in the palm of your hand, anywhere with an internet connection. And what's even more cool is that when the end credits roll around, as a funder, you will SEE YOUR NAME scroll on the screen!

 As technology advances, so does movie making and movie watching. Help us create the new media entertainment revolution.


What We Need & What You Get


Incredible advances in film technology have made making a great looking movie easier than ever before but in order to make a high quality, independent film we still need to cover some remaining production expenses. We have a goal of $20,000 which will go towards paying our professional film crew such as our director of photography to give our film a unique and captivating style, a professional sound person so you don't miss a word or scary sound, to help cover the costs of our amazing talent, as well as insurance, equipment, and rentals. A prop knife that looks amazing on film doesn't come cheap and we want to give you the most suspenseful, intense and entertaining movie possible.

Thankfully the good folks at Indiegogo have made funding a movie, fun. Check out some  of our very cool perks like a visit to the set, digital downloads of the movie, autographed memorabilia and much more! 

Plus, we are giving everyone who funds this movie regardless of level, a special thanks in the closing section of the film's credits because without you, there would be no movies.



Risks & Challenges 

Making a movie really does take a village. There are contracts to negotiate, various personalities to contend with, permits to be gotten, never enough bathrooms and only so much daylight to get the perfect shot.

We at Reel Artists Collective, pride ourselves on being an artists collective. We believe we are better together than apart. A group of professionals with a wide range of experience in entertainment from film to stage, from directing to producing, from writing to acting and all the way to the opposite end of the spectrum; the corporate side of business.  The collective atmosphere allows one partner's weakness to be overcome by another partner's strength. Together, we believe we can overcome any challenge this production might throw at us.


Who's Who





Alison Arngrim (cast) is an actress, comedian and author. Beginning her television career at the age of twelve, Arngrim is a Young Artist Award–Former Child Star "Lifetime Achievement" Award honoree, best known for her portrayal of Nellie Oleson on the NBC television series "Little House on the Prairie" from 1974 to 1981. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0036274/


 Stage and screen actress / singer Robin De Lano has been added to the cast in the role of Sara.  A veteran musical theatre actress and recording artist, Ms. De Lano has also been seen on television on shows such as "Passions" and "Journeyman" as well as in a number of independent feature films. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1220565/ .  NEW ANNOUNCEMENT !!!  (6/14/2015) Check out Director Michael Lopez' candid interview with Robin about Safe, 



NEW ANNOUNCEMENT !!! (6/5/2015) Bear Badeaux has joined the cast.  Bear Badeaux is an improv veteran working at Groundlings, IOWEST, ACME, LA Connection, and more. His team Drunkards & Dragons currently performs at Second City and IOWest. Bear recently worked on an upcoming National Commercial as well as the series "Black Jesus" on cartoon networks Adult Swim. This past year, Bear filmed across from Matt Fahey(MTV's Awkward) in the upcoming feature "Holden On." Past credits include: 2 Broke Girls, Mind of Mencia, Bloody Mary 3D, and Aim High. Bear also directed the short film "Cyber Mac" which was the winner of the Best Short Film at the 2014 Mockfest Film Festival at Raleigh Studios. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3057024/



Roger Kern (R.A.C. Team) has been starring on stage, film and television for a period of over 35 years. Concurrently he’s directed, taught, and coached actors at such places as the California Institute of the Arts, Oklahoma Art Institute, American Academy of Dramatic Art, American Academy of Radio and Television Broadcasting (on camera acting), South Coast Repertory Theater and he had his own Main Street Actor’s Workshop in Venice, CA.  He’s also written and directed plays for the theater as well as written and directed for film and short subject video.  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0449496/ or http://www.rogersactingtips.com

 


NEW ANNOUNCEMENT(June 1, 2015)! David C. Hernandez has joined the cast. Performing has always been a deep passion for David C. Hernandez. Raised in the southern part of San Jose, California, David eventually made the decision to pursue acting as a profession The American Academy of Dramatic Arts proved to be an excellent fit to nourish the growth of his art. While attending the Academy, David was able to stretch his boundaries as an actor through the rigorous curriculum and also found he had a talent and fondness for stage combat. Now as an Academy graduate, David is an accomplished actor, fighter, instructor, and fight choreographer. David attacks new project with conviction and verve anxious for new learning experiences and cherishing every moment he gets to work in this fantastic industry.

Bobby Hundley (R.A.C. Team) is a producer, writer, actor, director, and non-profit manager. He is currently the Producing Artistic Director of the San Gabriel Valley Music Theatre. Prior to this post he was the Founding Artistic Director of the University Wits Repertory, where in 2004 he won the Artistic Director Achievement Award for Best Play Revival-Comedy, for their production of "Moonchildren".  He served as the Managing Member of the Wartime Romance Show Tour. In addition to co-writing “Safe”, he is the co-author of The Iron Relic Book Series. He has written, acted and directed many theatre, film, television ad new media projects. Bobby is an alum of The London Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts. http://www.amazon.com/Bobby-Hundley/e/B00W4APHNO/ref=ntt_dp_epwbk_0



James Stevenson (R.A.C. Team) is an actor who performs under the name Dallas James.  He is also a writer and a producer.  James is an AADA alum and a cast member in The Stranger Than Fiction Show, an 11 year long running weekly live improv show.  James teaches improv for actors at The L.A. Connection Comedy Theater.  He also recently co authored the thriller The Iron Relic Book I: The Crossing.  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2578570/ 



Sheila Marie Shostac (R.A.C. Team) began in the industry as an actress.  Sheila Marie realized that she liked to tell the story from the beginning and began on her journey as a producer.   She has since produced several short films as well as staged readings.  Her short films include "Ten Men On The Field" and "Trane and Miles”.  Staged readings; "Granny Dearest", "9/11, 10 years" later writing contest, "Walkers" live steam reading and "Livin’ the Dream" with LoNyLA at Paramount studios. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1311345/



Michael Lopez (R.A.C. Team) along with Reel Artists Collective, Michael is also Co-founder of Laughing House Productions, Ground UP! a writers lab and Sitcom Madness, an industry showcase focusing on comedy for television that partners with writers, actors, producers and directors to create new and inventive material to bring to the industry.  As an actor/singer Michael’s credits are wide and varied, from Tevye in "Fiddler on the Roof" to Miss December in "The 99 cent show: Calendar Girl Competition" as well as vocal soloist with various symphonies around the world. Michael also has a background in marketing in the arts field.



Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about our film on your social media; Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, anyone where you can think of.

Watch the film online when it's released.

Cross your fingers and wish us well.

story:
A Rare Comedic Gem That Tells The Story of Your Life...

So few comedies are genuinely hilarious and yet still capture real life, but Roommates -- in the tradition of that classic indie Goliath, Clerks -- does just that.

There are also few comedies that are so slavish to the pursuit of laughter that they put it above all other considerations, irreverently delivering humour that most other filmmakers dare not touch. But, as with Borat, South Park, or The Life of Brian, Roommates is a no-holds-barred comedic gem.

From the opening gambit of one character telling anther that his girlfriend is "Good. She let me cum in her ear last night," to the introduction of the easily offended Harry Kunst, to an on-going debate about whether it would be better to have sex with a good-looking monkey or an ugly woman, Roommates is jam-packed with that all-too-rare type of comedy that the best comedies embrace.

Watch Yourself Onscreen... 

But, beyond this, Roommates (again taking a page out of Clerks' script), is true to the life of those who are watching it. It is an honest portrayal of the struggles of trying to get along with roommates, chronicling the experience of that first move out of home to live in squalid shared accommodation. It is an unsentimentalised look at your life as it is, in all its honest joy and frustration. It's a chance to finally see yourself represented onscreen.

Quite literally, too, if you live in the Baglowah area! We need a massive cast of extras, so the first 50 people who donate $30 or more can have themselves immortalised on-screen in what promises to be a classic picture!

And, while we can't offer investment opportunities or profit participation via indiegogo, our biggest supporters would certainly be remembered should we found the success we expect.

story:
www.JULIABLUETHEMOVIE.com
FOR ALL WAYS TO DONATE!!!


A FEW HOURS LEFT!

Several months ago, a friend in Kyiv told me, "Roxy, you are trying to shoot a rocket into space with only rubber bands"   people have told me it's "impossible" to make a film in Ukraine, to work with locals, to find actors. But I BELIEVE and we are doing it - watch this rocket FLY!

From the TEAM at JULIA BLUE! THANK YOU FOR BELIEVING!!!!!

***The fundraising will continue - share, discuss, be a part of it:)


36 Hours TO GO!

"Its more than lights, it's about creating a world in front of the lens."   A quote just now from my cinematographer Sashko.

The more money we raise, the more we are able to create something that is beyond average, we can create something breathtaking. 




48 HOURS LEFT!

We can DO THIS!


LESS THAN 72 HOURS LEFT!

Check out some images of yesterday's camera test in the GALLERY TAB ABOVE





4 DAYS LEFT!

Please read the absolutely BRILLIANT article by Sonya Borys for EUROMAIDAN PRESS!  Click the LINK below and Read :)

Euromaidan Press Article Aug. 2015

*Striy River Bridge  Location - Photo Sashko Roshchyn

*Nafta Mountain Daybreak - Photo Sashko Roshchyn

*Scouting Nafta Mountain - Photo Sashko Roshchyn

FYI - For my mom and others who wonder what "scouting locations" means:

Location scouting is a vital process in the  pre-production stage of  filmmaking. Once scriptwriters, producers or directors have decided what general kind of scenery they require for the various parts of their work that is shot outside of the studio.  The search for a suitable place or "location" outside the typical studio begins. Location scouts also look for generally spectacular or interesting locations beforehand, to have a database of locations in case of requests.

Location scouts often negotiate legal access to filming locations.



6 DAYS LEFT!  The countdown has begun!

This past weekend was spent location scouting in the Carpathian Mountains.  The group included myself, my DP Sashko and one of our new producers, Iryna, from MKK FILMS (more about this to come...)
The scout started at the Skole train station then moved to a village 20km away.  For two days we visited every location featured in the script and searched for more.  My family was invaluable to us throughout the weekend! Its so on!




PROJECT UPDATE! 
DAY 20
Its been an AMAZING week for the project! We have been moving forward at lightning speed!  Stay tuned for more info!!!!



DAY 10!

We are at 10%!  Thanks to  everyone for sharing and supporting! Today I'm excited to feature the work of artist OLA RONDIAK who is generously creating an ORIGINAL tote bag for donors at the $250 Level- her designs will ALSO be worn by my lead actress in one of the scenes of the film, so this really is a unique and exciting reward. Ola's work is amazing inspiration for me, I hope it will be for you too!

Read more about OLA RONDIAK here! 


DAY 8 ! 

  • Thanks to my WEEK ONE supporters.  Let's keep the funds coming in.  ALSO, check out the cinematography reel of my number one collaborator and team member, Sashko Roschchyn.  I would never make this film without him:)

Sashko Roshchyn Reel


  1. WEEK  ONE UPDATE!
Its been a crazy week, launching the campaign, sharing perks, photos and editing videos. All while coming home after a year abroad to visit family, attend a wedding, fight some zombies with my niece and nephew and launch a campaign for a second film that is much bigger than me, a film that will challenge all of us.

*This week, I have a FANTASTIC PERK UPDATE!  At the $500 range you will receive an original 11x14 photo print taken on Maidan during the revolution by  ARTEM RHYZHYKOV, photographer and cinematographer of the award-winning documentary
 THE RUSSIAN WOODPECKER!!!!
To those who have contributed THANK YOU!
To those thinking about it PLEASE DO!


July 24, 2015 WE HAVE LAUNCHED!!!!

LOGLINE

Ukraine, 2015. JULIA, an accomplished university student, finds her life disrupted after falling in love with ENGLISH,  a soldier fresh from the eastern front.

SYNOPSIS

Feisty and hard-working, 22 year-old student, JULIA, is confronted with the harsh realities of life in contemporary, war-torn Ukraine. Relentless with her studies, she wins a coveted scholarship to a University abroad.  As Julia secretly prepares for a new world outside of Kyiv, she meets a young, edgy, soldier from Donetsk, known as ENGLISH.

Together, Julia and English navigate through contemporary Kyiv; a world of babushka’s, volunteers, soldiers, hipsters, nationalists and VIP’s. Ultimately, they choose to break away from the city, escaping to the Carpathian mountains, where a new set of realities determine each of their fates.

A character-driven drama, Julia Blue will dive into the psyche of a determined twenty-something and a damaged war hero. The stories authenticity is highlighted by the richly detailed and captivating world of its’ unique location.

*One Year Anniversary of Maidan.

VISUAL STYLE

The film will create a look of an "unvarnished realism," capturing the private moments of our characters lives within the exciting frame of contemporary Ukraine. The film will show the modern, metropolis that is Kyiv and re-define with visual cues and details what life is truly like in rural Ukraine, where babushkas text while simultaneously following centuries-old customs. The film will take a naturalistic approach (handheld camera, use of mostly available light) and sweeping shots of both the city and countryside will add to the richness of the story.  Subtle details and nuances will enhance the audiences understanding of this world.

Julia Blue will be shot entirely on location in Ukraine in English, Ukrainian and Russian languages.

*Sveta from the Dom Kino not only makes an amazing Turkish coffee but she and this amazing cafe  served as character& location inspiration for the story.


ABOUT OUR TEAM

KinoRox Productions Director Roxy Toporowych works in various aspects of the film industry, as both a director of slavic-inspired films and as a set decorator on multitudes of project.  Her first feature "Folk!" a documentary about the Ukrainian dance world, has had over 50 screenings across the US, Canada & Ukraine.  

Writer/Director - Roxy Toporowych, KinoRox Productions

Cinematographer - Sashko Roshchyn


*Carpathian Knaipa "gang" of kids on location at Nafta mountain.  Perhaps a miniature version of our Julia Blue team?


WHY THIS FILM?   WHY THIS STORY?

I left NYC for Kyiv in September 2014 on a Fulbright Scholarship. It was a challenging move, but I chose to battle my nerves and culture shock and push forward.  I started really listening, meeting and speaking with people from all over  Ukraine.  From volunteer soldiers and aid workers to students and artists - everyone's lives have been touched by the Maidan revolution and the current war with Russia.  Cabbies,  soldiers,  farmers and hipsters - everyone had a story to tell.

I decided to compile these stories and this research into a feature length script.  I also decided I wanted to tell that story in a way that would reach people across borders, speaking to them emotionally.   One year later, Julia Blue was born.


WHERE WILL THE FUNDS GO?

The funds will be split into two basic categories.  

1. BASIC NEEDS OF PRODUCTION  -   Locations, lodging, transportation, food, water, and equipment expendibles.  THIS is what we need to get our 21-day film shoot in the can!

2. AUTHENTICITY - Set decoration, wardrobe, make-up, music, all the details that bring a film its extra layer of life!

FUNDING COSTS IN DETAIL:

Transportation and Lodging for cast and crew in the Carpathians. The dream is to make the film as AUTHENTIC as possible - so we plan to do a company move from Kyiv to a village outside of Striy, Ukraine. 659 Kilometers to be exact!

We need to drive the cast, crew and equipment across Ukraine. We need to house everyone and feed everyone!  Most of the crew is working on a volunteer low/no budget basis,  including the amazing locals who will open their doors to us for the process.

Equipment/Crew - Though most of the equipment will be donated by Radioaktive Film, and most of the crew is working on a volunteer basis, there is other gear that we will need to rent for the full production, such as generators for the extensive night shoots and the wedding scenes in Ukraine, as well as additional crew members and technicians to assist our main team throughout the shoot.

Food/Craft Services Food & water for cast and crew throughout the shoot! It will still be hot in August and September and a hydrated crew is a happy crew.

Props/Set Design - Sets include a university dormitory, military hospital, village home and the infamous Dom Kino Cafe.  Props include everything from school backpacks to a Zaporozhets car. 

Hair / Make-Up / Wardrobe. Huge cast, must dress! The look and style of our characters will speak volumes in the storytelling.  From the Ukrainian ethno-hipster vibe of Julia to the military fatigues and tattoos that English has, all of it has to be collected and created.

DO I HAVE TO DO ANYTHING ELSE?

First of a big shout out and hug to you for reading this far and taking interest!   The fact is, with your donation, you are now part of the team that is Julia Blue!  You have no other commitments except to enjoy the crazy, journey which lies ahead!  Of course, it would do wonders if you could further help our goal by spreading the word. Sharing an email link,  sharing the campaign on Facebook, and telling your friends and family to get on board and DONATE!  Perhaps suggesting a press article about the film to a third party/journalist/newspaper to keep the buzz going.  Otherwise sit back and enjoy the ride:
 

*Musicians lead wedding parade

*ALL PHOTOS AND VIDEOS ABOVE ARE THANKS TO A SPECIAL GRANT FROM CANON, USA
***ALSO CHECK OUT THE *GALLERY* FOR MORE PHOTOS OF OUR PERKS!***

*MORE PHOTOS AND VIDEOS WILL BE RELEASED THROUGHOUT THE CAMPAIGN!
story_txt:
www.JULIABLUETHEMOVIE.com
FOR ALL WAYS TO DONATE!!!

A FEW HOURS LEFT!Several months ago, a friend in Kyiv told me, "Roxy, you are trying to shoot a rocket into space with only rubber bands"   people have told me it's "impossible" to make a film in Ukraine, to work with locals, to find actors. But I BELIEVE and we are doing it - watch this rocket FLY!
From the TEAM at JULIA BLUE! THANK YOU FOR BELIEVING!!!!!


***The fundraising will continue - share, discuss, be a part of it:)
36 Hours TO GO!
"Its more than lights, it's about creating a world in front of the lens."   A quote just now from my cinematographer Sashko.
The more money we raise, the more we are able to create something that is beyond average, we can create something breathtaking.  





48 HOURS LEFT!
We can DO THIS!



LESS THAN 72 HOURS LEFT!
Check out some images of yesterday's camera test in the GALLERY TAB ABOVE



4 DAYS LEFT!
Please read the absolutely BRILLIANT article by Sonya Borys for EUROMAIDAN PRESS!  Click the LINK below and Read :)
Euromaidan Press Article Aug. 2015





*Striy River Bridge  Location - Photo Sashko Roshchyn*Nafta Mountain Daybreak - Photo Sashko Roshchyn*Scouting Nafta Mountain - Photo Sashko RoshchynFYI - For my mom and others who wonder what "scouting locations" means: Location scouting is a vital process in the  pre-production stage of  filmmaking. Once scriptwriters, producers or directors have decided what general kind of scenery they require for the various parts of their work that is shot outside of the studio.  The search for a suitable place or "location" outside the typical studio begins. Location scouts also look for generally spectacular or interesting locations beforehand, to have a database of locations in case of requests.

Location scouts often negotiate legal access to filming locations.


6 DAYS LEFT!  The countdown has begun!

Its so on!

Thanks to my WEEK ONE supporters.  Let's keep the funds coming in.  ALSO, check out the cinematography reel of my number one collaborator and team member, Sashko Roschchyn.  I would never make this film without him:)
