story:
Visit our Website to Learn More About BRUCE

BRUCE the Movie

BRUCE | The Team

Phebe Szatmari, Director of BRUCE, is a Hungarian-American filmmaker based in New York City. After receiving a full scholarship to study at Stony Brook Southampton with Christine Vachon of Killer Films in the 20/20/20 Digital Filmmaking program, Phebe was placed on a house digital filmmaking team at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre as Director, Director of Photography, and Producer. Phebe is currently directing, shooting, and/or starring in several web series and numerous shorts. Her work has appeared on UCBComedy, IFC, College Humor, Funny or Die, Right This Minute, Sports Illustrated, BuzzFeed, and has been written up on Time, Fast Company, Huffington Post, Bustle, Nylon, Cosmopolitan, The Daily Dot, Mashable, among others. Her videos have reached more than 1 million viewers. When she’s not making comedy films, she’s performing improv all over New York City on her Queens Secret house team, TALON, her improv, sketch, and video team, Scott Baio Wolf, and her indie team, HUNS. She dreams of one day pursuing off-road racing. 

Chris Bayon, Co-Writer, Lead Actor, Producer of BRUCE, is a New York City based Producer/Actor/Writer/Director who has been working steadily on short films, off-broadway plays,  feature films and commercials since his move to NYC in summer of 2009. He is a graduate of the prestigious and intense William Esper Studios in NYC (Larry David, Timothy Olyphant and Sam Rockwell) and also received a business degree from Gettysburg College. Chris has written, starred in and produced several short films and has appeared in several national commercials. Chris is an avid musician (trumpet) and soccer player.

Jess Clark, Co-Writer and Associate Producer of BRUCE, is an New York City based comedian, writer and a featured player at The People's Improv Theater. This is her first feature film, and she feels incredibly grateful to be working with, and learning from such accomplished professionals. 
Alex Parada, Associate Producer of BRUCE, is a filmmaker, writer, and producer based in Long Island, New York.  He has produced, directed and written several short films and his first feature length film entitled The Tale on Emerald Trail is in post-production.  He enjoys arts and crafts and long walks on the beach.  Preferably with his crafts.
Mike Greene, Co-Production Designer of BRUCE, is a designer and filmmaker based in New York City. After receiving his undergraduate degree in journalism from Rutgers University, Mike completed his masters in architecture and design from Tulane University in New Orleans. He has done art direction for many filmmakers from the UCB and comedy community at large, including one play. During the day, Mike works as a User Experience Designer at the award winning media agency, Isobar. When he’s not working he can be seen around town, performing with his video/sketch/improv team Scott Baio Wolf, and improv teams Rascals and Humphrey. He has no fear of heights and would love to start jumping out of planes!

Samantha Gurewitz, Co-Production Designer/Costume Designer/Makeup Artist of BRUCE, began doing costume design at PBCC in Florida back in 2003, where she was nominated for a Kennedy Center American Theater Award for her costume and makeup design work on Murder in the Cathedral. After moving to New York City in 2006, she was a costume designer at the 13th st. rep. Theater and the Impact Theater, where her work on Ahmalia earned great reviews. She has been a makeup artist for the past 3 years, doing work for numerous productions featured on Netflix, Above Average, UCBComedy, IFC.com and College Humor. Recently she stepped up her tour of the Art Department becoming the Art Director for video series' on UCBComedy and IFC.com. She is an actress with numerous straight and comedy credits, and performs regularly with her indie improv teams HUNS, M and Risky Brisket. She also writes and performs original music with her band Danger Pin, and is obsessed with finding the perfect pair of pants. 

Kate Payne, Digital Strategist for BRUCE, is a digital media specialist and someone who loves fancy words. Kate has been working in social media and web branding since 2010 when she graduated from Hamilton College and moved to New York to start work at TCG Agency, a digital branding agency specializing in fashion brands. From there Kate moved on within TCG to work in business development and pitching clients the perfect website and social media campaign to fit their needs. Following work at TCG, Kate took a break from marketing to travel the world (mostly in Asia) for a year, starting in Japan and literally landing, then leaving, places like Kabul, Afghanistan and Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. In 2014 Kate began working for VisualMax, the creative agency behind many of the award-winning online advertising campaigns which Yelp has used to help position itself as a cornerstone of new media. At VisualMax, Kate acted as a producer and marketing manager, ensuring that every advertising campaign, whether for Ford or Mastercard, fit the clients needs, functioned as needed and made the world of online advertising a more interesting, interactive place. Now Kate freelances and uses her skills for good to help smaller brands broaden their online presence, whether that means building a new website, designing a newsletter chain or managing the infrastructure of a social media campaign. In her free time (when she has it) Kate trains at UCB, is a tech intern at the PIT and performs and produces original videos with her video team. 


BRUCE | The Message

BRUCE is close to our hearts because we believe that if you work hard at something you love and are passionate about, you can't go wrong--and this is the message of our film.  
BRUCE is a story about a frustrated artist, Charlie, who is dragging himself through his days at a desk job he hates. Just as Charlie is at his breaking point, he meets the incredibly free-spirited and constantly inappropriate Bruce. Bruce takes Charlie under his wing and through a series of misadventures, graffiti, and bizarre pep-talks, reconnects him with his sense of humor and his passion. There’s an issue though, Bruce doesn’t exist. Charlie is the only person who can see and hear him. 
Whether behind the scenes or on screen, the cast and crew of BRUCE are all working professionals at their craft, and they are contributing their time and effort pro-bono for love of the project, the script, and the message of the importance of integrating all the parts of oneself into pursuing one's life goals.
Having previous working relationships with everyone on the cast and crew makes this process much smoother.  We have earned each other's trust, and this provides a more comfortable set environment for all involved and that is when the magic happens!

Contributors will not only be helping us make BRUCE, but you will help build a team that will continue to create awesome content for the rest of our careers.  And if you'd like to be on our team, now is the time to let us know. Join us! It is our goal to maintain the same core team and experience success together.  A rising tide lifts all boats.


BRUCE | What We Need & What You Get

While we can pull up our boot straps and get certain things like locations and props for free by doing extra leg work and mining Craigslist, we need help with equipment, transportation, and post-production costs like sound editing, color correction, and submission fees for film festivals. We are going all the way with this film, and you get to be right there with us for the ride as our contributors. We mean it--a rising tide lifts all boats--and we want you to be one of the boats in our tide. 

Last night I watched A Most Violent Year and enjoyed it thoroughly. I was struck by Oscar Isaac's portrayal of Abel Morales. Morales' advice for pitching is that "You'll never do anything harder than staring someone in the eye and telling them the truth." And that's exactly how I feel about Indiegogo campaigns and asking for help. 

Ultimately, we are going to shoot this film.  We will do whatever it takes to make the best film we can, and that includes asking for your help.  We're self-funding a large portion, but with your help, we can move mountains. We're setting the fundraising goal at it's absolute minimum (10K), but depending on the success of this Indiegogo campaign, we may be able to attract a well-known performer to get more attention and ultimately make the film as successful as possible.

BRUCE | Risks & Challenges

Making a film is very difficult.  As soon as you think you've covered everything, there is inevitably another obstacle.  However, because we have done this many times before (shorts, feature-length web series, other films, commercials, etc.), we are comfortable in the environment and confident that as a team we can solve any issues that arise.


BRUCE | Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to donate please share this link and help us get the word out about BRUCE!


Thank you, friends and loved ones!!

BRUCE the Movie

story:
CANCER: My Story - Another 30 Days of Treatment

Hi I'm Rubin Rodriguez Jr, in July, I went to the dentist because of pain with my wisdom teeth. The dentist took x-rays and explained that he didn’t want to remove the wisdom teeth based on my health history, heart strength and unknown effects from cancer radiation treatments three years ago. There was a chance my jaw would break because of its weakened state and my weak and damaged heart may fail during the procedure. 

I met with the oral surgeon two weeks later and he too was concerned about the removal of the wisdom teeth.  He required that I take 30 days (6 weeks) of treatment in a Hyperbaric Chamber , 20 days (4 weeks) before the oral surgery and 10 days (2 weeks) after. The two hour-per-day hyperbaric treatment will strengthen my jaw and heart muscle. Insurance denied the treatment and we appealed. Three months later  the treatment finally begins.

The expenses and bills will create a hardship for my family and I wanted to create a solution to cover the expenses. 

It is a hard and humbling moment to ask for help.

"Smile for Survival" is my way of finding that solution for my family and other cancer survivors that need help. Check out:  www.SmileforSurvival.com

When the campaign is successful, we will share our experience in the campaign with other cancer survivors and their families and work to provide support for them as well.  

My story and experience with cancer

The video updates on this campaign are my current experiences and a reflection three years later and the effects the cancer treatment has on my life now.

I’ll go into detail about my cancer and treatment.  I’ll share about the first time I felt the bump to the day they released me cancer free. I will share the surgery, chemo, radiation and recovery. I'll talk about the depression, disfigurement, medications, physical therapy, long stays in ICU and heart failure.

I will share with you about the financial losses, the missed moments with my kid's life, the lawsuits from doctors and a medical institution for my treatments.

Most importantly, how lucky I am to have a wife, family and church as my support during recovery.

The perks you buy will help to fulfill the financial needs created by treatment and to bring more awareness of long term effects of cancer. Obviously the needs and the use of funds may change based on the events of the treatment, but the principle ideas is to assist when needed.

I never attended a support group about the effects of my cancer or my depression, so this campaign and the videos maybe my way of dealing with feelings and having some closure on the struggles of the past three years.

Please help make Smile for Survival a success. 

Give the Gift of Support!

It all begins Tuesday, October 20, 2015.

"Smile for Survival, Life Beyond Cancer"

The Smile for Survival fundraiser helps to raise public awareness and much needed funds for cancer survivors and their families as the go through the journey of recovery. These are most often the living expenses and bills that are not paid by insurance companies. More stories on www.SmileforSurvival.com coming soon.

Once we reach the goal our volunteer staff will begin creating a template campaign that can be duplicated by other cancer survivors and their families that need assistance. 

If you have a business and would like to contribute to our efforts, please contact me at 801-923-3533 or SmileforSurvival@gmail.com for the details. We can create a gift certificates to be redeemed for products and services at your local business. 

Why build Smile for Survival?

Not all cancer survivors and their families have the time to create marketing material, shoot a video or a circle of influence to succeed. When I was in recovery, the treatments and life survival was all I could think about. As a result, my family carried the burden of the financial hardship.

One man show

I will be the only one creating and updating this campaign. I have designed the logo, artwork for the T-Shirts, built the website, created the videos and prepared the perks and rewards. I won't take a salary or receive compensation for the work. There are treatment, family and campaign expenses that come first. I have an attorney ready to prepare the necessary paperwork with the state and federal government for the non-profit status.

Many hours have been spent working on the different areas of this campaign. These type of campaigns are hard to build and communicate on social media, so please appreciate the skill set and marketing.


Perks and Rewards

Buy a Juice, Diet Soda or Hot Coco

If you could buy us a juice, diet soda or a hot chocolate for $5.00.  With all the trips to and from the hospital for treatment, a comfort drink is appreciated. 

          

If you would like to help us build Smile for Survival, a non-profit company, then a drink would be a great help to volunteer staff. 

Fuel and Transportation

Buy us some Fuel for transportation $10.00. Every visit to the hospital or treatment center requires transportation from the home and it requires up to $10.00 per day.

                        If you would like to help us build Smile for Survival, a non-profit company, then we will create a "Fuel Fund" for future cancer survivor recipients and help our volunteer staff. 


T-Shirt - Smile for Survival - "Smile if You Love a Cancer Survivor"

Buy a T-Shirt for $20.00. These are high quality t-shirts that can show off your pride for a cancer survivor. 

T-Shirt - Smile for Survival - "Smile if You Love a Cancer Survivor"

Buy the Family 6 T-Shirt Package for $135.00.  The family 6 t-shirt package is for those that want to share their pride for a cancer survivor in their family.  We can add your family name on the back of these 6 t-shirts packages.

Dinner with My Wife
Buy us a dinner out for $50. So often the cancer patient has the support of their spouse, but doesn't have the funds to dine out or a date night. The spouse needs a "time out" from the stress of the home and the medical treatments.

A fine dining experience can help relieve the stress of the family hardship.

Give the Gift of Support!

Local Business Support

If you have a business in the Salt Lake City and surrounding areas and would like to contribute to our efforts, please contact me at 801-923-3533 or SmileforSurvival@gmail.com for details. www.SmileforSurvival.com

We can create a gift certificates for perks and rewards to be redeemed for products and service at your local business.  

Call 801-923-3533 or SmileforSurvival@gmail.com


Thank you for showing your support. 

MORE PERKS AND REWARDS WILL BE ADDED TO THIS CAMPAIGN

Give the Gift of Support!

story:
Santo Niño is a documentary about three young men during their last days in high school in one of Mexicali's most conflicted areas, the Santorales region. Francisco is a literature and arts aficionado facing a radical change come graduation, moving to the United States. Marco is an aspiring painter who spends his energy drawing and helping out at his family's motorcycle repair shop. Luis is focusing on a technical trade, all the while hoping to get into a university come graduation.  

The feature length documentary is being shot in a variety of formats, including film and digital video. We are utilizing Super 8mm stock, particularly the recently out of stock Ektachrome 64T color stock, this film being more than likely, the last Mexican documentary to ever do so. The documentary film will feature documentaries made by the students/protagonists shot on digital video, positioning the structure of a film within a film. An original score is being composed and currently in its final stages by alternative musicians and the film's director.

We are asking for your support in aiding us with postproduction expenses in order for the film to be finished the way it should be and reach the widest possible audience. As it currently stands, the film is neither a short nor a feature-length film, so we need approximately $2500 dollars for 16mm film stock + developing and HD transfer costs at Pro8mm in Burbank, CA in order for us to reach our feature-length goal. One thousand dollars will be destined for studio time to record the original score at The Creamery Analog Recording Studio in Oakland with acclaimed musician/producer Greg Ashley, who is on board with the project. The remaining five hundred dollars would cover transportation and shipping costs for film shoots and post-production. 

We truly appreciate your time and any donation possible in support of independent, alternative Mexican documentary cinema.

XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

Santo Niño es un documental acerca de tres jóvenes que cursan sus últimos días de preparatoria en una de las zonas mas conflictivas de Mexicali, Baja California, la región de los Santorales. Francisco es un aficionado de la literatura y las artes que próximamente se encontrara con un cambio radical al graduarse, ya que se mudara a Estados Unidos. Marco aspira a ser artista plástico y dedica toda su energía al dibujo y a ayudar en el taller de refacción de motocicletas de su familia. Luis se enfoca hacia una carrera técnica, esperando poder ingresar a la universidad al graduarse.  

El largometraje se esta filmando con una variedad de formatos, incluyendo película y video digital. Estamos filmando en el formato de Super 8mm, particularmente con la película de color Ektachrome 64T, la cual recientemente fue descontinuada, siendo este largometraje mexicano el ultimo en usarla. El largometraje también mostrara documentales realizados por los estudiantes/protagonistas filmados en video digital, posicionando una estructura de un film dentro de un film. La música original y soundtrack del film se encuentran en su etapa final de composición a cargo de músicos alternativos y el director del film. 

Solicitamos su apoyo para cubrir gastos de postproducción para que el film se termine de manera adecuada y asi llegar a la mas grande audiencia posible. El film actualmente es un mediometraje, asi que necesitamos aproximadamente  $2500 dólares para comprar película y filmar en formato de 16mm + gastos de scaneo en HD y transfer digital con la compañía Pro8mm en Burbank, CA. Mil dólares se destinaran para grabar la música original en The Creamery Analog Recording Studio en Oakland con el aclamado músico y productor Greg Ashley, quien también participa en este proyecto. Por ultimo, los quinientos dólares restantes se utilizarían para cubrir gastos de transporte para las filmaciones y gastos de envío para la postproducción.

Agradecemos su tiempo y cualquier donacion posible en apoyo al cine documental mexicano independiente como alternativa. 

Director/Editor: Marco Vera
Cinematógrafo: Rubén Marrufo
Sonido Directo: Derrick Sparrow 
Música Original: The Valiants (Joe + Héctor Hernández, Marco Vera)
story_txt: Santo Niño is a documentary about three young men during their last days in high school in one of Mexicali's most conflicted areas, the Santorales region. Francisco is a literature and arts aficionado facing a radical change come graduation, moving to the United States. Marco is an aspiring painter who spends his energy drawing and helping out at his family's motorcycle repair shop. Luis is focusing on a technical trade, all the while hoping to get into a university come graduation.  The feature length documentary is being shot in a variety of formats, including film and digital video. We are utilizing Super 8mm stock, particularly the recently out of stock Ektachrome 64T color stock, this film being more than likely, the last Mexican documentary to ever do so. The documentary film will feature documentaries made by the students/protagonists shot on digital video, positioning the structure of a film within a film. An original score is being composed and currently in its final stages by alternative musicians and the film's director.We are asking for your support in aiding us with postproduction expenses in order for the film to be finished the way it should be and reach the widest possible audience. As it currently stands, the film is neither a short nor a feature-length film, so we need approximately $2500 dollars for 16mm film stock + developing and HD transfer costs at Pro8mm in Burbank, CA in order for us to reach our feature-length goal. One thousand dollars will be destined for studio time to record the original score at The Creamery Analog Recording Studio in Oakland with acclaimed musician/producer Greg Ashley, who is on board with the project. The remaining five hundred dollars would cover transportation and shipping costs for film shoots and post-production. We truly appreciate your time and any donation possible in support of independent, alternative Mexican documentary cinema.XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXSanto Niño es un documental acerca de tres jóvenes que cursan sus últimos días de preparatoria en una de las zonas mas conflictivas de Mexicali, Baja California, la región de los Santorales. Francisco es un aficionado de la literatura y las artes que próximamente se encontrara con un cambio radical al graduarse, ya que se mudara a Estados Unidos. Marco aspira a ser artista plástico y dedica toda su energía al dibujo y a ayudar en el taller de refacción de motocicletas de su familia. Luis se enfoca hacia una carrera técnica, esperando poder ingresar a la universidad al graduarse.  El largometraje se esta filmando con una variedad de formatos, incluyendo película y video digital. Estamos filmando en el formato de Super 8mm, particularmente con la película de color Ektachrome 64T, la cual recientemente fue descontinuada, siendo este largometraje mexicano el ultimo en usarla. El largometraje también mostrara documentales realizados por los estudiantes/protagonistas filmados en video digital, posicionando una estructura de un film dentro de un film. La música original y soundtrack del film se encuentran en su etapa final de composición a cargo de músicos alternativos y el director del film. Solicitamos su apoyo para cubrir gastos de postproducción para que el film se termine de manera adecuada y asi llegar a la mas grande audiencia posible. El film actualmente es un mediometraje, asi que necesitamos aproximadamente  $2500 dólares para comprar película y filmar en formato de 16mm + gastos de scaneo en HD y transfer digital con la compañía Pro8mm en Burbank, CA. Mil dólares se destinaran para grabar la música original en The Creamery Analog Recording Studio en Oakland con el aclamado músico y productor Greg Ashley, quien también participa en este proyecto. Por ultimo, los quinientos dólares restantes se utilizarían para cubrir gastos de transporte para las filmaciones y gastos de envío para la postproducción.Agradecemos su tiempo y cualquier donacion posible en apoyo al cine documental mexicano independiente como alternativa. Director/Editor: Marco VeraCinematógrafo: Rubén MarrufoSonido Directo: Derrick Sparrow Música Original: The Valiants (Joe + Héctor Hernández, Marco Vera)

story:
Short Summary

NOTE: We will now be looking at Agora and Evolution as our case studies 
This short 15 minute documentary is going to investigate the recent epidemic of online drug marketplaces that have risen on the dark web. The main discoveries we make, will unveil the controversial and unexpected positive alternatives that these websites generate. Focusing on the infamous website “The Silk Road”, we will be taking a closer look at their helpful community based forum, and surprising care from both vendors and other buyers.

“The never ending Silk Road” opens by introducing and explaining what these online drug marketplaces actually are, followed by revealing how the average computer literate user is able to anonymously purchase drugs online without being traced.  

Once the basics have been established, the documentary leads on to an interview with a recovering drug addict who will explain the importance of being aware of the purity levels of drugs when consuming, to determine dosage. We are then taken into the depths of this topic leading on to how dealers rip us off and how they jeopardise people’s lives by doing so, for their own profit.  

Within this film we also hope to benefit from professional expertise including an MP, drug specialists and deep/dark web analysts. Finally we hope to interview Russell Brand. As a public figure, recovered drug addict and a believer that the current drug laws need changing he will be perfect for this documentary. 


What We Need

Travel: £400

As this documentary will be based in Central London, transporting crew and equipment will be very costly. We will endeavour use the most cost effective modes of transport nonetheless. Travel Expenses will cover the congestion charge, petrol and Oyster Card fees that will enable us to get to our destinations to hold interviews!

Equipment: £1050 

We are planning to shoot this documentary on a hired Cannon C300 with a full lens set. By using this camera in particular we will be able to create a sleek and captivating look yet still enabling the documentary to be broadcast ready. 

Voice over Artist: £100 

Using a voice over artist who can convey the style and mood of this documentary will really set off the tone of the documentary, while also giving an informative narrative. 

Catering: £400 

Keeping your crew warm with hot drinks and full bellies is so important, especially when running around on location in the winter months. Every day will be a 12 hour shoot which means breakfast, lunch and dinner will be needed to sustain the crew! 

Location Hire: £500 

A very import aspect of documentary is being able to situate your contributors in the correct setting that represents their personality as well as their message. As this documentary will have around 8 interviews, we will need to locate a range of locations in central London.

DVD Printing - £50 

After the production is complete we will be printing around 20 copies of the final product, some of which will be sent out to our donators. This will include the cases, printing and burning of the DVD’s


Risks & Challenges

This documentary will be the first of its kind to reveal a world known as “the dark net”. Being the first, means that we need to be careful in the message we convey and how we display this controversial topic. By completing this documentary we hope to shed new information on current UK drug laws and enlighten the public how one could see the unexpected benefits that “the dark net” could provide.

In this documentary we hope to interview someone with firsthand knowledge of what it is like having had a drug problem. This subject must be handled with care and delicacy as it could be one of the hardest and distressing chapters of the interviewee’s life. Therefore, making them feel comfortable is paramount, so that they might help others in their journey of recovering from a drug addiction.

This shoot has an extremely tight filming schedule, shooting over the short period of four days. Luckily, I have a strong production team who I have the utmost confidence in, to timetable all the interviews and actuality that we will need to capture and fit it into a well organised schedule.

The topic at hand is extremely controversial and entirely contemporary, with talks being held at present about reforming the UK failing drug laws. The Silk Road is a very interesting website to explore and share what it has to offer, when revising the UK drug laws.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you cannot donate please help us by sharing this page on any social media websites!

story:
Who we are:

Ok, here it goes, my name is Beau Harrington and I am a young Director that has been assigned the job of directing this very witty short, written by the very funny Greg Thomas. Along side me is the talented production manager Liberty Duvall and the unique cinematographer Tom Turner.  

The Project:

This short is the final project for our film degrees at the University of Kent. The story follows a female who has been invited to a dinner date over the social dating site ‘Tinder’. Out of support she brings her friend, as the night goes on and the wine flows, she soon realises not everything is, as it seems. 

This project is very important to the crew and I as it is what we are hoping to move into as careers once graduated, and we want it to be the best it can be both for self pride and final grade.

The Funds:

The funding made will be used on such things as props, locations and special effects. As this is a science fiction short, we need the money for the best and most realistic props and make-up.

Every single donation will make a difference, as being an independent group we are very limited with budget. And we have to hope we find people generous enough to donate and make this project the best it can be… which will be pretty awesome.  A special perk will be for people who donate £20 or more, as this is a big sum of money, they will be given a ‘Special Thanks’ on the credits and a link to the website that this will be premiered.

Please Share:

And one last thing that would help us massively would be to share, share, share, so that as many people know of this project. The more the merrier. There are links on the website that can also help you with this. Thank you for the time you've given to read this.

story:
What Is Fastpitch World?

Fastpitch World is a documentary television series that will feature some of the best travel ball players in the nation, showcasing their physical skills as an athlete and their continued sacrifice, discipline and determination, in their attempt to play to that next level. 

We hope you will embrace this opportunity to support this series without prejudice, and without any pre-conceived notion in our attempt to elevate the sport by creating a positive awareness within the community and abroad, through story telling and high end competition.

I have heard many stories that are heart felt and emotionally driven in these past few weeks and those stories deserve to be heard and seen.  We have the platform where many stories, just like yours can be seen and heard. But in order for this to happen, we must work together to achieve that common goal. Increase the awareness of girls fastpitch and create opportunities for our young ladies. Today, we have that opportunity to expand the boundaries for our female athletes and it starts with you.

USSSA, ASA, TCS, PGF and NPF has provided opportunities for our athletes access to develop their skills and compete.  We owe them gratitude for their continued effort to compete and raise the level of competition.  We owe gratitude to Sue Enquist and others like her who work tirelessly in educating the community of the value that female sports offers to a young female.

Fastpitch World is being distributed by a major sports network that will air our hour long episodes during prime time hours on a weeknight. 

Last but certainly not least, a big thanks to those parents, coaches, tournament directors, mentors, sponsors, non-profits and media for providing hopes and dreams to millions of young athletes across the globe.

We want to inspire and empower young women in sports and raise awareness of the incredible game that is fastpitch softball.

Amanda Lorenz-OC Batbusters

Make It Happen With Your Tax-Deductible Donation

$5 makes the difference. We believe that girls fastpitch deserves wider recognition and a place on television, please make a contribution to this campaign  today.

Fastpitch World believes its time to show the world of the talent and tenacity  in today's female youth sport program in a positive way on TV. We hope that we can count you in.

In order to get the show on television, we are responsible for all the costs associated with making the series. This is the fastpitch' community's series. 

This production will not happen without your support. Make a tax-deductible contribution by February 28, 2015, and help get Fastpitch World on television.


Iris Films is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization and all donations are tax-exempt to the fullest extent allowed by law. Founded in 1976, Iris Films is dedicated to producing and distributing documentary films that creatively addresses contemporary social issues.

The organization promotes an artistic and story-based approach to social issue filmmaking, while also upholding the highest editorial and production standards. Its award-winning films include In the Best Interests of the Children, We All Have Our Reasons, Skin Deep, and Long Night’s Journey Into Day, the Sundance Best Documentary award-winning and Academy-award nominated film about South Africa’s Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Iris Films engages multiple distribution networks, from HBO and PBS to domestic non-profits and international NGO´s, to reach audiences and issue stakeholders.

Taylor Mcquillin (OC Batbusters). Gatorade Player Of The Year.

What does it takes to become a top female athlete? How about winning an athletic scholarship to a top-ranked college?  These female athletes are not professionals, they are amateurs, not older than 17 years old - attempting to pursue higher education through athletics.  The very few who make it to this level of competition and recognition will have endured disappointments, failures, and hardships that remain hidden to all but their closest family. These are inspiring stories of strict discipline, daily sacrifice, and enduring courage.

Taylor and her Dad

What Do We See In The Series

Witness the sacrifices, the discipline, the commitment, the desire to succeed. These are not your average athletes. These are today's female warriors, determined to beat the odds, to play the gamer they love, with hopes of a promising future through a higher level of education. 

Go inside the minds of some of the top nationally recognized coaches and see how they mentally, physically and psychologically prepare each player for that next big game. Be in the action and capture some of the best competition in the country. Go behind the scenes and capture the training and overcoming adversity.  Follow another girl, a pitcher who overcomes being blind in one eye and deaf in one ear to become Gatorade Player of the Year.

Girls' competitive fastpitch softball is one of the fastest growing sports in North America. Fastpitch World  takes viewers inside some of the nation’s top fastpitch teams to see first-hand what it takes to become one of the leading teams in the nation.  Be a part of the journey. Be a part of the experience in “Fastpitch World".

The Players and The Teams- Season 1

Faith Canfield-So Cal Athletics

Fastpitch World is currently seeking for those players and teams who will make up our 1st season's line-up. Fastpitch World will feature some of today’s top female fastpitch players, through different walks of life, defining the odds, to play the game they love without any guarantee of the outcome.

What Kind Of Teams and Players Are You Looking For?

We are seeking for teams who have a reputation for winning and those players who display the COMMITMENT on being the best they can be. A DISCIPLINE that transfers on and off the softball field. Willing to SACRIFICE, for the love of the game and display's GOOD CHARACTER. 

When Will You Select The Teams And Players?

Once funded, we will begin to select for the remainder of our casts.  Fastpitch World will include players from various divisional aged groups (12u, 14u, 16u, 18u).
Team confirmations and player selections will be confirmed once series is funded and casting is completed.

How Can We Include Our Player Or Team?


If you would like to be featured for season 1, let us know by writing to us at fastpitchworldteams@irisfilms.org. 

What If we Don't Get Selected To Be On The Series?

If you are not selected in season I, you may still be eligible to share your story through our website and/or our YouTube site.


The Gallery

Make sure to take a peek inside The Gallery to see the LATEST videos on what coaches, parents, players and fans are talking about Fastpitch World.

Let's Get This Series About Girls' Sports on TV!

Alabama's-Halie McCleney


This television documentary series will include five episode in this first season, with each episode being 60 minutes long. We are looking to be on-air in summer 2015. Once the fundraising campaign has finished, we will begin production. We will film in California, Colorado and New Jersey. Our shooting schedule is based on the 2015 fastpitch schedule. 

We plan to go into production in May 2015 and complete our filming by July 2015.

Why a Series About Fastpitch?

It's exciting to watch. It's suspenseful. It's fast-paced. It's compelling. It's unpredictable. It's competition like you have never seen.

Your contribution to this campaign will help the sport and its dedicated athletes reach the next level of awareness and opportunity.  These girls are training six days a week for a chance to get a higher education. They hit home runs, turn double plays; they dive and will bare hand a hard hit ball and will throw a runner out. They are fearless. They are today's female warriors.

The series has been in development for approximately two years. Our goal was, and is, to provide the community a series they can be proud of. We have witnessed the sacrifice, commitment and discipline of the players, parents and coaches - on a daily basis. In order for this show to happen, we need the community to support this effort. 

There are approximately 5 million girls playing fastpitch softball in the United States. With your support, this series can be a reality. Are you up for the challenge? We think that you are.

Our Thank You for Your Support

So Cal Athletics-PGF Champions

Make a donation, and be among the first to sport season-one FASTPITCH WORLD limited-edition perks: t-shirts, water bottles, travel mugs, baseball caps and visors, backpacks, posters and autographed softballs.  Become a supporter and show the world that you were there from the beginning and said YES to Fastpitch World and YES to girls fastpitch finally getting some well-deserved attention on television!  Come on board to help get this first-ever, action-packed, competition series on air. The show will keep you on the edge of your seat all the way to the very last pitch, and you'll be glad you were among those who made it happen. 


Why Fundraise With Indiegogo?

Kaitlyn Lim-Irvine Sting

Our goal and vision is to increase the awareness of the physical skills, commitment to excellence and dedication these fastpitch players display on a daily basis - on and off the field.

Together we can make it happen. For our girls. For our athletes. And for this sport.

Sincerely,

Louis Simon
Series Creator and Executive Producer

Where Does The Money Go?

All donations will be implemented into the development, pre-production, physical production expenses, which includes location, crew, equipment, insurance, marketing, offices and post production. 

Donations will NOT BE USED for any other purpose but to produce the series itself.

Production Budget Breakdown

Here is how the donations will be used: Development   4% Pre-Production and Production  51% Post Production  40% Marketing  5% Indiegogo Fee  9% (-25% discount for 501c3 status). If our goal is met, that fee is reduced to 5% fee.

The Production Team

Our development team's relationships and experience in the entertainment industry and non-profit sector is bar none - from top films to television network shows and important documentary work. Fastpitch World will be visually stunning, rich with compelling personal stories and commanding of a wide and dedicated audience.

Series Creator: Louis C. Simon

Lou’s work began as a professional actor, but his dedication to media making and the film industry drew him to work as a casting director, stuntman, writer, technical advisor, stunt coordinator, director, producer and head of production. He has 100 + professional credits to his name as a film and television maker. When asked to name a memorable moment from working on some of Hollywood’s biggest productions and television shows over the past 20 years, he responded,  “getting a call from Rosemary Children Services (a non-profit organization) and being asked if I could help them out by writing, directing and producing a commercial for the cause of neglected and abused children.” He gladly accepted. The title of the commercial? “Everybody Has A Dream”. 

Executive Producer: Garrett Grant

Garrett Grant is the talented producer behind the movies Justin Bieber’s Believe, Rock of Ages, Going the Distance and Step Up Revolution. As a long time executive producer, Grant has successfully overseen crowd-pleasers such as Bedtime Stories, Hairspray, Old Dogs, The Pacifier and Cheaper by the Dozen 2. Prior to those films, Grant collaborated with directors Bobby and Peter Farrelly on the films Stuck on You, Shallow Hal, Osmosis Jones, Me, Myself & Irene, There’s Something About Mary, Kingpin, and Dumb and Dumber. He also served as Co‐Producer on Like Mike and Say It Isn’t So, and as Line Producer for Pitch Perfect 2,  Search Party and The Locusts. Born into a movie industry family,Grant began his career as a child actor on the television series Father Murphy and Little House on the Prairie. He entered the production side of the industry age 18, working in several different capacities before emerging as a producer.

Producer/Director: Pamela Harris


Pamela Harris is the executive director of Iris Films, a non-profit media company based in Oakland, California that has produced award-winning documentaries for over 30 years, including the Academy-Award nominated Long Night’s Journey into Day.  Pam has an extensive background in media as a documentary director, producer, editor, and outreach and engagement professional. In 2013, she was a Fulbright grantee working in Uruguay on a documentary about Afro Uruguayan history and culture. She is dedicated to social justice and has worked with a broad spectrum of communities and causes, including physically and developmentally disabled adults, affordable housing residents, low-income artists, and rape survivors. Pamela holds a Bachelor of Arts in Sociology from Vassar College and a Masters in Journalism with a focus in documentary film from the Graduate School of Journalism at UC Berkeley.

Producer: Aerielle L. Nisson

Since joining the team in 2014, Ms. Nisson has played a key role in the development and supervision of broadcast negotiations and brand integration for the series. She also is responsible for campaign execution and brand identity. With a rich career history encompassing over 20 years, she brings a diverse set of business experience in marketing, advertising, brand management and new business development. She’s led multi-functional teams in highly successful campaigns for a variety of multi-million dollar clients. Additionally, during 2012 she created an orchard restoration program that engaged community volunteers and corporate teams to work and learn about agriculture, while donating the food grown to the local emergency food network through OC Food Access Coalition. She maintains a strong presence in the local non-profit community supporting urban agriculture, food education, and equality for all living things.


What Happens If You Don't Raise The Funds For The Series?

If we do not receive the required funds to make the series, a two-hour special or a pilot, then all donations, minus administrative expenses, will be donated to a non-profit organization dedicated to the promotion of girls' softball.

Spread The Word. Share With Others.

Unable to contribute? It's okay. Please share the link with others. Your voice matters. Your sharing matters.  Simply use the Indiegogo tools to help get the word out. Thank you!

this campaign  today. Fastpitch World believes its time to show the world of the talent and tenacity  in today's female youth sport program in a positive way on TV. We hope that we can count you in. In
 order to get the show on television, we are responsible for all the 
costs associated with making the series. This is the fastpitch' 
community's series.  
This production will not happen without your support. Make a tax-deductible contribution by February 28, 2015, and help get Fastpitch World on television. 

Iris Films is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization and all
donations are tax-exempt to the fullest extent allowed by law. Founded in
1976, Iris Films is dedicated to producing and distributing documentary
films that creatively addresses contemporary social issues. 
The organization
promotes an artistic and story-based approach to social issue filmmaking, while
also upholding the highest editorial and production standards. Its
award-winning films include In the Best Interests of the Children, We
All Have Our Reasons, Skin Deep, and Long Night’s Journey Into
Day, the Sundance Best Documentary award-winning and Academy-award
nominated film about South Africa’s Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Iris
Films engages multiple distribution networks, from HBO and PBS to domestic
non-profits and international NGO´s, to reach audiences and issue stakeholders.


Taylor Mcquillin (OC Batbusters). Gatorade Player Of The Year.


What does it
takes to become a top female athlete? How about winning an athletic scholarship
to a top-ranked college?  These female
athletes are not professionals, they are amateurs, not older than 17 years old
- attempting to pursue higher education through athletics.  The very few who make it to this level of
competition and recognition will have endured disappointments, failures, and
hardships that remain hidden to all but their closest family. These are
inspiring stories of strict discipline, daily sacrifice, and enduring courage.


Taylor and her DadWhat Do We See In The Series
Witness the sacrifices, the discipline, the commitment, the desire to succeed. These are not your average athletes. These are today's female warriors, determined to beat the odds, to play the gamer they love, with hopes of a promising future through a higher level of education.  
Go inside the minds of some of the top nationally recognized coaches and see how they mentally,
physically and psychologically prepare each player for that next big game. Be in the action and capture some of the best competition in the country. Go behind the scenes and capture the training and overcoming adversity.  Follow another girl, a pitcher who overcomes
being blind in one eye and deaf in one ear to become Gatorade Player of the
Year. 

Girls' competitive fastpitch softball is one of the fastest growing sports in North America. Fastpitch World  takes viewers inside some of the nation’s top fastpitch teams
to see first-hand what it takes to become one of the leading teams in the
nation.  Be a part of the
journey. Be a part of the experience in “Fastpitch
World".
The Players and The Teams- Season 1
Faith Canfield-So Cal AthleticsFastpitch World is currently seeking for those players and teams who will make up our 1st season's line-up. Fastpitch World will feature
some of today’s top female fastpitch players, through different walks of life,
defining the odds, to play the game they love without any guarantee of the
outcome. What Kind Of Teams and Players Are You Looking For?We are seeking for teams who have a reputation for winning and those players who display the COMMITMENT on being the best they can be. A DISCIPLINE that transfers on and off the softball field. Willing to SACRIFICE, for the love of the game and display's GOOD CHARACTER.  When Will You Select The Teams And Players?Once funded, we will begin to select for the remainder of our casts.  Fastpitch World will include players from various divisional aged groups (12u, 14u, 16u, 18u). Team confirmations and player selections will be confirmed once series is funded and casting is completed. How Can We Include Our Player Or Team? 
If you would like to be featured for season 1, let us know 
by writing to us at fastpitchworldteams@irisfilms.org. 

What If we Don't Get Selected To Be On The Series? 

If you are not selected in season I, you may still be eligible to share your story through our website and/or our YouTube site. 
The Gallery
Make sure to take a peek inside The Gallery to see the LATEST videos on what coaches, parents, players and fans are talking about Fastpitch World. 




Let's Get This Series About Girls' Sports on TV!


Alabama's-Halie McCleney

This television documentary series will include five episode in this first season, with each episode
being 60 minutes long. We are looking to be on-air in summer 2015. Once the
 fundraising campaign has finished, we will begin 
production. We will film in California, Colorado 
and New Jersey. Our shooting schedule is based on the 2015 fastpitch schedule. We
 plan to go into production in May 2015 and complete our filming by July
 2015. 
Why a Series About Fastpitch?



It's exciting to watch. It's suspenseful. It's fast-paced. It's 
compelling. It's unpredictable. It's competition like you have never 
seen. 

Your contribution to this campaign will help the sport and its 
dedicated athletes reach the next level of awareness and opportunity.  
These girls are training six days a week for a chance to get a higher 
education. They hit home runs, turn double plays; they dive and will 
bare hand a hard hit ball and will throw a runner out. They are 
fearless. They are today's female warriors. 


The series has been in development for approximately two years. Our goal was, and is, to provide the community a series they can be proud of. We have witnessed the sacrifice, commitment and discipline of the players, parents and coaches - on a daily basis. In order for this show to happen, we need the community to support this effort. There are approximately 5 million girls playing fastpitch softball in the United States. With your support, this series can be a reality. Are you up for the challenge? We think that you are. 
Our Thank You for Your Support 


So Cal Athletics-PGF ChampionsMake a donation, and be among the 
first to sport season-one FASTPITCH WORLD limited-edition perks: 
t-shirts, water bottles, travel mugs, baseball caps and visors, 
backpacks, posters and autographed softballs.  Become a supporter and 
show the world that you were there from the beginning and said YES to Fastpitch World and YES to girls fastpitch finally getting some well-deserved attention on television! 
 Come on board to help get this first-ever, action-packed, competition 
series on air. The show will keep you on the edge of your seat all the 
way to the very last pitch, and you'll be glad you were among those who 
made it happen. 

Why Fundraise With Indiegogo?
Kaitlyn Lim-Irvine StingOur goal and vision is to increase 
the awareness of the physical skills, commitment to excellence and 
dedication these fastpitch players display on a daily basis - on and off
 the field. Together we can make it happen. For our girls. For our athletes. And for this sport. Sincerely,
Louis SimonSeries Creator and Executive Producer
Where Does The Money Go?
All donations will be implemented into the development, pre-production, physical production expenses, which includes location, crew, equipment, insurance, marketing, offices and post production.  
Donations will NOT BE USED for any other purpose but to produce the series itself. 


Production Budget Breakdown
Here is how the donations will be used: Development   4% Pre-Production and Production  51% Post Production  40% Marketing  5% Indiegogo Fee  9% (-25%
discount for 501c3 status). If our goal is met, that fee is reduced to 5% fee.
The Production Team




Our development team's relationships and experience in the 
entertainment industry and non-profit sector is bar none - from top films to television 
network shows and important documentary work. Fastpitch World will be visually stunning, rich with compelling personal stories and commanding of a wide and dedicated audience.
Series
Creator: Louis C. Simon



Lou’s work began as a professional actor, but his dedication
to media making and the film industry drew him to work as a casting director,
stuntman, writer, technical advisor, stunt coordinator, director, producer and
head of production. He has 100 + professional credits to his name as a film and
television maker. When
asked to name a memorable moment from working on some of Hollywood’s biggest
productions and television shows over the past 20 years, he responded,  “getting a call from Rosemary Children
Services (a non-profit organization) and being asked if I could help them out
by writing, directing and producing a commercial for the cause of neglected and
abused children.” He gladly accepted. The title of the commercial? “Everybody
Has A Dream”.  

Executive Producer: Garrett Grant





Garrett Grant is the
talented producer behind the movies Justin
Bieber’s Believe, Rock of Ages, Going the Distance
and Step Up Revolution. As a
long time executive producer, Grant has successfully overseen crowd-pleasers
such as Bedtime Stories, Hairspray, Old
Dogs, The Pacifier and Cheaper by the
Dozen 2. Prior to those films, Grant collaborated with directors Bobby and
Peter Farrelly on the films Stuck on You, Shallow
Hal, Osmosis Jones, Me,
Myself & Irene, There’s
Something About Mary, Kingpin, and
Dumb and Dumber. He also served as
Co‐Producer on Like Mike and Say
It Isn’t So, and as Line Producer for Pitch Perfect 2,  Search Party and The
Locusts. Born into a movie industry family,Grant
began his career as a child actor on the television series Father
Murphy and Little House on the Prairie. He entered
the production side of the industry age 18, working in several different capacities before emerging as a producer.
Producer/Director: Pamela Harris

Pamela Harris is the executive director of Iris Films, a non-profit 
media company based in Oakland, California that has produced 
award-winning documentaries for over 30 years, including the 
Academy-Award nominated Long Night’s Journey into Day.  Pam has
 an extensive background in media as a documentary director, producer, 
editor, and outreach and engagement professional. In 2013, she was a 
Fulbright grantee working in Uruguay on a documentary about Afro 
Uruguayan history and culture. She is dedicated to social justice and 
has worked with a broad spectrum of communities and causes, including 
physically and developmentally disabled adults, affordable housing 
residents, low-income artists, and rape survivors. Pamela holds a 
Bachelor of Arts in Sociology from Vassar College and a Masters in 
Journalism with a focus in documentary film from the Graduate School of 
Journalism at UC Berkeley.Producer: Aerielle L. Nisson



Since joining the team in 2014, Ms. Nisson has played a key role in the 
development and supervision of broadcast negotiations and brand 
integration for the series. She also is responsible for campaign 
execution and brand identity. With a rich career history encompassing 
over 20 years, she brings a diverse set of business experience in 
marketing, advertising, brand management and new business development. 
She’s led multi-functional teams in highly successful campaigns for a 
variety of multi-million dollar clients. Additionally, during 2012 she 
created an orchard restoration program that engaged community volunteers
 and corporate teams to work and learn about agriculture, while donating the food grown to the local emergency food network through
 OC Food Access Coalition. She maintains a strong 
presence in the local non-profit community supporting urban agriculture,
 food education, and equality for all living things.
What Happens If You Don't Raise The Funds For The Series?

If
we do not receive the required funds to make the series, a two-hour special or a
pilot, then all donations, minus administrative expenses, will be donated to a
non-profit organization dedicated to the promotion of girls' softball. Spread The Word. Share With Others.
 

Unable to contribute? It's okay. Please share the link with others. Your voice matters. Your sharing matters.  Simply use the Indiegogo tools to help get the word out. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

SEE-W (Social Empowerment by Empowering Women)  is  a non-profit organization established  in Kathmandu Nepal to work for women empowerment through economic independence and skill enhancement. 

Vision: Inspiring positive change to our society by empowering women and eliminating gender biased issues.

Mission: To help fulfill the basic needs, education & rights of women and excluded   and also to encourage these women to become agents of change within their own households, communities & beyond.

Project Overview:

SEEW Nepal and SAFECITY India did a joint study on documenting sexual harassment and abuse in public spaces in and around Kathmandu. The research proved that women were mentally physically and emotionally affected which had an impact on their wellbeing. The data was like this:

Physical abuse ie. Groping, touching, rape, etc

72%

Verbal abuse ie. Commenting

31%

Non verbal ie. Staring and whistling

21%

Sexual violence by a known member

29 cases

Chain snatching & robbery

6 cases

Taking pictures without permission

22 cases

Cases on public bus/micro bus / tempo

131 cases

The country is in transitional stage and  the Justice system is very slow and complicated .We don't have Fast track court.Even if a crime like rape happens the justice to the victim and punishment to the perpetrators will be very slow. Therefore interim solution is women only transport.

Pink Bus is a campaign in Nepal to enable women and girls to go about their daily life with dignity and safety. The Pink Bus project is buses driven by women, for women.
Yes, ideally we all want to fight for our space and own it- why a separate bus??? I too find myself thinking... but even as larger social forces get balanced, let us enable environments that empower women and girls to get to work, to school, to their daily jobs easily....

Women who are harassed everyday have low self esteem and are confidence less; to empower women we must make them confident first, and let them travel safely. It's not a segregation rather it's a campaign for safety and security of women who are in need for such safe transportation system. SEEW launched it's first bus for service on 8th March,2015.Now the bus is run by a male driver for a time being because we could not find  lady  driver . We are still looking for Lady drivers however we have found two female conductors who will be in direct contact with the woman and girls off/on the bus while collecting the transport fares from the women passengers. By the end of this week the second bus in the same route will be ready. We have further plans of extending this service to the chakra- path-this is a round route around Kathmandu valley which will benefit thousands of women everyday who use public transport. This initiative will deprive sex starved males from fondling and touching females unnecessarily and free the females of the psychological trauma of such embarrassments and harassment. In future, Also women with less education, skills and access to resources will be benefited economically when we train them as drivers & conductors and this transport industry can  be change and  will be improved  dramatically for the betterment of society.

Project Result

Ø Harassment free public transport

Ø Empowering women Economically

Ø Utilization of women for women's cause

Ø Comfortable/Safe ride for women from home to work and vice versa


What We Need & What You Get

We will get started with the US$ 10,500/- with two Buses  and we have a modest goal to gradually move on to a fleet of 10 Micro Buses once the project is initiated with the initial funding. 

More than 500 women/girls will be benefited daily and will be out of risk from sexual and other harassment that is ongoing in the public transport system of Nepal. Women Drivers will be directly employed and several women will learn the driving skills and will be provided with self sustainable livelihood schemes.

Of the total earnings 50% will be spent for the further expansion of the 'Pink Bus Project';25% will be spent for skill  enhancement and development; 15% will be spent on Children (girl child) education and the remaining 10% will be spent to foster micro enterprises via micro credit systems.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can connect us with people and donors to help our organization grow and have financial sustainability. We focus on Menstrual Hygiene, Sponsorship for girl child Education, Economic and social Empowerment of women please  use the Indiegogo platform to transform lives and please spread the good cause. thank you.

livelihood schemes.

Other Ways You Can Help


You can connect us with people and donors to help our organization grow and have financial sustainability. We focus on Menstrual Hygiene, Sponsorship for girl child Education, Economic and social Empowerment of women please  use the Indiegogo platform to transform lives and please spread the good cause. thank you.

story:
As a child growing up my family would take the long drive to our Grandparent's home, where my Aunt lived next door.  I adored my Aunt; she would love it when my sisters and I did her hair and make-up.  Then we would play music and dance the afternoon away, at least until our weekly family dinner was ready.  We always knew she was different, but we didn't care.  She was always kind to us.

As we became older we became more aware of how adults talked about my Aunt. We would hear our people refer to her as "Crazy" or when she was away she was at the "Crazy House". One incident I remember clearly was when she attacked my aunt, there did not seem to be any reason for the provocation but it took both my father and my uncle to restrain and calm her down.  Once it was over me and my sisters were told to go play like it was just some normal occurrence.

Years later I discovered, when my Aunt was in her 20s and they were all living in New York City, she and a group of "friends" went out for a night on the town.  None of us know what actually happened but they said when she returned home her hair was a mess, she was scratched and bruised, and did not want to talk or hear about it.  No matter how much she wanted to discount it, this event seemed to be the trigger to her mental illness.  An illness my family would rather deal with by pretending things were normal, this event did not happen, and she was just “crazy”.

This is not so unique to just my family; I see it in every city across this country.  People sitting on the sidewalk, in doorways, and  camped out in alleys are someone's aunt, uncle, parent, cousin, sister, brother, and child.  When I watch the news, I see the stories of tragedy and I ask what could have helped make the outcome of those stories different... my answer AWARENESS.


SYNOPSIS

Queen Victoria Brooks is a single mother of a teen-aged daughter in middle class America.  She is an accomplished scientist about to receive her well-earned doctorate degree.  However, behind the mask of all her academic and career successes, Queen Victoria's biggest nemesis is one that she and her family try to keep hidden safely behind closed doors -- her mental illness.

Queen Victoria has stopped her treatment and has refused to take her medication.  Consequently, her life spirals out of control and the pain that she causes her family is almost unbearable and can no longer be hidden.

Let’s Erase the Stigma!


WORKING TO CHALLENGE THE STIGMA OF MENTAL ILLNESS...

We want “Queen Victoria’s Wedding” to impact ALL communities.  Mental illness has no race, gender or political affiliation.  It is a health condition, as is diabetes, cancer or having a heart attack.  In some, lack of treatment is a factor in homelessness, incarceration, and episodes of violence, victimization, suicide or more severe clinical outcomes.   The results from the 2013 National Survey on Drug Use and Health: Mental Health Findings reports that 1 in 5 Americans lives with a mental illness.  Of the nearly 44 million people with mental illness in the U.S., 55 percent of them went without treatment last year. While “Queen Victoria’s Wedding” shows the experience of a family dealing with mental illness, we know there are universal aspects of this film that will touch and help all communities.


THE FILMMAKER

B. J. Rouse has written, directed and produced several award-winning short films.  She was a recipient of both the Kodak and the Panavision New Filmmakers Grant.  She is currently a member of the Writers Guild Independent Writers Caucus.  BJ was one of twelve writers selected from thousands of submissions nationwide for the prestigious Guy Hanks and Marvin Miller Screenwriting Program at the University of Southern California. 

Award Winning Films:

“Billie" -- Premiere screening at the Pan African Film Festival in Los Angeles, Best Short Film at Denver World International Film Festival

"Queen Victoria's Wedding" (short) -- Honored at BHERC's (Black Hollywood Entertainment Resource Center),  Sistah's Are Doin it for Themselves, NC Black Film Festival

“Are You Looking" -- Best Special Effects & Award of Merit at the Los Angeles Cinema Festival of Hollywood, 2012 Midnight Black International Festival of Darkness, 19th Annual African American Film Marketplace and S.E. Manly Short Film Showcase, nominee for Best Horror Film at 2012 Director's Circle Film Festival.  


WE NEED YOUR HELP...

As we all know, making a feature film isn’t cheap, even if ours is considered low budget.  Yes, $2 million dollars is considered EXTREMELY LOW BUDGET and that doesn’t include all the costs of post-production (editing, music composition, color correction, etc.).  Unfortunately, My friends and I have yet to win the Lottery. 

That’s where you come in. 

Your contribution helps us cover our shooting expenses. 

These cost below included not only pay but include onset rentals, equipment (camera, grip, & electric), make-up, wardrobe, craft services, trucks rentals, locations, security, insurance, and other fees.



Additional Ways You Can Contribute:

· Use the Indiegogo share tools!

· Follow us on Twitter or Facebook

· Tell your Friends, Family, Co-Workers, or Strangers in a Coffee Shop about our campaign.


Help us #EraseTheStigma of Mental Illness.




Help us Trend on INDIEGOGO

USE THE SHARE BUTTONS

Spread the word!

story:
Kids At Risk Action has partnered with Minnesota Public Television to address the rights, education, and well-being of at-risk children.

Hi,  I'm Mike Tikkanen, long time Hennepin County volunteer guardian ad-Litem, Founder of Kids At Risk Action (501c3), and author/speaker on children's issues. 

KARA'S Public Television Expose/Documentary partnership is bringing awareness and change to the thousands of abused and neglected children that go without help in our communities each year.  

KARA has delivered this message in person and in print to many communities over the years (including a presentation at the United Nations). This televised opportunity will reach tons more people and have much more impact.  

Best of all, long time American news anchor and investigative journalist and winner of Emmy and Peabody awards Don Shelby is advising us on the project.  The protection of all children, is to his mind, the responsibility of all adults.

Core issues;

  • Mental health and *coping skills – if not delivered in the home they must come from the community.  Help KARA bring wellness to children, lower crime, empty prisons, and make schools and our communities happier and more productive.  
  • Our institutions today are creating exactly what they were designed to stop.  Child protection services workers are seeing the fourth, fifth, and sixth generation of abused and neglected children re-entering the system with their own dysfunctional families (because they don’t have the mental health* coping or parenting skills to do otherwise).
    *Dr Read Sulik’s definition of Mental health is “the ability to cope in one's own environment.”  Traumatized children often lack these skills.
  • Committed and hardworking people doing the work cannot meet the needs of children they serve - the traumas abused children have experienced exceed training, resources, and capacity of foster/adoptive families and the institutions trying to help.  
  • Political neglect and lack of public awareness keep things the same. 

The documentary will blend experts and stories from children, families, and people involved in the lives of traumatized children.  KARA is highlighting the work of The Academy on Violence and Abuse, Safe Passages For Children, CASA, the Youth Law Center, foster and adoptive parents, court and justice workers and administrators along with children who are in or have passed through the child protection system.

Kids At Risk Action believes that once more people know how our institutions are failing our children, change will happen, and the cycle of abused and neglected children having their own families of abused children will be broken and all children can grow up to lead productive lives.  Schools will graduate more students, prisons will become empty, and streets will become safer.


For more information on KARA visit our website; www.invisiblechildren.org

KARA seeks one hundred and twenty eight thousand five hundred dollars to fund this project.  The cost breakdown appears at our site under "About Us"

Major donors will receive televised recognition, all donors will be recognized, and our book, INVISIBLE CHILDREN will be sent to all donors of $50 or more.

Share this online and with your friends, write to us at our blog, and consider inviting KARA to speak at your next event.

Thank you, 

Kids At Risk Action

info@invisiblechildren.org

story:
Short Summary

A loyal Italian father must defend his son who has inadvertently sparked a mob war between Sicilian and Albanian crime families in New York.  


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are pursuing a $4mil budget. 
  • We need to raise AT LEAST $40,000 in order to get BESA the exposure necessary for big producers to consider investing in us.  


The Impact

The BESA script has won the following awards:

WINNER: BEST SCREENPLAY / 2012 NY/LA International Film Festival
WINNER: BEST ACTION SCREEPLAY / 2013 Bloody Hero International Film Festival
WINNER: BEST ADAPTED SCREENPLAY / 2012 First Look Project (Script Pipeline)
WINNER: BEST SCREENPLAY, ALOHA ACCOLADE / 2012 Honolulu Film Awards
WINNER: BEST SCREENPLAY, SILVER AWARD / 2012 California Film Awards


Risks & Challenges

We have already invested over $20,000 and created a mood reel, investment portfolio, pitch deck, business plan, key art, logo, and production budget breakdown.  We need your help to get to that next level!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this link along to others that may consider helping us reach our goal.  Whether Albanian, Italian, mob film fanatics, or simply fans of great movies - anyone can contribute to help us deliver this film to the movie-goers around the world.

story:
THE PLOT

BLACKOUT is told in fragments of magical illusions that possess Addy, an aspiring photographer with an unhealthy fixation. Beginning in the cabin where the crime takes place, Addy experiences a mental lapse causing fantasy and reality to blur. With her darkness manifesting itself into a demonic figure, Addy is unable to think clearly, resulting in a total blackout.

                                                                    THE CONCEPT

BLACKOUT is both a short movie and an experiment in extended music videos. With dialogue taken out of the picture, we aim to tell a surreal tale exploring dark and obsessive themes while limiting our sound to a newly released music album (BLACKOUT by Stanford Mixed Company) played from start to finish.

                                                                        THE IMPACT
By creating this film, we want to promote the music video's importance as an art form. Perhaps more significantly, BLACKOUT will serve as the first album-length music video tied to the a cappella genre, one that is gaining timely importance. (Pitch Perfect 2 will be released later this year, and The Sing-Off Season 3 winners Pentatonix won a Grammy at the 57th Grammy Awards after achieving platinum recording status in December.)
                                                                  WHAT WE NEED
We are very close to making BLACKOUT a reality! However, we need your support to complete and release this work of art for independent movie enthusiasts, music video viewers, and a cappella fans like you. These are the types of costs that have been draining our pockets:
  • Transportation (flights, gas)
  • Filming locations, including a Lake Tahoe cabin ($223)
  • Props, including detective board supplies ($30)
  • Costumes, including a latex fox mask ($36)
  • Equipment, including professional-grade tungsten lights ($30 each)
  • Distribution and hosting
To reward you for your help, we're providing perks, including autographed material and an executive producer title! That being said, contributions of all sizes help and we greatly appreciate them.
                                                     OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you don't have any money to spare, please consider sharing this Indiegogo page or the BLACKOUT website to spread the word! Thanks!
