story:
What is APAIT?

The Asian Pacific AIDS Intervention Team (APAIT) is a community-based organization that has been caring for Asian and Pacific Islanders (API) and other communities of color living with or at-risk for HIV/AIDS. Since 1987, APAIT has become the largest comprehensive API AIDS service organization in Southern California. Alongside HIV Testing, we provide access to a wide array of supportive services. APAIT is a division of Special Service for Groups (SSG), a non-profit human service agency that was established in 1952.

Who is APAIT?

At APAIT, we strive to improve the health and overall well-being, as well as to address the health disparities, among APIs and marginalized communities living with or at-risk for HIV/AIDS through our culturally competent and linguistically appropriate programs. We welcome anyone who walks through our door and aim to provide the best quality services with respect, compassion, and integrity.

We offer walk-in HIV testing, case management, support groups, mental health counseling, outpatient substance abuse treatment, and housing assistance. APAIT programs have successfully led to improved social support, mental health, and access-to-care among individuals living with HIV/AIDS; improved risk reduction among participants in HIV prevention and substance abuse treatment; and reduced stigma related to HIV among minority groups.

 “APAIT’s approach has always been holistic. They treat the person, not the disease.” – Mario, client


For over 28 years, APAIT continues to practice its core value of commitment to advocate for our clients and the community.

One of our goals as an organization is to serve hard to-reach clients. With HIV testing technology developing rapidly, APAIT strives to reach underserved individuals and to meet them where they are or feel most comfortable. Last year, APAIT identified a higher proportion of newly diagnosed individuals (with a 2.55% seropositivity rate) as compared to countywide testing (with a 1.19% seropositivity rate). Nonetheless, our ability to test off-site is limited due to our inability to secure private testing spaces. Alongside this, there are multiple barriers that prevent individuals from getting tested: (1) It may be hard for some individuals to take time out of their week to go to a health center. (2) Others may be scared of the stigma associated with HIV/AIDS, which may cause them to not want to be seen at a health/testing center. (3) There are individuals who simply have never thought about getting tested. 

In order to address these barriers, we feel that our next step is to invest in a mobile testing van. This will allow us to expand our ability to provide HIV testing services to communities that are at greatest risk for HIV. Early detection will save lives.   

We are currently looking at a 2014 Ford Transit Connect Cargo Van to utilize as our mobile testing unit. The van has optimal space for us to retrofit to our needs in order to provide mobile testing. 

Here’s the breakdown of what the $30,000 will go towards:


Mobile testing will encourage people to test more frequently, as we provide HIV testing beyond our storefront to the communities most in need. APAIT will be able to reach areas that have high infection rates, such as Skid Row - an area of Downtown Los Angeles inhabited by a dense population of homeless people. APAIT will also be able to serve populations that have low testing rates. The API population, for example, currently has a 33% testing rate, which is the lowest amongst any ethnicity. From 2001 to 2008, HIV diagnosis rates were higher for APIs than any other racial/ethnic group, as the rates for other racial/ethnic groups declined during that time span. Since then, the number of HIV diagnosis rates has remained stable, but still is considered relatively high given the low percentage of individuals getting tested within the API community. Within the transgender community, less than 1% of the population get tested (Source). This is concerning since a recent study led by Dr. Stefan Baral, Director of the Key Populations Program in the Center for Public Health and Human Rights at Johns Hopkins School of Public Health, determined that transgender women are 49 times more likely to contract HIV.

Our mobile testing van will also serve as a vehicle for outreach and allow us to reach individuals who otherwise may not know about our free community services that include mental health counseling, substance abuse treatment, housing assistance, and social services navigation.

According to the Los Angeles County’s Division of HIV and STD Programs, there are roughly 9,500 individuals that are infected with HIV in Los Angeles County, but are unaware of their status (Source).

Within the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) estimates there are 1.2 million aged 13 years and older living with HIV, including nearly 168,000 (14%) who are unaware of their infection (Source). Not knowing one’s status can lead to more harmful repercussions. Those who remain unaware, remain untreated, and do not practice preventative measures, run the risk of spreading the infection. Moreover, treatment is costly; in 2010, it cost $23,000 a year to treat an HIV positive person (Source). APAIT aims to reach the undiagnosed HIV positive population in hopes of providing the support needed for these individuals to successfully access and stay in medical care, as well as to increase the number of virally suppressed individuals, which will ultimately decrease the infection rate.


So how is this project beneficial to you?

Since the beginning of the epidemic, HIV has directly affected millions of lives. You may not have HIV, nor may be aware of anyone that has HIV, but HIV is more common than you think. People can live with the virus for a long period of time without showing any signs of infection and may spread it unknowingly. By knowing one’s status, people can make conscious health decisions regarding their health and in doing so, the health of others. Join us in taking the necessary steps to help prevent the spread of HIV and to provide treatment for those who are living with HIV/AIDS.

Here at APAIT, we recognize that the struggle expands across communities. Thank you for helping us not only save lives, but also improve the quality of lives. Don’t forget to know your status and to help others know theirs too! 

“I have been HIV positive for 28 years. I should be dead by now, but because of the help from APAIT, they have kept me alive and I greatly appreciate it. The reason why I appreciate it is because of the wonderful staff who helped me with medication, counseling, and referrals. I will always be indebted to them for the rest of life.” – Rodney, Client


Perks

To better help you, here are visuals on what some of our perks look like! First, we have the $100 donation containing Status is Sexy material, plus a #accesstostatus pin.


This is our $500/$1000 donation perk, where you'll receive APAIT branded materials, including some from various program. These perks also come with tickets to our wine tasting event in April.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is my donation tax-deductible?
Yes. APAIT is a division of Special Service for Groups, Inc., a 501(c)-3 non-profit organization. Your donations are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

What if you don’t reach your goal?
APAIT is committed to having a mobile testing unit, which is why if we do not meet our goal, we plan to have various fundraisers to support the amount donated on Indiegogo.

How do I get my perks?
If you ordered a perk during the campaign, we will be shipping your items by the end of June 2015. For donors who ordered wine tasting tickets, we will be following up with them shortly after their donation to ensure the tickets arrive before the event. As for large-scale donors who donate towards a PSA, photo shoots, counseling/testing room, or logo placements, we will be updating and working with them after the completion of the campaign to fulfill the perks. If you have any questions about the perks, feel free to contact jaseno@apaitonline.org .

How can I find out more about APAIT’s future events?
Be sure to follow us on Facebook and Instagram (@apait_ssg) for updates and posts about our upcoming events. For more information, contact ayakan@apaitonline.org.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about our campaign to your family, friends, and social networks! Use the Indiegogo share tools (underneath the campaign video) to post on Facebook, Twitter or directly e-mail individuals. If you post on social media, don’t forget to use #accesstostatus!

You can also help by donating to our pantry closet, in which our underserved clients can access. Items that we are looking for are non-perishables, ready to eat foods (cans & microwavable), and toiletries (toothpaste, laundry detergent, shampoo, etc.)

Or simply, get tested!

story:
The Awakening Project is a series of four short films: The Fallen, Sky People, Origins and Awakening, that together comprise a feature-length film about around the mystery and conspiracy theory of UFO sightings and covert government projects. The series combines fantasy with real life mysteries such as the Roswell UFO crash site, Area 51, the Wow signal, the German Nazi device called “Die Glocke” (the Bell), experimental spacecrafts, and advanced bioengineering project. In The Awakening Project, a unique story unfolds and audiences will immerse themselves in a world filled with possibilities. 

The Fallen introduces Cassandra Cruz, a young woman who experienced an encounter with what she believes to be a UFO and now has an unstoppable hunger for the truth about UFOs. In her quest, she attends an “Anonymous Alien Abductees” meeting and is introduced to Richard Reyes, a man dedicated to the same goal. Together they investigate and dig into far depths to uncover a complex network of cover-ups, government secrets, and public denials. They will have to question their own beliefs and discover a new insight into the mystery of the UFO conspiracy.

Name: Cassandra Cruz          Age: Mid 20's          Eye Color: Brown

Cassandra Cruz is an independent and unafraid to to confront authority. She travels the world visiting ancient civilizations, attending university lectures, and visiting UFO societies in hopes to be enlightened of the truth about the alien encounter she experienced in her childhood.

Name: Richard Reyes         Age: Mid 30's          Eye Color: Brown

Richards Reyes is forced to retire after reporting an alleged UFO encounter while working for the United States Air Force, he is a analytical and measured. He believes that such events are perpetuated by the government and their covert experiments against their citizens.  

Name: Deep Throat         Age: Mid 60's          Eye Color: Brown

An educated and cautious man. A former member of the government black operations that secretly work on experimental bioengineering trials and aerodynamics. He is a key element for Cassandra and Richard's investigation, providing them clues that will bring them closer to the truth. 

Historical Fact: Deep Throat is a real person, a former FBI agent and secret informant during the Nixon administration. The character has appeared in Sci-Fi novels, movies and TV shows.

Alexander Rodriguez, Writer-Director:

Rodriguez earned an MFA in Filmmaking at the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles, where his work has been showcased in Warner Brothers Studios as well as several festivals including the Cannes Film Festival (Short Film Corner), the International Puerto Rican Heritage Film Festival and The Rincon Film Festival. He is a graduate in physics from the University of Puerto Rico at Mayagüez. He is proficient in editing, graphic design and visual effects.  He has been developing The Awakening Project over several years and is the heart and soul of this series. 

Director's Statement:

I have always had a great passion for science and mystery. As a kid, I would devour scientific books, science-fiction novels, and TV series such as “The X-Files”.  One of the stories that I remembered from my childhood was about a local Puerto Rican family that went missing, never to be found again. I remember my father telling me of this event as drove through the countryside of Puerto Rico. He stopped by a house that had extraterrestrial-looking statues by the garage and told me that the family that lived there had been abducted by aliens. According to the locals, the whole family disappeared one day, and the police never found their bodies. They had vanished without a trace.

I developed this project as part of my Masters Thesis in the MFA in Filmmaking I earned  at the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles. Currently, I am raising $10.000 to shoot and edit the first installment of the series. It is not easy to collect the necessary funding in order to bring this story to life on my own. Any dollar amount will help me realize my goal. Even if you are not able to financially support the project, you can still help it by spreading the word around on social media sources like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. By doing this, you will help bring traffic to our crowd funding campaign and help us achieve the $10,000 goal. I will be greatly appreciative any of your support!

The aim is to captivate the attention of viewers within a diverse market while spending in the most practical ways as follows:

Here is how:

  • By using the most affordable, top quality camera and equipment.

  • By seeking discounts on locations, wardrobe, props and production design items.
  • Recruiting talented and like-minded crew willing to work for a minimum rate.
  • Utilizing the filmmaker's extensive knowledge and experience in digital work which will allow extensive savings on costly special effect expenses.
  • Filmming in Los Angeles offers a wide variety of landscapes, allowing to shoot the entire story within a very small area and to save in travel and lodging expenses.

Distribution of $10,000 first installment funds

Los Angeles is known for its diverse landscapes and easy access to a variety of locations; from vast deserts, to city streets. As the capital of the cinema industry, it is also filled with talent of all kinds, rental houses for props and set design, and great actors. After two years in film school, I can now say that I know enough skilled people in order to be able to pick the best of the best for this ambitious project. I have the knowledge and the experience to make this a success, all the way from pre-production to distribution.

Pre-Production:

Once funding  for THE FALLEN is secured, locations and crew will be secured and casting will get underway.  Currently, the filmmaker is scouting locations to recreate the specific landscape of Roswell, New Mexico. Los Angeles is known for its diverse landscapes and easy access to a variety of locations; from vast deserts to city streets. It is filled with talent of all kinds, rental houses for props and set design, and great actors.  All these resources will be utilized.

Production:

THE FALLEN will be shot in five days and in four different locations.

Post-Production:

During Post Production, all of the raw footage will be transformed into a high quality film.  The first step will be cutting the scenes together, adding digital effects, mixing sound and music, all to match high quality visuals with equally polished audible elements.

Films are stories told in sound and images, through framing and colors. By shifting colors, their intensity, or the exposure of the picture, a filmmaker creates nuances in the way a story is perceived by viewers. 

For “The Fallen”, a soft but dark tone will be used with an emphasis on shadows for the surroundings. The harsh, dark shadow will allow for a deep picture that instantly tells the audience that something mysterious is involved. The strong contrast will help to create an intriguing look. 

Below are some examples of the look and color palette to be used.

                                    

What’s next:

This first short has to be seen as a proof of concept, which will then allow us to aim higher and execute the remaining three installments. Once the entire series is created, we will be in a position to promote the series through different web content platforms such as Amazon Prime, Hulu and Netflix. 

In order to guide particularly selective audiences towards us, we want to first generate some interest by running the festival circuit. Some of the international festivals we intend to submit to promote science fiction content.  They are:

- Athens International Sci-Fi & Fantasy Film Festival: Athens, Greece

- Trieste International Science Fiction Film Festival: Trieste, Italy

- Festival Internacional de Cinema de Catalunya: Sitges, Spain

- Neuchåtel International Fantastic Film Festival: Lund, Sweeden

- London International Festival of Science Fiction: London, England

- International Horror & Sci-Fi Film Festival: Scottsdale, Arizona

- Rincón Film Festival: Rincón, Puerto Rico

- Cinefiesta: San Juan, Puerto Rico

The recognition we gain through festivals we allow us to attract a wider audience and additional funds for the remaining three installments.

Risks & Challenges

Unfortunately, if the $10,000 goal is not reached, production of the pilot title The Fallen that serve as an introduction to The Awakening Project web series will cease, that is why your help is crucial for this project. It is not easy to collect the necessary funding in order to bring this story to life on my own. Even if you are not able to financially support the project, you can still help it by spreading the word around on social media sources like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. By doing this, you will help bring traffic to the crowd funding campaign and help us achieve the $10,000 goal. I will be greatly appreciative all of your support!

                                                          E Pluribus Unum 

                                                         (From Many, One)
story_txt:
The Awakening Project is a series of four short films: The Fallen, Sky People, Origins and Awakening, that together comprise a feature-length film about around the mystery and conspiracy theory of UFO sightings and covert government projects. The series combines fantasy with real life mysteries such as the Roswell UFO crash site, Area 51, the Wow signal, the German Nazi device called “Die Glocke” (the Bell), experimental spacecrafts, and advanced bioengineering project. In The Awakening Project, a unique story unfolds and audiences will immerse themselves in a world filled with possibilities. The Fallen introduces Cassandra Cruz, a young woman who experienced an encounter with what she believes to be a UFO and now has an unstoppable hunger for the truth about UFOs. In her quest, she attends an “Anonymous Alien Abductees” meeting and is introduced to Richard Reyes, a man dedicated to the same goal. Together they investigate and dig into far depths to uncover a complex network of cover-ups, government secrets, and public denials. They will have to question their own beliefs and discover a new insight into the mystery of the UFO conspiracy.Name: Cassandra Cruz          Age: Mid 20's          Eye Color: BrownCassandra Cruz is an independent and unafraid to to confront authority. She travels the world visiting ancient civilizations, attending university lectures, and visiting UFO societies in hopes to be enlightened of the truth about the alien encounter she experienced in her childhood.Name: Richard Reyes         Age: Mid 30's          Eye Color: BrownRichards Reyes is forced to retire after reporting an alleged UFO encounter while working for the United States Air Force, he is a analytical and measured. He believes that such events are perpetuated by the government and their covert experiments against their citizens.  Name: Deep Throat         Age: Mid 60's          Eye Color: BrownAn educated and cautious man. A former member of the government black operations that secretly work on experimental bioengineering trials and aerodynamics. He is a key element for Cassandra and Richard's investigation, providing them clues that will bring them closer to the truth. Historical Fact: Deep Throat is a real person, a former FBI agent and secret informant during the Nixon administration. The character has appeared in Sci-Fi novels, movies and TV shows.Alexander Rodriguez, Writer-Director:

Rodriguez earned an MFA in Filmmaking at the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles, where his work has been showcased in Warner Brothers Studios as well as several festivals including the Cannes Film Festival (Short Film Corner), the International Puerto Rican Heritage Film Festival and The Rincon Film Festival. He is a graduate in physics from the University of Puerto Rico at Mayagüez. He is proficient in editing, graphic design and visual effects.  He has been developing The Awakening Project over several years and is the heart and soul of this series. Director's Statement:I have always had a great passion for science and mystery. According to the locals, the whole family disappeared one day, and the police never found their bodies. They had vanished without a trace.I developed this project as part of my Masters Thesis in the MFA in Filmmaking I earned  at the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles. Any dollar amount will help me realize my goal. Even if you are not able to financially support the project, you can still help it by spreading the word around on social media sources like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. story:
Summary 

This film's main purpose is to alleviate discrimination against people with learning differences. I need funds for three things...

  • Equipment 
  • Advertising
  • Distribution to Netflix and other streaming services 

Why?

You may be asking, "why should I contribute to this?" The answer is simple. Discrimination against those with learning differences is a real problem. You will also be providing resources resources for future films. 

The Impact

This will help solve one of the many problems in this world, as well as providing us with the resources to make future films for much less money. 

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is that we only get a $2000 and that would set us back another year but we will still make it and get it distributed no matter what.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money just advertise to people that do, it will help a lot. 

  • Advertise 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

You can help make #123, this dramatic, short film about a girl whose two world's collide, bringing her psychosis out of the shadows.  Amy's thrill seeking mischief has moved from misdemeanor to capital crime.   She's ready to make her mark.

The #123 team comprises a talented and hard working group.  The Director of the film, Ian Jones,  is creative and visionary, drawing off his own experiences in Film and Theater as an actor, producer, stage manager, costume designer,  and props designer.  He will be working closely with our Director of Photography before and during the shoot and our Editor in post-production to ensure his vision of #123 is fulfilled.  "This is an important project," says Jones, "too often we go through life oblivious to the people around us.  #123 is a potent reminder of the interconnectedness of human beings and points at our universal need for acceptance."  

It is our hope that #123  will also create a discussion about the significance of traumatic brain injury and mental illness.  Amy is an extreme example of what can happen when illness goes untreated.  

What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce and market #123, it is our goal to raise $10,250.  Many talented people are donating their time and equipment to help create this film.  

1/3 of the money raised will be set aside to market the film and send the film to over 100 film festivals around the globe.  The remaining 2/3 will be used to hire professionals that will create art, design sets, design wardrobe, provide hair styling and make-up for the talent, produce lighting, produce film, produce and record sound, and the all important editing in order to bring it all together.  

For our generous contributors to the film, we will offer some rewards which include

  • A behind the scenes look at the making of the film including photos, videos, and real time notes from cast and crew during the shoot
  • A signed #123 DVD
  • Invitation to a private party for Sneak Preview of the film
  • The highly sought after Brain Scan T-Shirt
  • Your name in the #123 Film Credits

The Impact

  • You will be a part of the creation of a film
  • You will help create work for artists in Maine
  • You will provide the opportunity for an actress to play her first lead role in a film and for a Director to go solo for the first time.

Risks & Challenges

This dedicated and tenacious team can overcome any obstacle to make and market #123.

  • If our funding goes over our goal, the proceeds will be used to increase marketing and get wider reach so #123 can touch more people.
  • If our funding falls short of the goal, we will still make and market #123.  Our team is dedicated and ready to make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you cannot afford to donate any money to #123 and that's ok, you can still help our team achieve it's goals:

  • Tell your friends about our campaign.  A search for "Fund-123" on Indiegogo will bring up our campaign. Here is a link  http://igg.me/at/Fund-123
  • Share our videos and fundraising campaign using Indiegogo's tools for Twitter, Facebook (www.facebook.com/123TheMovie), and other social media. 
  • Ask your friends and family to share our video and campaign
  • You are the most powerful voice for our success.  With your help, #123 will go from paper to video, and around the world on an electronic web created by you.

story:
Help us fight back

My name is Naser, and I'm an angry citizen of India, a country where crime is on the Rise and Justice for Citizens rarely happen. Along with a group of Friends who share the same feelings, We are Fighting back by starting an app that will give every citizen a chance to avoid being a Victim of everyday crimes. 

With this App, we hope to create a strong community and with just a push of a button, have willing and able citizens come to the rescue of a person in need in the near by vicinity.   


What We Need & What You Get

  • The Funds that we Receive from the people will go Into Developing a High Quality Application for everyone to use(Free Of Cost| for IOS and Android).  
  • Creating a Youth Based Community to help create awareness and help fight back
  • By funding this project, you are helping all the people who care about what's happening in our country and want change. 
  • If the funding falls short, we will still work on an application(of a lesser quality) and work towards building a large Community. 


The Impact

The world needs more Heroes, and the only way that can happen is if we join together as one. As a strong community, we could make a big difference.                    A difference that this country deserves. Its on us to make it happen. 


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by spreading the word and sharing the Project on social media sites to help more people gain awareness. 

  • Help by Sharing the video link to tell people about the project
  • Make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to get more people to visit our page.


APP IN DETAIL 

  1. This app will work sort of like Tinder but just in a way that ppl in near by locations will be notified of someone being in trouble and the victim can rate how severe the situation might be. You could also help a person that you see in trouble by Pushing the button for them on your phone. 
  2. What we will incorporate in this app is, if People go to the rescue of person in need, that person (once the stuation has been handled) can then add a rating to your profile to show his/her appreciation. And this rating will stand out in your Profile and every month the people who helped out the most will be featured on the App and will receive some goodies from us.  
  3. There will be notifications on the app to spread awareness of incidents that had taken place and how to avoid or help prevent them, and also to give you locations where incidents have happened and help you stay away from areas that might be dangerous.

story:
Purpose

As a self-financed film, Carla was a labor of love, sweat, and heart. After all the work and dedication that went into creating this film, our biggest hope is to have the story mean more than 90 minutes on a screen. 

Carla's Story

Carl(a), starring Joslyn DeFreece and Laverne Cox, is the story of a trans woman who is being dejected from her family while seeking the means to complete her transition. Carla (DeFreece) meets Sam, a man who loves her for who she is, but when Carla gets the funds to complete her transition sam has second thoughts about their relationship. Now Carla must choose between being herself, or being some she wasn't for someone else. 

"I was so excited about this film because this is a very real story I have seen time and again over the years with people in my life but have never seen it told in a film so truthfully," Laverne Cox in an interview with Huffington Post.
"Groundbreaking trans-themed film" -   

While this film has become a film festival success, we are promoting this limited release to raise money for The National Center For Transgender Equality organization.





What We Need & What You Get

While Carl(a) is only one woman's journey, we hope to use it to propel our goal to help raise awareness and funds for a wonderful charity that promotes education and change for the transgender community. 

  • Every donor who contributes a minimum of $10 to the cause will receive a password for a streaming HD link to an exclusive view of the film Carla. The link will be given at the end of the campaign and will be accessible for an entire week.
  • We are working closely with the cast and crew of the film to bring you more and exciting rewards for your higher contributions towards the cause, so please stay tuned and spread the word. 


Risks & Challenges

The last few years have brought about change, understanding, and gains for the rights of different races, genders, and sexual orientations. There is still a lot of work to do, particularly for the transgender community who are often misunderstood and demonized. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We truly thank you for taking the time to check out our Indiegogo page, but please don't think your support has to stop here. Check out our charity of choice (National Center For Transgender Equality) and learn how you can impact real lives and change. 

Follow along with our campaign's success and premiere events using the hashtag #CarlaPremiere.

story:
THANK YOU to all who have donated to our dream so far! We are so grateful and psyched to get going on this project! We are just over the $10,000.00 mark and that's awesome! BUT we still need help to reach our goal! 

We have 15 days left of our campaign. With another $9,000.00 we will be able to make our series IN FULL and get people watching! 

If you haven't already thought about donating, don't think about it just do it! Right now! The button is right there! 

If you HAVE already contributed, THANK YOU! What you can do now is SHARE! Remind people what a great project this is and why you're involved and why they should be too! 


                     

Long time New Yorkers and best friends, Jess and Dakota end up back in their home town for very different reasons. The one thing they have in common - they’re broke. Dakota is a fast talking, hard-edged Brooklyn artist with a soft side. Jess is a writer grappling with what it means to be a woman in a very male driven industry. Back in the small New England town they grew up in, the two learn that you can try to escape your problems, but they always come with you. Laughter really is the best medicine in this comedy about friendship, going back, growing up, and learning how to be alone...together.


                           

Dakota will explore her issues with perfectionism and helicopter parents. She will have to face her reliance on her sexuality, and will be challenged when she meets a person who just might be worth having more than just a physical relationship with. 

                            

Jess is close to the success she’s always wanted, but her emotional walls make it hard to break through in her writing. A serial monogamist, she is single for the first time and desperately trying to stay that way. A friend from her past resurfaces and makes that particularly hard for her. 

Throughout the series, the women will try to get their heads above water financially by running (and almost ruining) a town fundraiser, cleaning a dead man’s apartment, hosting an Airbnb that goes horribly awry, and, the ultimate vocation of an artist, waiting tables.

The show is exploring love in all forms: platonic, romantic, and self love.


                     

The title is a play on words, referring to the fact that Dakota and Jess are perpetually alone (together) and perpetually in debt, a predicament common among those walking the line between gen X and millennials.

An element of the series is also examining what it means to be a part of a generation that tells you to pursue your passions and then puts a stigma on not being financially independent by a certain age. The show aims to explore the dichotomy of “follow your dreams” and “pay off your loans.”

                     
Loaners has truly been a group effort. We have so many people working with us and supporting us. We can't wait for you to come on board!  




                      

We are hoping to make an 8 episode (10 minutes each) first season. Here’s how we are planning to do that:


Check out our list of awesome perks to see how becoming a part of our team can get you some cool swag. There's something for everyone! Or gifts!



Co-creator Arielle Jessop has created some one of a kind pieces for the campaign. Perfect for holiday gifts, friends gifts or a just a plain old any time gift to let someone know you love them. They come in the from of signed and numbered artist prints, t-shirts, note cards or mugs !  

And this custom poster signed by the cast and creators could also be yours! 

Check out the REP-A-LOANER perk option to see how you can get your hands on your very own Loaners collectables! 

                     

We want more than anything to produce a show that is true and meaningful to the viewer. Audience connection is what we’re all about. The feels, if you will.

The characters are flawed and human and just trying to figure it out like the rest of us. The difference is that they’re lucky enough to have a person to do it with. But will their friendship get in the way of them pursuing their goals and possible love interests?

Stories are all about connection and we want to tell a story that you, the viewer, can connect to. We are not stopping at Season One – we're planning on making multiple seasons and submitting the show to festivals and, the ultimate goal, getting picked up by a network! By donating now, you'll be a part of the grass roots of that process! 


                 

Collaboration is a key element to crowdfunding. That’s why we want to hear from YOU.  We want to hear your stories - tell us about going home, turning thirty, or just being human! The most important thing for us is that the series is a collaborative effort, so we are counting on you!

                 

If your bank account would make even Dakota and Jess blush, there’s another way to help out - SHARE this campaign! Every eyeball counts, so if you’re excited about this show, please Facebook, Tweet, Tumble, Insta and Reddit us to anyone and everyone you know!

Melissa and Arielle haven’t slept in six months and are the happiest they’ve ever been, bringing this show to your computer screens. Donate a dollar so these ladies can hire a producer and take a nap.


THANK YOU SO MUCH! WE LOVE YOU!
FIN.
story_txt:
THANK YOU to all who have donated to our dream so far! We are so grateful and psyched to get going on this project! We are just over the $10,000.00 mark and that's awesome! BUT we still need help to reach our goal! We have 15 days left of our campaign. With another $9,000.00 we will be able to make our series IN FULL and get people watching! 
If you haven't already thought about donating, don't think about it just do it! Right now! The button is right there!

story:
We are some people who have alot of experience in different parts of filmmaking, and have grouped up to make some really great movies. We have made one movie at this time and are working on our second. We have learned alot from the first movie, and are really excited to continue our work and show what we are capable of now. 

The new movie is a sequal to the first one. The story is around a new member of the swat team joining the special unit SAEF. It will be the epic conclusion of a gunblazing story, and the SAEF team needs to be alert to all dangers.

The support from you  will be spend on things like props to make the movie much more realistic and allround better. It will also be spend on traveling to locations, to give the movie the best look in its scenes.

Join our facebook fan site: https://www.facebook.com/Squares-Studios-147641...

story:
Short Summary

Corrections Corporation of America, or CCA, makes a huge profit off of locking up people and even entire immigrant families.  Now, this deplorable company with a history of inhumane treatment and a plethora of human rights violations has set its sights on winning an 80 YEAR contract with Dallas County.

Several years ago, CCA was kicked out of Dallas after repeated violence and ignorance of human suffering occurred at Dawson State Jail (nicknamed Texas' Worst Jail). However, a decision is set to be made this month that will determine whether or not CCA is allowed back in Dallas until at least the year 2095.

The Impact

We cannot allow such medical negligence and profiting off of vulnerable humans to happen under our watch. Until now, CCA has received very little pushback and has been allowed to amass a billion-dollar operation that relies on keeping as many people locked up for as long as they can. CCA needs to hear the voice of the people rising up to say NO MORE. Not on our watch.

For some perspective on our campaigns:
Last year, citizens of Dallas County and concerned folks around the country banded together to organize against the Securus contract in Dallas County. This contract was set to eliminate in-person visitation in the jail, in favor of a for-profit video visitation system. We spearheaded this effort to defeat the corrections phone giant Securus, but your direct involvement and coming out to show support is what really turned the tide and allowed a victory for all families and loved ones of inmates. This
grassroots movement eventually turned into statewide legislation!

Now, we have an even bigger battle to face. Please partner with us as we work to defeat CCA's agenda with our county.

About Organize Justice

Josh Gravens is the Executive Director of Organize Justice. He is also a Soros Justice Fellow and formerly worked as the Chair of Texas CURE. During his youth, Josh was incarcerated for 3.5 years in the Texas juvenile justice system (TYC). He now uses his unique background and understanding of the inner workings of the system to network with policymakers and officials, and advocate for change within the justice system.

Josh frequently speaks to groups in Texas and around the country, sharing his story, challenging perceptions, and showing others how they too can make a difference. He has also contributed as a writer or been the subject of numerous publications.

Under the heading of Organize Justice, Josh's small and growing team work to restore involvement in the democratic process to citizens who have become disenfranchised by the criminal justice system.

Organizing such groups of people takes unceasing passion, a whole lot of effort, and consistent resources in order to effectively mobilize citizens (who may not have an understanding of how they can be involved in truly affecting change for their local communities). Your support is invaluable in helping maximize our efforts to empower citizens and, collectively, fight mass incarceration giants.

We Need Your Help to Stop CCA!

Please donate today. Your tax-deductible donation will allow us to more effectively STOP and organize against the proposed CCA contract for Dallas County halfway houses and potential detention centers being built.

Risks & Challenges

The truth is, we are fighting back against a massive entity. However, we believe that by leveraging media strategies, public input forums such as Commissioners Court, and community engagement of allied citizens, we can make a real difference and draw attention to the larger issue of mass incarceration.

This campaign is really the beginning of a larger movement to both educate the public about the travesties of the incarceral system and how it affects our whole community, and rally newly-informed citizens to help change policies and STOP the steamrolling by huge, for-profit prison companies.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Share on Facebook and Twitter. If you aren't able to give, please help us spread the word by posting this link on your social media accounts. The public at large needs to know what CCA is doing, and what citizens can do to let their voice be heard.

2. Live in Dallas? Join our Facebook event here.

3. Live out of town? You can still make a difference! Sign our petition here. Your voice counts!!

story:
Update:

We have enough for a launch already, and Tercer Milenio Mexico is coming on board January 11th, 2016 to kick in funding.  I am confident that we will reach our goal.  That said, keep contributions coming, we are now aiming for a U1.5 Cubesat with command ability through GlobalStar :)

___________________________________________________________________________

First, what our Sat is capable of:

Ionized radiation: we have a scintillation counter, that enables us to measure the various radiation in our satellites environment.  This is significant as it enables us to detect high energy particles, radiation, and other phenomenon.

Cameras: we will use two cameras with parabolic lenses, giving us a clear 360 degree view around our satellite.

Radar: while this is a hope, but may not be feasible, we would like to have radar capabilities on our sat.  Mini radars do exist, but they are a very new technology, so it may be difficult to get our hands on it.  Radar would give us another tool for measurement, and would be among the first radars in space.

If we raise enough funds, maybe we can get a radar on our sat, and have the ability to concretely verify objects in space.

Regardless of radar, our radiation detection and imagery will give us enough to verify high energy emitting objects in space.

Our Team:

Costs:

Mission Objectives

  • Build a 2U CubeSat to search for anomalies in Low Earth Orbit

  • Must be capable of receiving command and transmitting telemetry and mission data down.

  • Experiments include:

    • Real-time magnetometer observations

    • Real-time geiger counter observations

    • On-orbit HD image capture of surrounding Low Earth Orbit

      • Capable of taking images in 5 second increments

      • Transmitting images down and release images to public raw(untampered/unedited)

      • Capable of coarse pointing accuracy
      • Global Shutter for capturing moving objects

LT Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System Board

  • 32-bit AVR flash microcontroller featuring 512KB Flash, 68KB SRAM

    • Running OpenSAT FreeRTOS, lightweight multitasking architecture

  • Redundant µSD storage (2x 8GB)

  • Real Time Clock

  • On-board Temperature Sensor

  • 4x External Temperature Sensor(user mountable)

  • External(from µController) On-board Watchdog

  • USB Bootloader

  • Virtual USB for easy Debugging

  • On-board Inertial Measurement Unit - Magnetometer, Gyroscope, Accelerometer

  • Compatible with CMOS(UART) camera(TBD)

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC Flight Radio/Educational Radio

  • Compatibility with NSL: NearSpace Launch Inc. Eyestar Duplex Modem

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC OpenSat Educational Payload Board

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC Magnetorquer Board

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical Interface

LT Battery Pack

  • Li-Ion Battery Pack

  • Utilizes four 18650 series battery cells

  • 10000 mAh Capacity

  • ~7.4 V voltage Range

  • Temperature Sensors

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

LT Magnetorquer Board

  • 3-axis magnetic torque rod system

  • 3-axis magnetometer

  • Coarse Control Pointing

  • Three actuators; two torque rods and one air core torquer

  • Current Sensors for each torquers

  • Telemetry over I2C

  • Detumble up to 3U

  • Direct analog control of actuators with direct PWM signal

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System

LT 1U Flight Solar Panel

  • 22% cell efficiency

  • Coarse Sun Sensor -ADC

  • Temperature Sensor

  • Protection Diodes

  • Voltage: ~12v

  • Current: 104mA

  • Power: ~ 1250 mW peak

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC 1U, 2U,3U Chassis

LT Flight Imager Payload Board

  • BeagleBone Black header connector

  • BeagleBone Black with 8GB SD card included

  • Geiger Counter

  • 3MP CMOS Sensor Color Camera

    • 35mm lens/F1.9

    • Camera Mount included

    • 25.8 fps

    • Global Shutter for capturing moving objects

    • Rolling Shutter for low-noise, high-contrast images

    • Near InfraRed version with twice the infrared sensitivity

  • OpenSat Payload Software Package

    • JPEG Compression

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

LT 2U Flight Chassis

  • AL 6061

  • Tight Tolerances TBD

  • Detachable Side Panels

  • Kill-switch mechanism

  • PC-104 compatible

  • 94mm x 94mm PCBs

  • Compatible with NSL’s Eyestar Duplex Modem

Now, on disclosure:


For the past 70 years, the topic of extraterrestrial intelligent beings and UFO's has been controversial, if not ridiculed.  Despite many sightings and events, government, military and media have made a strong attempt to discredit the idea of extraterrestrial "aliens".  And in the face of their apparent "disbelief" of the topic, the same military and governments have spent huge amounts of money secretly studying these "ridiculous" UFO's and aliens. Thanks to freedom of information, and the actions of many with first hand experience, thousands of documents, witness testimony and data have surfaced, making the ridicule posed on ufology by media and governments seem staged and forced, with a very secret intent.

To name a few reasons why this topic is important, and why it must be subjected to rigorous scientific study:

1) Countries are beginning to release highly classified documents proving their governments interest in aliens and UFO's.

2) Hundreds of highly credible witnesses have come forward with testimony that at least some UFO's are verifiable alien technology.  These witnesses

include a former Canadian Defense Minister, numerous astronauts, high ranking US military officials, pilots, ... Well, I could go on and on, but instead

I will provide a few links for those of you interested in learning more:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Center_for_the_Study_of_Extraterrestrial_Intelligence

http://www.siriusdisclosure.com/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7vyVe-6YdUk

http://www.citizenhearing.org/

https://www.youtube.com/user/CitizenHearing

What our project aims to do, is to use a low orbit satellite, controlled by us individuals, to study potential objects that emit high energy radiation.

Maybe we'll get data readings and pictures of solar-flare caused auroras.  Maybe we'll capture images of some very interesting meteors.  And maybe we'll actually capture a verifiable craft.  All we can do is try, and by doing this our way, we can open-source the data to you, the individuals.

Perks:

Our CubeSat T-shirt:

Data (get login benefits and real time data):

Join the Team (sit with us and build the CubeSat):

Visual Breakdown of the CubeSat:



* Perks will be distributed after campaign is finished.  Some perks, such as real-time data, will be available once cubesat is launched, whereas others, such as the t shirt, will be sent out as soon as funds are released by indiegogo and the items are aquired.

include a former Canadian Defense Minister, numerous astronauts, high ranking US military officials, pilots, ... Well, I could go on and on, but instead
I will provide a few links for those of you interested in learning more:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Center_for_the_Study_of_Extraterrestrial_Intelligence
http://www.siriusdisclosure.com/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7vyVe-6YdUk
http://www.citizenhearing.org/
https://www.youtube.com/user/CitizenHearing
What our project aims to do, is to use a low orbit satellite, controlled by us individuals, to study potential objects that emit high energy radiation.
Maybe we'll get data readings and pictures of solar-flare caused auroras.  Maybe we'll capture images of some very interesting meteors.  And maybe we'll actually capture a verifiable craft.  All we can do is try, and by doing this our way, we can open-source the data to you, the individuals.

Our CubeSat T-shirt:




Data (get login benefits and real time data):

Join the Team (sit with us and build the CubeSat):






Visual Breakdown of the CubeSat:












* Perks will be distributed after campaign is finished.  Some perks, such as real-time data, will be available once cubesat is launched, whereas others, such as the t shirt, will be sent out as soon as funds are released by indiegogo and the items are aquired.

story:
KASCON 27 in New York City, March 2016

KASCON, the largest gathering of Korean-American students in the US, is returning for its 27th conference in New York City. The conference will be held in various venues in Manhattan on March 18 - 19, 2016, reviving a legacy that has touched the lives of thousands of Korean-Americans for decades. 

*This is our first batch of speakers being revealed to the public! Please check "Updates" for more info.


Korean American Students Conference (KASCON)

KASCON is the largest and oldest ethnic student conference in the nation. Since its inception at Princeton University in 1987, KASCON has been held 26 times, bringing together 500 to 1000 Korean-American students every year. KASCON has been the birthplace of international organizations like Liberty in North Korea (LiNK), and have attracted top leaders like Harold Koh (former US Dept. of State Legal Advisor), Michelle Rhee (former Chancellor of DC Public Schools), Paull Shin (Washington State Senator), and more. 

- universities that have hosted KASCON

KASCON 27 - Representing a New Generation

Thousands of Korean-American students gathered over the past 30 years to discuss the issues of Korean-American identity, culture, history, and the Korean-American role in broader American society. The 90s and 2000s were a time of self-discovery, as Korean-Americans came together to find out what it meant to be Korean-American at a time when very few industry leaders throughout society were of Korean background, and when the Korean-American identity was not definite or prevalent in the mainstream.

The social status of Korea and the Korean-American community has shifted immensely just within the past 20, perhaps even 10, years. Now, students have many different Korean-American leaders in government, law, finance, business, entertainment, the arts, and much more to look up to. Korean culture has permeated throughout America and around the world, and the Korean-American community has become a driving force of bridging the two worlds.

Why KASCON 27?

We believe in the power of sharing the same space and time with someone you admire, someone you aspire to be like. Especially for students--minds filled with uncertainty, hopeful optimism, doubt, all in one--being able to meet world-class leaders and to have the opportunity to engage with them is truly life-changing. Of course, passionate students who come together for such an experience will create meaningful, lifelong friendships as well.

Through KASCON 27, we hope to not only revive the legacy of the conference that has bonded so many Korean-Americans in the past, but also create a gathering through which students can absorb the insights of global leaders and forge valuable relationships.

Help us make KASCON 27 into a reality!

We are a group of NYU undergraduate students organizing the conference and raising funds for all expenses. A high-quality conference bringing world-class Korean-American leaders and passionate undergraduate students requires many parts, including:

  1. Venues for Opening and Closing Events, as well as for seminars/workshops
  2. Hotel rooms for students and speakers from outside the NY area
  3. Transportation arranged and covered for speakers
The above is the list of our biggest expenses, and we are expecting the following prices:

*chart only shows estimates of major expenses, based on current price estimates & past KASCON expenses

We chose $8,000 as our Indiegogo campaign goal in order to raise the minimum initial costs needed for KASCON 27. We will be approaching both individual and corporate sponsors for the remainder of the expenses, but all funds raised beyond $8,000 will go into covering Speaker Transportation and Hotel expenses. We will update you on how the money will be spent!

To express our gratitude for your support, we have created numerous perks so you can truly be a part of this journey. Thank you so much for supporting us!

Were you a past KASCON organizer or attendee?

Please share our campaign (http://igg.me/at/kascon27) with friends who have shared the KASCON experience with you! Your support is critical to reviving a strong KASCON alumni network, so we can continue to support each other.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please "like" our Facebook page to keep up with updates regarding KASCON 27 and its progress! Facebook: www.facebook.com/kasconference.
We are also on Twitter @kascon27 and on Instagram at kascon27.

For individual or corporate sponsorships larger than the tiers listed, please contact Tae Young Woo, KASCON 27 Executive Director at info@kascon27.com.

story:
Our upcoming short film, CORNERED, highlights the desperate need for smarter gun laws in the US. 

Based on a true story, CORNERED follows Bernice Bowen, whose partner, Hank Earl Carr, went on a violent killing spree in 1998. Carr killed three police officers and Bowen’s three-year-old son with guns he was easily able to obtain, despite his extensive criminal record. He ended the rampage by taking his own life. Bowen was arrested and sentenced to 21 years in jail as an accomplice to the horrific crime, for failing to inform officers that Carr was a convicted felon. 

We've partnered with the International Action Network on Small Arms, Stop Handgun Violence, and the Newtown Action Alliance to make CORNERED a reality. 

We plan to shoot our film in October 2015, but we need your support to make it happen. With your help, we can bring this vital message to audiences around the world.

Monetary Donations

We are looking to raise $50,000 for CORNERED. The process of quality filmmaking often incurs higher production costs, and our goal is to communicate this story as vividly and authentically as possible. The funds raised for CORNERED will be used entirely for the production, completion and distribution of the film. This includes:  

  • Equipment rental costs and shooting locations. A portion of the finances raised for CORNERED will be used to cover equipment rental costs incurred from securing the camera, lights, audio equipment and more. We plan to shoot CORNERED digitally, on a high-definition camera with professional lenses to ensure a high level of quality and detail in our footage.  We will also be acquiring permits and scouting for various shooting locations. It is our hope that every element of production will help elevate the quality of CORNERED and immerse the audience in the world of the film. We emphatically believe in the talent of our crew to accomplish that task. Therefore, it is important for them to have access to quality equipment throughout the production.
  • Distribution. After the completion of the film, we intend to submit CORNERED to festivals around the world, and hold joint screenings with our nonprofit partners.
  • Post production. Editing, color correction, sound, musical score... there's a lot of work to be done in the editing booth after our final day of shooting! We want to make sure CORNERED looks and sounds polished before we premiere it on the big screen.
  • Provide food and hire actors and crew members. We would like to provide fair wages for our working actors and crew members, who will be lending their talents and skills to the project. Whether in front of the camera or behind the scenes, each person working on CORNERED plays a valuable role in the completion of the film.  We want the set of CORNERED to be a comfortable working environment for our talent, and this includes ensuring that they are fed well and compensated for their work. 
Filmmaking is expensive, but we believe a story like CORNERED deserves to be told. This is a big goal, and we know we can achieve it with the help of Indiegogo's passionate donors.

To show our appreciation for your donation, we're giving out some amazing thank you gifts, including:

  • Digital downloads of the film
  • Executive Producer and Associate Producer credits
  • Set visits
Take a look at our Perks section for even more!

Sixth Sense Productions is a film and television production company based in Los Angeles, CA. We tell engaging, meaningful stories with mainstream appeal. Our CEO, Richard Harding, has over a decade of experience in the film industry and was involved in projects such as HOTEL RWANDA, which went on to heighten public awareness of the Rwandan genocide. He also produced the award-winning film THE FIRST GRADER. With CORNERED, we seek to inform and entertain the public while advocating for stricter and safer gun laws, and empower individuals across the globe to take preventative measures against gun violence.

Cameron Barsanti - Hank Carr
Cameron has been featured on SCANDAL and TRUE BLOOD, as well as starred in  films such as BE, WET CIGARETTES and THE NEMESIS BIRD. He recently starred in  Sixth Sense's short film BLUE ON BLUE. 

Erin Way - Bernice Bowen
Erin is best known for her roles in THE COLLECTION, DUSTLAND and DOONBY. She has also appeared in GREY'S ANATOMY and AGENTS OF S.H.I.E.L.D.

Richard Harding - Director, Producer
Richard is a passionate film Producer who was involved in HOTEL RWANDA and produced THE FIRST GRADER. He produced and directed the short film BLUE ON BLUE. Richard is also the founder of the nonprofit organization End Malaria Now, which donates thousands of mosquito nets annually to Africa to prevent the spread of malaria. 

Check out a clip from Richard's previous directorial work, BLUE ON BLUE:


Denise Tran - Co-Writer, Producer
Denise worked as an Associate producer on THE FIRST GRADER and was instrumental in bringing it to audiences around the world. She also wrote and produced the short film BLUE ON BLUE. Denise also serves as Co-Founder and CFO of End Malaria Now.

Chris King - Co-Writer
Chris is an award-winning writer and director of films such as BIRTHDAY and THE KILLING OF MARY SURRATT, among others. 

Lars Lindstrom - Cinematographer
Lars has an MFA in Cinematography from the Art Center College of Design. Check out some of his breathtaking work here: 


Greg Mazzola - Line Producer
Greg worked with Sixth Sense on BLUE ON BLUE. He has also worked on other films such as A QUIET KIND OF LOVE and UNDER THE ELECTRIC SKY

Kevin Doucette - Composer
Kevin is an experienced film score composer who has worked on acclaimed films like MILLION DOLLAR ARM and THE HUNDRED-FOOT JOURNEY. Kevin also composed the score for BLUE ON BLUE. 

Vicente Perez - Editor
Vicente worked with Sixth Sense on BLUE ON BLUE. His previous credits include CAMBIO DE SENTIDO, HADA, and JET-LAG. 

Greenhouse Post - Sound
Our sound will be done at Greenhouse Post, who recently worked on BLUE ON BLUE. Previous credits include THE SHIELD, BEER LEAGUE, and THE ROOKIE. 

Can't donate, but still passionate about CORNERED and its message? Wonderful! You can help us by spreading the word about our campaign. We are on Twitter at @cornered_film, and there's a link to our Facebook page below; tag us in your posts and make some noise about gun safety!

Thank you very much for taking a look at our campaign. And look out for "Cornered" in 2016!

story:
Synopsis

Now and Then is a love story about Mallika, a South Asian woman living in America. When someone from her past catches up to her, she finds herself reliving old memories and making the tough decision to share and discuss her past with her husband and daughters.

Now and Then is a “passion project” because the team is made up of professional and aspiring artists between the ages of 13 to 55 years old. These people have come together to create their own opportunity to showcase their talents. This team is set up so each aspect of the film has a mentor-student relationship. The professionals can teach techniques and give guidance through their experience while the debutantes can learn and offer fresh and innovative ideas. Now and Then started out with 2 people but has quickly grown into a family of over 100 artists- all volunteering their time, talent, and resources to complete this passion project!

All of our production was done in New Jersey, USA. The film was shot on a Red Scarlet Camera with 4K Resolution and all still photography was done using HD-DSLR cameras.

“Although inspired by Indian cinema, Now and Then portrays the universal emotion of love and showcases the timelessness of the emotion through two generations. As a film written and directed from a female perspective, Now and Then also touches upon the double standards that women may experience regarding the dating culture, even in today’s modern world. These double standards force us to think twice before sharing our stories. We were aiming to bring all the glamour of an Indian film- the music, dance, drama- without that 3 hour time commitment or language barrier. We hope this film is relatable for people from various cultural backgrounds and ages.”

-Mohitha Sripathi- Taken from the Director’s notes

          Our Official Teaser will be released Wednesday, August 12, 2015!!


Where does Now and Then stand in the crowd?

  • East meets West- Now and Then portrays the lives of Indian-Americans, both first and second generation. It allows for the audience to watch and possibly relate to how communities from world-over relate and adapt to American culture, while still incorporating their traditional thoughts and fusing cultures in essence. In addition, Bollywood singer, Shaan, teamed up with NJ based singer and songwriter, Lisa Bouchelle to sing an original sound track for the film.

  1. See some of Shaan’s previous work- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmydM5R4RSI

  2. See some of Lisa’s previous work- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=etgrrsKbNn4

  • Educational- “Now and Then” is set up so each aspect of the film works as an educational platform. Half our team is comprised of debutants while, the other half is made up of professionals. Throughout this creative process, the professionals and debutants have worked together to learn, grow and create this movie.

  • Musical- We have 3 original soundtracks along with choreographed dance sequences, which is typically uncommon for a short film! The lyrics are a mix of Hindi and English. 

  • 100% Real Passion- Now and Then is a community effort- we have brought together raw talent and local businesses from the NJ/NYC area to help further this project.


Collaboration: Uplift Humanity & Now and Then              

Uplift Humanity and Now and Then have collaborated! Why? It's simple! Both teams focus on volunteers, education, and teamwork. Our teams consist of volunteers who spend their time working towards their passion. Along with that we focus on education strongly and there's no better way to learn than having a hands on experience on set while being guided by mentors and experienced individuals. Finally, the most important aspect to any large project is teamwork! Teamwork is what keeps a large scale project from falling apart and it is the hard work of the whole team that has brought us this far! So now you can see how the team of Now and Then and Uplift Humanity have a similar foundation. 20% of all funds raised through this campaign will be donated to our friends and partners, Uplift Humanity India.


Budget                  

CXC Productions is a creative platform bringing like-minded individuals together to pursue their passions. We are now seeking monetary support so we can see Now and Then through it’s post production stage.

  • Bringing a team of film editors, sound engineers and marketing strategists on board = $4,000

  • Getting the best equipment possible for score composition, sound engineering, and ADR; (200 for ADR 300 engineering)= $500

  • Marketing the film, it’s music, and team on appropriate platforms = $1,000

  • Completing our film festival submission process - $700

  • Contingency (remastering, re-mixing, more studio sessions)- $1240

We need to raise a total of $7,440 in order to complete our project!

*20% of all our fundraising money will be donated to Uplift Humanity India.


Risks and Challenges!             

There is no business like show business! The art of filmmaking is the ambiguity that lies ahead as there are a host of unique risks for every cinema that often goes unnoticed by the common audience- Now and Then is no different. We have tried our best to reduce the risks by spending a lot of time in our pre production stages. Even with ample planning, we were faced with a series of financial burdens- food, accommodation, and insurance for equipment, to mention a few. Luckily, we were able to get through both the pre production and post production stages with the help of our friends, family and local businesses. Now, as we enter the last phase of our film, we need your support!

Your contribution will help us showcase a project that we have worked very hard on but will also help spread awareness of the unspoken stories most South Asian women face, even today, in regards to the dating culture.


Our Team

Director: Mohitha Sripathi- Her passion for film began at a very young age. Although she has no formal training in filmmaking, being on the sets of “Now and Then” has given her real life experience which cannot be matched by any course or certification. This story was written from her personal experiences and observations and marks her directorial debut. She plans to submit this project to various film festivals which target the South Asian crowd as well as other demographics and use the learnings from this project to better her next! She plans to pursue an MFA in the near future.  

Producer: Rome Chopra- He has been highly active and involved in the arts since his younger days. From filmmaking, to dancing, to acting, to singing, Rome has dabbled in many aspects of performing arts and the skill set he has developed over the years is relevant to the Indian film industry. At this point in time Rome wants to complete his education and obtain further education so he can increase his job prospects and leave himself open to explore his creative ventures and try his luck in the industry, in India.

Assistant Director: Nidhi Jain- With an education in finance, Nidhi currently holds a job in financial planning within the fashion industry, while simultaneously pursuing film-making/direction with the support of a novice, yet brilliant crew. She has always felt drawn to artistic fields - be it dance, writing, acting, or fashion - from a young age. Nidhi feels at home in Mumbai, Nyc, & New Jersey; and the influence of having lived & worked in more than one city has further inspired her creative thought process.

Assistant Director: Satya Adusumilli- As Satya was growing up in India, he was always a passionate storyteller! Upon moving to America, his passion grew, which lead him to be on sets for many films and theatre plays! Satya has taken a semester at Rutgers to advance his skills at storytelling and filmmaking. He currently works at a financial company but yet has loads of creative scripts that he would like to one day direct!

Production Manager: Shreya Srivastava- Shreya is in the process of completing her education in Economics at Rutgers University while being involved in this film project from its starting steps. While balancing education, her passion, and more, Shreya has been an integral part of production and set management. She has had a keen interest in the film industry, having grown up on Bollywood while living in New Jersey, and this process has given her the chance to be on the filmmaking side.

Associate/Line Producer: Vijay Adireddy- From his years of working on big Tollywood movies, Vijay Adireddy is an accomplished filmmaker today. Mr. Adireddy was a location scout and a line producer for a notable movie ‘Ye Maya Cheshave,’ which was remade into many different Indian dialects. He studied filmmaking at New York Film Academy. Mr. Adireddy has recently directed a critically acclaimed short film ‘The Brief-case’. This short film has won the Nassau Film Festival. It has been featured and nominated in Pittsburgh Independent Film Festival, Los Angeles Independent Film Festival, and Hang On To Your Shorts Film Festival. Vijay Adireddy is the Associate Producer of Now And Then. With the tremendous experience he brings onto the set, along with the mentorship he provides, ‘Now And Then’ is successfully completed due to a huge guidance from him.

Director of Photography: Ajayender Loka- He is an independent filmmaker based in New York / New Jersey. He has attended a film school in New York & has produced, wrote & directed several short films and feature films in English, Telugu, Malayalam and Hindi. Apart from Writing & Directing, Ajay also has skills of cinematography & lighting techniques, he has been a Cinematographer for several short films and a feature film that is currently in Post Production.

To find out more about our “NAT” team members, please check out our website- www.nowandthenfilm.com !
