These people have come together to create their own opportunity to showcase their talents. This team is set up so each aspect of the film has a mentor-student relationship. The professionals can teach techniques and give guidance through their experience while the debutantes can learn and offer fresh and innovative ideas. Now and Then started out with 2 people but has quickly grown into a family of over 100 artists- all volunteering their time, talent, and resources to complete this passion project!All of our production was done in New Jersey, USA. The film was shot on a Red Scarlet Camera with 4K Resolution and all still photography was done using HD-DSLR cameras.“Although inspired by Indian cinema, Now and Then portrays the universal emotion of love and showcases the timelessness of the emotion through two generations. As a film written and directed from a female perspective, Now and Then also touches upon the double standards that women may experience regarding the dating culture, even in today’s modern world. These double standards force us to think twice before sharing our stories. We were aiming to bring all the glamour of an Indian film- the music, dance, drama- without that 3 hour time commitment or language barrier. We hope this film is relatable for people from various cultural backgrounds and ages.”-Mohitha Sripathi- Taken from the Director’s notes          Our Official Teaser will be released Wednesday, August 12, 2015!!Where does Now and Then stand in the crowd?East meets West- Now and Then portrays the lives of Indian-Americans, both first and second generation. It allows for the audience to watch and possibly relate to how communities from world-over relate and adapt to American culture, while still incorporating their traditional thoughts and fusing cultures in essence. In addition, Bollywood singer, Shaan, teamed up with NJ based singer and songwriter, Lisa Bouchelle to sing an original sound track for the film.
See some of Shaan’s previous work- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmydM5R4RSI
See some of Lisa’s previous work- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=etgrrsKbNn4
Educational- “Now and Then” is set up so each aspect of the film works as an educational platform. Half our team is comprised of debutants while, the other half is made up of professionals. Throughout this creative process, the professionals and debutants have worked together to learn, grow and create this movie.
Musical- We have 3 original soundtracks along with choreographed dance sequences, which is typically uncommon for a short film! The lyrics are a mix of Hindi and English. 
100% Real Passion- Now and Then is a community effort- we have brought together raw talent and local businesses from the NJ/NYC area to help further this project.
Collaboration: Uplift Humanity & Now and Then              Uplift Humanity and Now and Then have collaborated! Why? It's simple! Both teams focus on volunteers, education, and teamwork. Our teams consist of volunteers who spend their time working towards their passion. Along with that we focus on education strongly and there's no better way to learn than having a hands on experience on set while being guided by mentors and experienced individuals. Finally, the most important aspect to any large project is teamwork! Teamwork is what keeps a large scale project from falling apart and it is the hard work of the whole team that has brought us this far! So now you can see how the team of Now and Then and Uplift Humanity have a similar foundation. 20% of all funds raised through this campaign will be donated to our friends and partners, Uplift Humanity India. 

Budget                  



CXC Productions is a creative platform bringing like-minded individuals together to pursue their passions. We are now seeking monetary support so we can see Now and Then through it’s post production stage. 

Bringing a team of film editors, sound engineers and marketing strategists on board = $4,000
Getting the best equipment possible for score composition, sound engineering, and ADR; (200 for ADR 300 engineering)= $500
Marketing the film, it’s music, and team on appropriate platforms = $1,000
Completing our film festival submission process - $700
Contingency (remastering, re-mixing, more studio sessions)- $1240

We need to raise a total of $7,440 in order to complete our project!*20% of all our fundraising money will be donated to Uplift Humanity India. 

Risks and Challenges!             


There is no business like show business! The art of filmmaking is the ambiguity that lies ahead as there are a host of unique risks for every cinema that often goes unnoticed by the common audience- Now and Then is no different. We have tried our best to reduce the risks by spending a lot of time in our pre production stages. Even with ample planning, we were faced with a series of financial burdens- food, accommodation, and insurance for equipment, to mention a few. Luckily, we were able to get through both the pre production and post production stages with the help of our friends, family and local businesses. Now, as we enter the last phase of our film, we need your support!
Your contribution will help us showcase a project that we have worked very hard on but will also help spread awareness of the unspoken stories most South Asian women face, even today, in regards to the dating culture.


Our Team




Director: Mohitha Sripathi- Her passion for film began at a very young age. Although she has no formal training in filmmaking, being on the sets of “Now and Then” has given her real life experience which cannot be matched by any course or certification. This story was written from her personal experiences and observations and marks her directorial debut. She plans to submit this project to various film festivals which target the South Asian crowd as well as other demographics and use the learnings from this project to better her next! She plans to pursue an MFA in the near future.  
Producer: Rome Chopra- He has been highly active and involved in the arts since his younger days. From filmmaking, to dancing, to acting, to singing, Rome has dabbled in many aspects of performing arts and the skill set he has developed over the years is relevant to the Indian film industry. At this point in time Rome wants to complete his education and obtain further education so he can increase his job prospects and leave himself open to explore his creative ventures and try his luck in the industry, in India.
Assistant Director: Nidhi Jain- With an education in finance, Nidhi currently holds a job in financial planning within the fashion industry, while simultaneously pursuing film-making/direction with the support of a novice, yet brilliant crew. She has always felt drawn to artistic fields - be it dance, writing, acting, or fashion - from a young age. Nidhi feels at home in Mumbai, Nyc, & New Jersey; and the influence of having lived & worked in more than one city has further inspired her creative thought process.
Assistant Director: Satya Adusumilli- As Satya was growing up in India, he was always a passionate storyteller! Upon moving to America, his passion grew, which lead him to be on sets for many films and theatre plays! Satya has taken a semester at Rutgers to advance his skills at storytelling and filmmaking. He currently works at a financial company but yet has loads of creative scripts that he would like to one day direct!
Production Manager: Shreya Srivastava- Shreya is in the process of completing her education in Economics at Rutgers University while being involved in this film project from its starting steps. While balancing education, her passion, and more, Shreya has been an integral part of production and set management. She has had a keen interest in the film industry, having grown up on Bollywood while living in New Jersey, and this process has given her the chance to be on the filmmaking side.
Associate/Line Producer: Vijay Adireddy- From his years of working on big Tollywood movies, Vijay Adireddy is an accomplished filmmaker today. Mr. Adireddy was a location scout and a line producer for a notable movie ‘Ye Maya Cheshave,’ which was remade into many different Indian dialects. He studied filmmaking at New York Film Academy. Mr. Adireddy has recently directed a critically acclaimed short film ‘The Brief-case’. This short film has won the Nassau Film Festival. It has been featured and nominated in Pittsburgh Independent Film Festival, Los Angeles Independent Film Festival, and Hang On To Your Shorts Film Festival. Vijay Adireddy is the Associate Producer of Now And Then. With the tremendous experience he brings onto the set, along with the mentorship he provides, ‘Now And Then’ is successfully completed due to a huge guidance from him.
Director of Photography: Ajayender Loka- He is an independent filmmaker based in New York / New Jersey. He has attended a film school in New York & has produced, wrote & directed several short films and feature films in English, Telugu, Malayalam and Hindi. Apart from Writing & Directing, Ajay also has skills of cinematography & lighting techniques, he has been a Cinematographer for several short films and a feature film that is currently in Post Production.To find out more about our “NAT” team members, please check out our website- www.nowandthenfilm.com !

story:
Short Summary

“We want to get people off the streets and into work”

Together we can make a difference; we are employers, employed, unemployed, and ex-homeless people who are passionate about getting people off the streets and in to Employment and Accommodation through positive action.

Our aim is to create Books and Apps using knowledge from those living on the streets of London. Providing materials and equipment i.e. Laptops, Cameras, also provide Hot Meals and Refreshments, Transport Costs and a daily allowances where necessary.

By bringing together homeless people and creatives who have an interest in London’s architecture, transport and tourist sites, also Photography and Social Media to create books, apps and walks of London.

Our first project will be called “Statues of London” which will encompass various skill sets including research, writing, photography, route planning. Furthermore, skills learnt will be transferrable and through net-working will help with motivation and confidence and eventually in to Accommodation and Employment.

Many of our team have experienced homelessness in their lives and found that depression, lack of self-esteem and motivation came about through being bored, having little or no contact with people outside of other homeless people and a lack of direction.

“From time to time we all need a helping hand”

This project allows support to homeless people knowing that money given will be supporting a positive change in their lives.

We already have three sites free of charge: Oxford Circus, Kings Cross and Peckham need to raise at least £3000 to cover cost of equipment and the day to day running.

DID YOU KNOW?

Every homeless person out of work annually has been calculated to cost £7,758 in welfare benefits payments, £1,341 in Income Tax and National Insurance payments and £12,000 in lost economic output.

When in employment a homeless person will ccontribute to the exchequer a minimum of £75,000 over a ten year period

We need other help and support e.g. equipment and materials, premises around London  to run the project, emergency accommodation. Other support needed includes employers and landlords.

story:
Join the BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS Community!



Let's bring E.B. WHITE to life!!


SHORT SUMMARY

BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS is a surreal comedy short film. Our protagonist E.B. White is an anthropomorphic character with  the head of a rabbit and the body of a slim man in a two piece suit. It is a portrait of an artist at a critical juncture in his life.

After finding success with his handpainted egg series, E.B. has turned to supervising the mass production of his eggs in plastic à la Pop-Art. Though the move to plastics has catapulted E.B. into a level of celebrity and wealth only enjoyed by a handful of living artists, he secretly fears that he’s lost touch with his creative core. He is more of a brand than an artist anymore. is the story of his return to his integrity and reconnecting with his inner truth. This film is the story of him returning to his truth and integrity.

BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS is about believing in oneself and pursuing passions despite critics.


CONTRIBUTE to BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS and empower a community of people!!


We are asking you to join us in bringing our lead character E.B. WHITE to life with special effects make-up and prosthetics, and asking you to join us in appreciating our cast & crew, without whom this film would not be possible.

We are only crowdfunding for a portion of our budget. We are still raising funds outside of this campaign to help pay for set design, equipment, locations, post-production and the list goes on!!

BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS needs your help to make this film possible. We have set our production dates. In the event our goal is not reached, we will have to postpone production. This greatly effects local crew, who find jobs as contract workers. Every $1 that goes into film in Texas generates an economic impact of $1.63. By donating to BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS, you are not only helping our cast & crew directly, but impacting the lives of so many more people indirectly. You're helping the local gas attendant where we fill up our lighting trucks. You're helping Mrs. P's Chicken, who could provide our cast & crew meals. You're helping yourself, because ALL contributions to BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE!!

RAISE AWARENESS

Contribute if you can, but another way you help is by sharing this campaign with your network. You can share using Indiegogo's share tools, or by sharing our unique link: http://igg.me/at/nonbunnyness

What do you tell your friends? TELL THEM THE TRUTH

  • Tax Deduction
  • Community Empowerment
  • Unique Perks – DINNER WITH LEAD CHARACTER E.B. WHITE




WHO WE ARE

Ben BLANCHARD

Ben attended Full Sail in Winter Park, Florida to pursue a degree in Film. He has since supplemented his film production education in Austin, TX. Ben honed his craft as a visual storyteller under the tutelage of local director Steve Mims (Arlo & Julie). He also specialized in screenwriting under the guidance of noted instructor Jill Chamberlain (mentor of Kat Candler; writer of Hellion). To develop his relationship to the performance side of film, Ben enrolled in Laurel Vouvray’s esteemed In the Moment Acting Studio (several alums have starred in SXSW award winning films). Ben has written and directed several short narratives that were exhibited in unofficial venues during SXSW.



Alexa Gabrielle RAMIREZ

Alexa Gabrielle RAMIREZ works in Development at the Austin Film Society, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that supports independent film and the filmmakers that create them. Outside of the non-profit world, she works as an independent producer and actress. Having worked the non-profit sector, and for a film organization no less, she has a unique insight into how to gain the most for her donors and how to work within budgetary constraints. Post-graduation from the University of Texas at Austin with a focus in cultural studies and psychology, Alexa attained a certification in Production Technology from ACC. Her student film ATX / SATX was selected for the school’s "Best of" Showcase, which premiered at SXSW 2015. Alexa has worked as a multimedia editor for internationally acclaimed photographer Gray Hawn, who has photographed the likes of the Princess Grace of Monaco (Grace Kelly), Farah Fawcett, and international diplomats, including former President Jimmy Carter. 



Meredith JOHNS (Key Special Effects Makeup Artist)

Meredith is an Emmy-nominated makeup artist for her work on the HBO TV movie Temple Grandin. Johns has also worked on such films as Tree of Life (Terrence Malick), True Grit (Joel & Ethan Coen) and Joe (David Gordon Green). She has leant her special effects makeup expertise to films like Stoker (Chan-wook Park), Machete and Machete Kills (Robert Rodriguez).



OUR CHALLENGES

Short films are hard to fund. Most investors know there little chance of return on their investment. BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS has taken on the added challenge of a unique lead character. E.B. White's special effects make-up is costly, but its application is integral to our narrative.

We do not want to hinder our actor's performance by putting him in something he will not be comfortable in. We want to allow him a full range of motion. We also don't want to distract you, our audience, by providing only a half-decent make-up application that will distract you for most of the film

This story comes from a personal place. We love E.B. White. He may be a rabbit, but no one will ever mention that in the film. He is one character living amongst many. He is what he is. We want you to truly see him for his traits, not his appearance.



PERK ASSESS*

  • Shipping of perks is free for anyone in the U.S.
  • Fees for shipping overseas are not to exceed what has been represented
  • BUNNY & NON-BUNNYNESS cannot provide travel & lodging for perk fulfillment
20 Frames at the Promotional Photo Shoot

  • Promotional Photo Shoot with lead actor in full make-up and prosthetics as E.B. White
  • Frames can be used for a person or product of your choosing

Set Visit Opportunity

  • Opportunity is subject to donor availability during shooting dates. Filming dates are not flexible.

Featured Extra Opportunity

  • Opportunity is subject to donor availability during shooting dates. Filming dates are not flexible.

DVD

  • Completed Film
  • E.B. White getting into make-up
  • Dance performance by Serese Brown
  • Additional behind the scenes footage

Print of Your Choosing (Pick One)

  • PIA Pop–original pop art featuring Serese Brown
  • E.B. Pop–original pop art featuring E.B. White
  • Pop Leads 4 Up–original pop art piece featuring our lead cast
  • BUNNY-FIDE Image–A print of your headshot made into an anthropomorphized bunny by a professional photo editor
  • POP-TASTIC Image–a print of your headshot made into a "Warholesque" pop art piece

story:
“Time is our most valuable asset, yet we tend to waste it, kill it, and spend it rather than invest it.” - Jim Rohn

What is MaTiFoLi.com?

We are striving to become the most comprehensive, location specific database of recreational activities found on the web. Matifoli.com found that even though as a population we are bombarded with vast amounts of information there still seems to be a need for well organized mediums to relay that information, and that is where we come in. Matifoli.com realized that people can spend days using popular search engines or tourism websites researching information on a location they currently reside in or one that they want to visit and still be left without results. More often than not, people are only informed about the popular tourist destinations because those are the only ones that are relayed in a search. If you are hoping to find something to do that is a little off the beaten path, one of those activities that you may only hear about through word of mouth, it can require a lot of digging and can be very time consuming; I imagine most people simply give up. Also, if people are visiting a location that in itself is off the beaten path, there may not be any information at all. That is where Matifoli.com wants to help!



We have arranged over 80 categories of recreational activities in a highly ergonomic manner to allow users to share, find and promote activities with ease in geo-specific locations across the globe.

If you are a recreational focused business owner, an activity planner or simply someone organizing something as simple as a pickup game and you want to spread the word about your activity, simply place the info on MaTiFoLi.com for free! If you wish to make the activity you are sharing more visible to users, you are provided the ability to promote your activity to more visible areas of the site such as the homepage, activity page and/or top of your activity category for a small fee. Our goal at Matifoli.com is to allow recreational focused companies and activity planners to get the word out as easily and efficiently as possible and encourage our users to seek out and experience as many of the activities as they can.

The most important thing that Matifoli.com is trying to do is make it easy to share and find fun in every community around the world! For this reason, we consider ourselves to be as much of a community based recreation site as a mass tourism site. So whether you're a curious local or a rolling stone road tripper, we want you to spend less time searching and more time playing. Simplify the search, use MaTiFoLi.com.

How did you come up with the name Matifoli?

Matifoli is short for MAKE TIME FOR LIFE. It is pronounced MA-TEE-FOE-LEE. Matifoli.com came to the conclusion that too many people today need to make time for life! Many of us have lost perspective of what is important. We spend so much time worrying about money and working long days that we forget to go out and enjoy ourselves and the people and places around us. Do us a favour, put things into perspective for a second and realize that the only thing that is concrete in this life is that you only have this one life to live. If all you do is work and you don’t take the time to step back and asses what is important to you, you could end up one day full of regret because you never actually lived at all.

                "If you don't take the chance to live life, what can you say at the end of it?" Naveen Andrews

We are not saying don’t work, but rather to simply take some time to productively enjoy your time when you're not working. Take some time to try new things, have fun with family and friends and enjoy the simple the things in life. The world is full of amazing locations and experiences, treat yourself to some fun every once in a while!

What else does MaTiFoLi.com offer as a company?

We are attempting to be different in every way. A significant part of what we do as a company is share the gift of fun with others.

What this means is that we are hoping to, on a weekly basis, give deserving individuals or families the gift of recreation. Our plan is to have small giveaways on our Facebook page where people can win the chance to enjoy the gift of recreation either for themselves or people they know that may deserve a break. We are going to start off small, but with your help and support we will be able to increase the reach and volume of the gifts with every passing week.

As a kick off for MaTiFoLi.com, the company had the privilege of surprising a deserving family that tragically lost their mother, daughter and sister to cancer in late 2014 with a family vacation to San Diego, California. It was more of a unique and fulfilling experience than anyone can imagine and made us realize that there is amazing, positive people everywhere you look. With the help of the extremely talented band The Soots, a couple gift cards from Dave Strano, owner of Burrito Boyz in London Ontario and Sue Coleman, owner of Thai Cuisine in London Ontario, and detailed trip planning provided by Sue Richard of Robert Q in London Ontario, Matifoli.com was able to truly make a difference in a deserving families life, all in the memory of their loved one Mel.

Our goal at Matifoli.com is to take half of our company profits and give the gift of fun to as many deserving families and individuals as we can; we want to show people that there is more important things than money, something that many corporations and governments have lost sight of. We also wish to show people that there is still positivity in this world even though the news never really mentions it anymore.

Since MaTiFoLi.com is attempting to stay away from typical investors, it will allow the company to share profits with our users and followers and their friends and acquaintances rather than have an obligation to share profits with shareholders and investors. 

What will MaTiFoLi.com do with the money raised in the crowd-funding campaign?

All of the money raised will either directly or indirectly go towards Matifoli.com's users, either through website improvements or giving back to the community.

Our goal is to invest some of the money into marketing and data entry to improve the usability of the site. Simply put, we need content!! At first we may need to add some content ourselves but hopefully in time, users will begin to add their own.

After the initial direct investment in the company, the remaining funds raised will be going towards gifts that will be given away on our social networking pages. We are hoping to use up to 50 percent of the funds raised to give back to people in communities around North America and beyond.

If you or someone you know wish to promote your recreationally focused business or activity by donating gift cards or experiences to give away on our social pages, please contact us at admin@matifoli.com. To us, recreation is everything people do outside of work. If our definition of recreation encompasses your activity, please do not hesitate to contact us!

As the CEO of Matifoli.com, what are your hopes for the future of the company?

I have always been a problem solver so my hope for Matifoli.com is that it can help people enjoy their lives with greater fulfillment. I hope that it can help people pursue their dreams, experience new things, create lasting memories, make new friends, experience new cultures, step out of their comfort zones, and most importantly HAVE FUN! There is so much out there to experience, even in your own city, the difficult part can be finding those experiences, and that is the problem I hope to solve.

How can you help Matifoli.com?

If you've read this far I'm sure you have gathered what we kindly need from you. 

Most importantly we need you to, using Matifoli.com, share, find and experience recreation as much as possible! It is time as a global population to appreciate the privilege of life and not waste it.

The other thing we kindly ask of you is to help our cause by donating to the company what you can. As mentioned before, we are trying to be unique in the ways we create our global brand by starting with grass roots community based funding and seeing where it takes us. The traditional funding strategies embraced by many current successful companies do not fit our core values at Matifoli.com, therefore we are hoping to get the ball rolling in a totally new direction and see what happens!

Thank you so much for your consideration! Please like/follow and share our social pages to help us expand our reach into communities around the world!

How to add an activity!
story_txt:
“Time is our most
valuable asset, yet we tend to waste it, kill it, and spend it rather than
invest it.” - Jim Rohn


What
is MaTiFoLi.com?

We are striving to become the most
comprehensive, location specific database of recreational activities found on
the web. Matifoli.com found that even though as a population we are bombarded
with vast amounts of information there still seems to be a need for well
organized mediums to relay that information, and that is where we come in.
Matifoli.com realized that people can spend days using popular search engines
or tourism websites researching information on a location they currently reside
in or one that they want to visit and still be left without results. More often
than not, people are only informed about the popular tourist destinations
because those are the only ones that are relayed in a search. If you are hoping
to find something to do that is a little off the beaten path, one of those
activities that you may only hear about through word of mouth, it can require a
lot of digging and can be very time consuming; I imagine most people simply give
up. Also, if people are visiting a location that in itself is off the beaten
path, there may not be any information at all. That is where Matifoli.com wants
to help! 

We have arranged over 80 categories of recreational
activities in a highly ergonomic manner to allow users to share, find and
promote activities with ease in geo-specific locations across the globe. If you
are a recreational focused business owner, an activity planner or simply
someone organizing something as simple as a pickup game and you want to spread
the word about your activity, simply place the info on MaTiFoLi.com for free!
If you wish to make the activity you are sharing more visible to users, you are
provided the ability to promote your activity to more visible areas of the site
such as the homepage, activity page and/or top of your activity category for a
small fee. Our goal at Matifoli.com is to allow recreational focused
companies and activity planners to get the word out as easily and efficiently
as possible and encourage our users to seek out and experience as many of the
activities as they can.The most important thing that Matifoli.com is
trying to do is make it easy to share and find fun in every community around
the world! For this reason, we consider ourselves to be as much of a community
based recreation site as a mass tourism site. So whether you're a curious local
or a rolling stone road tripper, we want you to spend less time searching and
more time playing. Simplify the search, use MaTiFoLi.com.



How
did you come up with the name Matifoli?

Matifoli is short for MAKE TIME FOR LIFE. It
is pronounced MA-TEE-FOE-LEE. Matifoli.com came to the conclusion that too many people today need to make time for life! Many of us have lost perspective
of what is important. We spend so much time worrying about money and working
long days that we forget to go out and enjoy ourselves and the people and
places around us. Do us a favour, put things into perspective for a second and
realize that the only thing that is concrete in this life is that you only have
this one life to live. If all you do is work and you don’t take the time to
step back and asses what is important to you, you could end up one day full of
regret because you never actually lived at all.

                "If you don't take the chance to live life, what can you say at the end of it?" Naveen Andrews



We are not saying don’t work, but rather to simply
take some time to productively enjoy your time when you're not working. Take
some time to try new things, have fun with family and friends and enjoy the
simple the things in life. The world is full of amazing locations and
experiences, treat yourself to some fun every once in a while!

What
else does MaTiFoLi.com offer as a company?

We are attempting to be different in every
way. A significant part of what we do as a company is share the gift of fun
with others. What this means is that we are hoping to, on a weekly basis, give
deserving individuals or families the gift of recreation. Our plan is to have
small giveaways on our Facebook
page where people can win the chance to enjoy the gift of recreation either for themselves or people they know that may deserve a break. We are going to start off small, but
with your help and support we will be able to increase the reach and volume of
the gifts with every passing week. 

As a kick off for MaTiFoLi.com, the company
had the privilege of surprising a deserving family that tragically lost their
mother, daughter and sister to cancer in late 2014 with a family vacation to
San Diego, California. It was more of a unique and fulfilling experience than
anyone can imagine and made us realize that there is amazing, positive people
everywhere you look. With the help of the extremely talented band The Soots, a
couple gift cards from Dave Strano, owner of Burrito Boyz in London Ontario and
Sue Coleman, owner of Thai Cuisine in London Ontario, and detailed trip
planning provided by Sue Richard of Robert Q in London Ontario, Matifoli.com
was able to truly make a difference in a deserving families life, all in the memory
of their loved one Mel. 

Our goal at Matifoli.com is to take half of
our company profits and give the gift of fun to as many deserving families and
individuals as we can; we want to show people that there is more important
things than money, something that many corporations and governments have lost
sight of. We also wish to show people that there is still positivity in this
world even though the news never really mentions it anymore.

Since MaTiFoLi.com is attempting to stay away
from typical investors, it will allow the company to share profits with our
users and followers and their friends and acquaintances rather than have an obligation
to share profits with shareholders and investors. 

What will
MaTiFoLi.com do with the money raised in the crowd-funding campaign?

All of the money raised will either directly
or indirectly go towards Matifoli.com's users, either through website improvements or giving back to the community.

Our goal is to invest some of the money into
marketing and data entry to improve the usability of the site. Simply put, we
need content!! At first we may need to add some content ourselves but hopefully
in time, users will begin to add their own.

After the initial direct investment in the
company, the remaining funds raised will be going towards gifts that will be
given away on our social networking pages. We are hoping to use up to 50
percent of the funds raised to give back to people in communities around North
America and beyond.

If you or someone you know wish to promote
your recreationally focused business or activity by donating gift cards or
experiences to give away on our social pages, please contact us at
admin@matifoli.com. To us, recreation is everything people do outside of work. If
our definition of recreation encompasses your activity, please do not hesitate
to contact us!

As
the CEO of Matifoli.com, what are your hopes for the future of the company?

I have always been a problem solver so my
hope for Matifoli.com is that it can help people enjoy their lives with greater
fulfillment. I hope that it can help people pursue their dreams, experience new
things, create lasting memories, make new friends, experience new cultures,
step out of their comfort zones, and most importantly HAVE FUN! There is so
much out there to experience, even in your own city, the difficult part can be
finding those experiences, and that is the problem I hope to solve. How can you
help Matifoli.com?

If you've read this far I'm sure you have
gathered what we kindly need from you. Most importantly we need you to, using
Matifoli.com, share, find and experience recreation as much as possible! It is
time as a global population to appreciate the privilege of life and not waste
it.
The other thing we kindly ask of you is to
help our cause by donating to the company what you can. As mentioned before, we
are trying to be unique in the ways we create our global brand by starting with
grass roots community based funding and seeing where it takes us. The
traditional funding strategies embraced by many current successful companies do
not fit our core values at Matifoli.com, therefore we are hoping to get the
ball rolling in a totally new direction and see what happens!
Thank you so much for your consideration! Please like/follow and share our social pages to help us expand our reach into communities around the world!How to add an activity!

story:
Short Summary

Wanderlust is a film about two strangers crossing paths and creating an unlikely bond. Jackson, a world traveler hitchhikes his way to New York, where he gets a ride with the beautiful, yet impulsive, Paige, who is running away. Together, as two lost and wounded souls, they find consolation in each other.  This is a film about finding yourself, and how sometimes a stranger can help you let go of your past.

wanderlust (n): a strong desire for or impulse to wander or travel and explore the world

How You Can Help

This is a road trip film that we filmed Upstate New York in October. And while we're done filming, we have a long way to go before this movie will be finished and ready to share with the world. Your funds will enable us to do editing, color correction, visual effects, and compose and record the perfect music for this film. 

The more we raise, the further we can take this project. We have big dreams for this movie, including placement in significant film festivals and a life beyond the festival circuit in targeted online distribution, and your donations could make those dreams a reality. 


MEET OUR CAST


Christine Spang as PAIGE

CHRISTINE SPANG is thrilled to be a part of the 'Wanderlust' team. Recent credits include Fort Tilden (SXSW Grand Jury Winner 2014), Misfits (Nominated for Best Actress at the Studio City International Film Festival 2015), and has contributed to multiple NYU short films. She finished her degree in Psychology and Drama from Tisch School of the Arts in 2013 and trained at the Stella Adler Studio and Stonestreet Studios for Film and Television. Her personal wanderlust has lead her to travel through China and South Africa just this past year. 


Daniel Hilt as JACKSON

DANIEL HILT has appeared in TV Commercials and self made, abridged, backyard productions of Les Miserables at his house since the age of 12. A Rutgers University graduate and New Jersey born TV/Film and Theater actor. He has been seen on TV and in Film in such things as Law and Order, The Sopranos, What Would You do?, American Gangster, and most recently in the Oscar nominated Foxcatcher. 


MEET OUR CREW


Christine Stronegger, Writer & Director


Christine is an award winning filmmaker from Norway who is currently based out of New York City. She graduated Summa Cum Laude in May 2015, from Long Island University where she earned her B.F.A in Cinematography and Film Production. She has written and directed five shorts, one of which won the Director's Choice Award at Sacramento Film & Music Festival in 2014. While attending the film program at LIU, she interned for Jane Rosenthal and Robert De Niro at Tribeca Productions. Her thesis film is currently being screened at various film festivals, such as Big Apple Film Festival, Gold Coast Film Festival and Katra Film Series where she won the audience award in October 2015. 

Steven Schuermans, Director of Photography


After studying Engineering in Belgium and Sweden, Steven earned a Masters in Nanotechnology and Nanoscience. While working on a film project with a friend, he discovered cinema was his true calling. Steven moved to New York to attend film school, and during his studies developed a love for camera and lighting because of its importance in creating the mood of a film. Steven has since shot for Saturday Nigh Live’s Digital Shorts Unit for Season 39 & 40,  Mike Myers’ directional debut Supermensch: The Legend of Shep Gordon, which was selected for the 2013 Toronto International Film Festival, as well as the indie film ‘All Relative’ (2014) starring Sara Paxton and Connie Nielsen and the upcoming film Conner4real (2016) starring award winning comedian Andy Samberg. Steven has also worked on documentaries for the Discovery Channel and shot numerous commercials for major brands including The Home Depot, Playstation, J&B liquor, Pledge, Ippolita Jewelry and VDL Cosmetics.

Amit Shrivastav, Producer


An active name in Indian Theater Arts, TV and Films, Mr. Amit Shrivastava, since his childhood, cherished being an artist following his father’s footsteps and guidance.  Still in process to establish himself as a renowned Producer in USA, Mr. Shrivastava likes to collaborate with filmmakers who are not afraid to take risks, those, whose undefeatable belief is their motivation, who hosts powerhouse artistry, reaching at the top of their fields. Amit Shrivastava enjoys helping to sculpt this ambitious work and articulate its heart and spirit, and considers it as an honor to work alongside a cast and crew of this caliber. This abridged preview staging was only the beginning, and we're all hoping that an even more vast and ambitious version will be mounted soon. 

Nick Grau, Producer

Nick works in the New York Television/Film industry as an Assistant Director, primarily on independent feature films.  Currently a resident of Brooklyn, he was born and raised in upstate New York, and he frequently chooses to set films there. In "Wanderlust", two strangers share a peculiarly intimate experience due to a complete isolation that comes from being on the road, against a backdrop of utter wilderness. Nick's affinity for finding locations in upstate New York was a perfect match for such a film. 

Juan Pablo Tramujas, Sound Mixer


Juan Pablo was born in Argentina and raised in Brazil. Sound has always been a big part of his life through music. Juan Pablo played the saxophone, jazz flute and sang in bands all the way through college when he graduated in Advertising. In 2010 he moved toNew York City to study filmmaking. Having the musical background, it felt natural for him to explore the world of sound for film. Since graduating, Juan Pablo worked on over 40 short films and 6 feature films that included talent like Harvey Keitel, Stephen Baldwin, Sean Young and William Forsythe. 

Melanie Coffey, Production Assistant


Melanie is currently a student, studying film at Long Island University, Post with a focus in writing, directing, and producing. She has studied film and television production in Philadelphia, London, and New York. 


STILLS FROM THE MOVIE

«Sometimes, you find yourself in the middle of nowhere,- and sometimes, in the middle of nowhere, you find yourself»

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 Spread the word about our campaign and our film. Like and Share our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/wanderlusttheshortfilm  and follow us on Instagram: wanderlust_theshortfilm where we'll be posting updates about the production. 

We appreciate anything you can do to help!

story:
“The BENDERS CIRCUIT” 

A Documentary on the Audio-Visual Performance scene in and around LA. 

This movie features performing artists in the LA area who use customized electronics to create unique audio-visual experiences.  This cutting edge genre encompasses experimental electronic music, circuit bending, audio-visual performances with customized equipment. 

What makes it Important: The mainstream needs to be challenged. This movement is a totally independent and original scene, and although not driven by commercial concerns, sustains itself and keeps growing creatively. Although unknown to much of the outside world, these performing artists are on the cutting edge of what’s happening in underground art culture. 

We have been shooting shows and interviews for two years, and are working to include as many acts as possible in this first release.  It's time to share this with the world.  You can help us to complete the shooting, editing, and post production for this documentary with your contribution to make this happen.

What We Need

We have already done a lot of editing, but more needs to be done! The budget will be used for: 

  • Editors
  • Additional Shooting
  • Gear
  • Hard Drive storage
  • Sound Mixing
  • Mastering costs
  • Social Media Marketing 
  • Website
  • Blu-Ray Production

What You Get

Be a part of exposing the world to unique ways of thinking outside the mainstream. With your help we can complete the movie. You can enjoy it, and also be a part of making a documentary for others to watch as well. Contributors each get a copy of the movie plus additional perks. Your name can appear in the credits. Your business logo can also appear in the credits.

The Impact

This is an important movement that deserves to be experienced by the outside world. Our goal is to submit the movie to festivals and outlets for distribution. 

The Team

This team has produced, directed, edited, and completed many successful long form and music documentary projects. 

Eric A Zimmerman is a graduate of The School of the Art Institute of Chicago, and has directed, produced, and edited many kinds of projects, He has directed music video and long form projects for NIN, Ministry, Black Label Society, and many other bands. He also has edited long form concert programs, tv shows,  and music videos for bands including Eminem, Ziggy Marley, and Snoop Dogg. He edited electronic rave culture documentary "Better Living Through Circuitry", cuban music documentary "Havana: Rhythm and Smoke", "Targeted: The Engineer of Death" nominated for the IDA Awards, and BET docu-series "Keyshia Cole, The Way It Is" winner of the Prism Award.

Angela Izzo is a graduate of Brooks Institute with a BA in Visual Journalism. Angela has worked for MTV News, CBS, AOL Travel and other prominent media companies. She has directed music videos and filmed live performances for Pearl Charles, Daniel Johnston,Taylor Momsen, Lykke Li, Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros, Chris Robinson, and many others. Angela's photography was presented at the Los Angeles Center for Digital Art, Jamie Brooks Fine Art Gallery, and the Guggenheim in New York. Her work has also been published in Relix Magazine, Vice, Huffington Post, and others. She wrote and directed the documentary "We Heart the Art Barn" about an art space which was featured in the Ventura Film Festival in 2009. In 2012 she won 1st place in the experimental film category for "The Messages We Give" at the My Hero International Film Festival. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but still want to help:

  • Pass the funding link along and help make some noise!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
benderscircuit.com

story:
What this is about

日本語版はこちら

This is a crowdfunding campaign for a sci-fi short film, "Perfect World." We have already completed everything from the principal photography to the 5.1 Sound Mix, but we need some help to finish the VFX due to the complexity of its process.

 

Story

"PERFECT WORLD" is a dystopian sci-fi drama short film that challenges our intolerance for other people's imperfections, despite the flaws that make us all human.​

In 2121, where everything is captured as data, Citizens in the CITY are judged based on a score of one's efficiency, called a SPEC. An abortionist, Doctor K, faces a question between the law and morality when faced with a visit by his ex-lover Grace, who is pregnant.

 

This story is inspired by true stories 

As someone born with a mild physical handicap (a twisted foot), Yuske, the Director of this project, cannot forget the moment where his grandfather told him not to do too much physical work because he was imperfect. Since his foot was 99% cured by then, he was confused and shocked by how other people judge him, although he did understand the grandfather meant to care about his health and future. Through his life, he occasionally experienced judgemental gaze from others and it became a major source of inspiration for this project.

 

Our SYSTEM

To tell the story as accurately as possible, we are working on complete integrity between the theme and the visual language of the film. And what we tried to achieve visually is the world where everything is captured as data for the sake of the optimization and perfection of the efficiency in human life.

 

- What's unique about this project

In order to accomplish this concept, we chose Microsoft Kinect.  Kinect captures the position data of people and objects with infra-red, and provides it as depth data. And we decided to visualize this data as Point Cloud, like in the picture below.

And I thought the texture of this Point Cloud imagery was ideal to tell the story about the characters who struggle between PERFECTION vs IMPERFECTION, and to visualize human being as something that contains noise and glitches.

Here's a video where we talk about our setup.

This setup using the Kinect to capture the whole world (the set + actors) is exactly what I imagined this world should be. So we built a the system with the captured data from 3 Kinects along with color information from the RED.

 

What's already done

1) Development through Production

After developing the concept with Sam Ziaie (Concept Designer), and the script with Anthony Rettenmaier (Story Consultant) and Tulica Singh (Dialogue Consultant), we successfully finished our principal photography despite the complication of the setup with three Kinects, a RED, and two Iconix camera (small webcam like camera attached to Kinect); thanks to our great producers, Aaron Bush, Sara Fenton and Megan McDonnell, as well as Toshihiko Kizu (DP), Laura Cechanowicz (Production Designer), and the Kinect Team led by Enrico Targetti and many many more as you can see in pictures below! 

 

2) Editing & 5.1 Sound Mix

We already locked our picture by our editor, Meibei Lieu, and our 5.1 Mix was completed by Peter Bawiec.

 

3) Concept Art & Some VFX

We have some versions of backgrounds and point cloud shots with and by Jiayuan Liu (Concept Artist), Martin Tsuai (VFX Artist), and Production Designer/World Builder Laura Cechanowicz.

Here's a work-in-progress image of a set. The point cloud data from three Kinect look like this. Different colors indicate data from different angles.

Test renderings.

and VR tests... (monoscopic 360 video, although we already proved stereoscopic 360 is working with our setup.)

 
 

What still nees to be done

1) VFX (more Point Cloud)

Among 67 point cloud shots, 39 have been started and waiting for the finish up, but other 28 shots still need to be taken care of.

2) VR shots

The biggest advantage of this setup is that our captured data is, by default, ready for recreation in virtual 3D space. So technically we can rebuild everything that happened in the real world during the shoot in the virtual world in post production. As some of you who are familiar with technology may have noticed already, this set up is perfectly ready for a stereoscopic 360 VR experience. 

We are planning to generate 3 VR setups (scenes), and 2 have been started and proved to be functioning, but 1 is yet to be started.

 

Perfect World Team

A world set in the virtual doesn't mean we don't exist in the real world...

 

What we need

We need support for the following reasons.

As presented above, we're done with everything BUT the VFX and VR, although we already have designs, and all of our workflows are proven to work - including the point cloud shots, the most exciting part of this project, that I show and explain below. We just did not have enough man power, and computational power, to complete everything faster within our resources. The fact that we're using a customized workflow with a lot of experiments made it very difficult to find a suitable artist with experience, knowledge, curiosity and working rate.

So, we need your help. The numbers are listed below.

 

What You Get

What we can offer as returns are the following:

1) Movie (of course!)

2) Stereoscopic 360 VR shots

2) Credit (Executive Producer/Associate Producer/Special Thanks)

3) Props & Costumes

 

Risks & Challenges

We are proud that we made our grand design possible despite the complexity and innovative approach to the audio-visual storytelling, but  the time is our biggest concern and risk. The quality will likely be compromised to reduce time without your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing and Liking on any social media or in your daily conversation with friends DOES help!

 

Just to make it super duper clear...

I understand the fund asked here is not small - you may say "I could make one short film with that budget!" Yes that may be true. But I just wanted to be super clear that this is not 'making money'  kind of campaign. If you ask me about it, I simply say NO (WAY!) None of us can survive only with the money donated here, but I would like to contribute back the artists as much as I can so their talent is not abandoned for their survival, which unfortunately happens everywhere. And I hope the presentation above explains for you to be convinced on this point.

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have ANY doubt or question about this, or the project.

 

That's all there is to it. Thank you first of all for reading this page!!
story_txt:
What this is about
日本語版はこちら
This is a crowdfunding campaign for a sci-fi short film, "Perfect World." We have already completed everything from the principal photography to the 5.1 Sound Mix, but we need some help to finish the VFX due to the complexity of its process.
 
Story
"PERFECT WORLD" is a dystopian sci-fi drama short film that challenges our intolerance for other people's imperfections, despite the flaws that make us all human.​
In 2121, where everything is captured as data, Citizens in the CITY are judged based on a score of one's efficiency, called a SPEC. An abortionist, Doctor K, faces a question between the law and morality when faced with a visit by his ex-lover Grace, who is pregnant.
 
This story is inspired by true stories 
As someone born with a mild physical handicap (a twisted foot), Yuske, the Director of this project, cannot forget the moment where his grandfather told him not to do too much physical work because he was imperfect. Since his foot was 99% cured by then, he was confused and shocked by how other people judge him, although he did understand the grandfather meant to care about his health and future. Through his life, he occasionally experienced judgemental gaze from others and it became a major source of inspiration for this project.

 
Our SYSTEM
To tell the story as accurately as possible, we are working on complete integrity between the theme and the visual language of the film. And what we tried to achieve visually is the world where everything is captured as data for the sake of the optimization and perfection of the efficiency in human life.
 
- What's unique about this project
In order to accomplish this concept, we chose Microsoft Kinect.  Kinect captures the position data of people and objects with infra-red, and provides it as depth data. And we decided to visualize this data as Point Cloud, like in the picture below.
And I thought the texture of this Point Cloud imagery was ideal to tell the story about the characters who struggle between PERFECTION vs IMPERFECTION, and to visualize human being as something that contains noise and glitches.

Here's a video where we talk about our setup.

This setup using the Kinect to capture the whole world (the set + actors) is exactly what I imagined this world should be. So we built a the system with the captured data from 3 Kinects along with color information from the RED.

 
What's already done
1) Development through Production
After developing the concept with Sam Ziaie (Concept Designer), and the script with Anthony Rettenmaier (Story Consultant) and Tulica Singh (Dialogue Consultant), we successfully finished our principal photography despite the complication of the setup with three Kinects, a RED, and two Iconix camera (small webcam like camera attached to Kinect); thanks to our great producers, Aaron Bush, Sara Fenton and Megan McDonnell, as well as Toshihiko Kizu (DP), Laura Cechanowicz (Production Designer), and the Kinect Team led by Enrico Targetti and many many more as you can see in pictures below!

The point cloud data from three Kinect look like this. Different colors indicate data from different angles.Test renderings.and VR tests... (monoscopic 360 video, although we already proved stereoscopic 360 is working with our setup.)  
What still nees to be done
1) VFX (more Point Cloud)
Among 67 point cloud shots, 39 have been started and waiting for the finish up, but other 28 shots still need to be taken care of.
2) VR shots
The biggest advantage of this setup is that our captured data is, by default, ready for recreation in virtual 3D space. So technically we can rebuild everything that happened in the real world during the shoot in the virtual world in post production. As some of you who are familiar with technology may have noticed already, this set up is perfectly ready for a stereoscopic 360 VR experience. 
We are planning to generate 3 VR setups (scenes), and 2 have been started and proved to be functioning, but 1 is yet to be started.

The fact that we're using a customized workflow with a lot of experiments made it very difficult to find a suitable artist with experience, knowledge, curiosity and working rate.So, we need your help. The numbers are listed below.

1) Movie (of course!)
2) Stereoscopic 360 VR shots
2) Credit (Executive Producer/Associate Producer/Special Thanks)
3) Props & Costumes

story:
Short Summary

 My name is Shauna Richardson and I'm an actress and writer based out of SF and LA. I've had the pleasure of working on several television shows, feature films, and commercials.

 Our goal with this campaign is to get the necessary funding in order to create a beautiful film. This short film is all about showcasing the every day life and how our relationships can thrive and struggle when faced with hardship. This film explores the lives of a married couple who have to face some harsh realities after a tragedy takes place in their lives. We have all dealt with tragedy, with loss, and with the hard task of picking up the broken pieces and moving forward. We want to capture that. This campaign is so important to us because it will allow us to create the best film possible, and hopefully, in turn, touch many viewers. We want to bring this short film to the festival circuit both nationally and internationally and believe that with the right execution and creative process, it will find success.

 Your contribution would make this film possible. We want people to be as passionate about this story as we are. We want to bring the authenticity and rawness of every day life back to the screen. We want our audience to walk away with questions and not just answers. Our goal is not to just create a film but to actually connect with viewers around the world through these characters. Your contribution will help us achieve that goal. 

Below, underneath our cast, are some links that will take you to some of the pages we've already created for the film so you can get the first peak at what we've done so far!


Cast


Shauna Richardson : Grace
Shauna Richardson began acting in middle school and continued throughout high school starring in several roles such as Scout in "To Kill A Mockingbird", Anne Frank in "The Diary of Anne Frank" and Beatrice in "Much Ado About Nothing". After signing with an agency in San Francisco, Richardson was soon booked as a model for Levi's and traveled across the country promoting their Curve ID line for many important figures in the fashion industry including Amy Astley of Teen Vogue. She has appeared in several films including "San Andreas", "Cross Cut", "The Wizard", and "We Promised", which was an official selection in many film festivals and won Best Picture at the HIMPFF. She's also been in multiple TV shows including "Wives with Knives" and "Behind the Screams". She recently filmed a pilot for a new web series "Studio 12" and just finished filming the independent drama "Helen's Last Love". She has also been involved in promotions and commercials for Heirloom, Zmodo, ParentPro and Zinus. In addition, she is also a writer for I Am That Girl, which is a movement that is dedicated to helping young girls around the world find their voice and self-worth.

Paul Spadaro : Jack

Paul Spadaro was born in San Francisco, California and has been fascinated with film since he was a young child. At the age of eleven, he was in his first play and was complimented by the highly respected Mare Winningham. Paul fully began his journey in acting in his twenties and began attending acting classes at the Mestnik Acting Studio in Los Angeles. He stepped onto his first set in 2012 in the film "I'm In Love With A Church Girl". Shortly after, he filmed two short films and was cast as the lead in the feature film "The Desire of Ages" as Jesus. He has since been seen in various film and television productions including "Hemingway and Gellhorn", "Looking" "I Almost Got Away With It", and "Cuff Me if You Can". Paul has also made a dent in independent film starring in "A Million Miles Away" and "Never Alone". He hopes to one day be in a position that allows himself to make films and build a platform in the pursuit of giving back to important causes around the world.


Tabitha Paigen : Camille

Tabitha Katherine Paigen was born in Northern California and lives with her parents and sister. She discovered her love of acting while playing Gretl in Sound of Music in a local theater company, where she started at 6 years old. She grew up around improv acting groups and Shakespearean players at the Northern California Renaissance Faire. The move from small stage to screen was almost effortless. She signed with a talent agency in Northern California and has been cast in principal roles in "Lane 1974" as Gina and in "Pushing Dead" as Kimberly. Tabitha hopes to one day be in a movie with Emma Watson or Daniel Radcliffe.

Our IMDB page: Official Fault IMDB
Instagram: Official Fault Instagram

What We Need & What You Get

For this to happen we are asking for $2,000. It may seem like a lot. And it is. But it truly takes a village to create a wonderful short film. 

We have tons of unique perks for contributors! We want you to feel like you are a part of this project. You are why this project is happening!

 All of the funds acquired in this campaign will go directly to paying our professional crew, providing food for all involved on the production, the best gear possible, and will go to post-production work that includes sound, coloring, and visual effects among many other things.

The Impact

We think our project is valuable and stands out because of the intention and meaning behind it. The world of film has grown so much in the last decade as has the technology within it. All of that is great. However, we really want to create a simple, organic story with a simple idea. This film aims to tackle many situations we face in life whether it's loss, love, grief, happiness, or sorrow. We want every person that views this film to be able to relate to what they are seeing. We want to showcase what we see in our own lives every day. We want to show real.

Risks & Challenges

Any time you set out to make a film you are taking a creative risk and accepting challenges. That is part of this business and we as a team are willing to face those head on. As with any film, budget can always be a major issue, however, we believe that with the funding we already have and with the contributions we will hopefully receive through this campaign, that we will achieve our goal and create a film that we are all proud of. We have a wonderful team signed on and a great cast that are ready to put everything they have into making this film a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that it is the holiday season... and that donating to a film may not be possible. We would love to have you as a contributor but if you are unable to at this time, you can always share this page with others through social media outlets or by passing it on to friends and family. Every amount and every mention helps!

story:
Short Summary

Elsewhere is a land filled with weird and wonderful creatures where these beings wander aimlessly never interacting with each other. When two, a fox and a crow meet they learn to socially interact and define their personalities through each other and learn what it is to be a social being.

Fox Concept Art

About Us

We have, over the past four years, developed a robust, honest working relationship which we have benefitted from in our time making films together. Before now we have always been based in horror, and thrill, but we believe this mainly to be a reflection of our growing selves. With a background in horror, a costume intensive art, with a lot of time dedicated to placement of camera and shot composition gives us many of the skills necessary to create a creature costume fantasy.

Elsewhere is, by contrast a far more uplifting film, though it is anchored in reality. This fresh tone and theme for the both of us is a welcome change, but we also feel that it is a reflection of us becoming happier in ourselves: from becoming more realistic with life, and expectations.


Why Do We Need Your Help?

We have an estimated budget of £4500 for the film.
Principal Photography will be taking place mid February over two weeks at Loch . Awe in Scotland which induces several costs :

  • Lodgings
  • Transport
  • Camera Equipment
  • Location Equipment
  • Drone Hire
  • Food and Drink for the Cast and Crew

    As well as the Costumes which comprise of many varying materials to make it functional as well as look professional and believable. In stilt based costumes there is a lot going on behind camera.


    • The Impact

    Funding for low-budget filmmaking is very hard to come by and if we received even the smallest contribution from yourselves we would be extremely grateful. Even the smallest amount can go a long way.Gaining funding for our film will help give creatives in Dundee, who are desperate to make films, a platform that is widely unavailable in Scotland as a whole. Once we have completed the project we will be entering the film into festivals worldwide so the world can see the potential Scotland has when it comes to film making! As well as our listed perks, for any donation above £5 you will be entitled to a digital download of Elsewhere in 2K.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We appreciate not everyone can contribute to our campaign but if you are interested in the project please share this campaign on social media as well as following us on facebook so we can continue to keep you updated.
    And please don't hesitate to contact us if you'd like to know more or even get involved! 


         

         

    Creature Concept Art

story:
هذه قصة عربي جاء إلى أوروبا سنة ١٩٣٦ ليس طلباً للجوء وإنما لكي يتضامن مع الأوروبيين للتخلص من الفاشية

 نحتاج إلى دعمك لاستكمال الفيلم الذي يحكي القصة غير العادية لنجاتي صدقي وعائلته

النص باللغة العربية

(Trailer y texto en español más abajo)

The Story

“I am an Arab volunteer, I came to Spain to defend Cairo in Barcelona, Damascus in Toledo and Baghdad in Madrid.” Najati Sidki (in 1936).

Imagine that your father is a Palestinian Arab, but he had decided to fight against Franco in Spanish Civil War. Imagine that you have siblings, but you can’t talk with them because you don’t speak the same language. Imagine that you have a family but you were raised without parents...

“You Come From Far Away” tells the extraordinary story of a Palestinian family: the father, Najati Sidki, was a Palestinian communist who came to Spain as a volunteer to fight against Franco in 1936. The family was dispersed by several turmoils that steer the last century starting by the Spanish Civil War, and goes on with World War II, Nakba, Lebanese Civil War, etc. As if the 20th century was summed up in the life of a single family. Dulia (Dawlat in Arabic), the eldest daughter, was lost in Russia after the Spanish Civil War and separated from the family for 20 years.

The film also remind us the fact that the Arabs were fighting for the future of European people long before they become unwanted refugees at its borders. Najati Sidki was one of those unknown Arab heroes who paid a high price for his decision.

Background

History usually has associated the Arabs’ role in the Spanish Civil War (1936–1939) with the Moroccan troops who were brought to Spain by Franco in order to fight against the Republicans’ government. This image has predominated during the last decades, overshadowing the other Arabs’ existence among the international volunteers.

In fact, more than one thousand people had come from Iraq, Morocco, Lebanon, Palestine, Egypt, Algeria, etc. in order to defend the Republic and democracy against Franco. Some of them were killed or disappeared just like other comrades in Madrid, Aragón, Andalusia and Catalonia, while others returned to their countries after the war.

Who were those Arabs? Why did they come to fight and to die defending democracy in a distant country? The documentary tries to answer these questions, through the story of Najati Sidki, a Palestinian journalist and the former secretary of the Palestine Communist Party.

Why is your contribution important?

The historical research of the story is already done with the support of Fundación Euroárabe, based in Granada. “You Come From Far Away” is selected also among the projects, which are going to be supported by Screen Institute Beirut. 50% of the filming is already done. However, the existing budget is far from covering the full production.

We need your support in order to continue filming in Moscow, Beirut and Spain.

The film will be completed in 2016.

The filmmakers

Amal Ramsis - Director

Amal Ramsis is an Egyptian filmmaker who was born and raised in Cairo. She has studied cinema in Madrid between 2002-2005. She has conducted numerous workshops around the world with women who have no experience in filmmaking at all. Ramsis is the founder and the director of Cairo International Women’s Film Festival. Her films “Only Dreams” (2005) “Life” (2008), “Forbidden” (2011) and “The Trace of the Butterfly” (2014) have got several international awards and been screened in many festivals.

Necati Sonmez – Producer

He has worked as film critic and journalist before starting to make documentary films. His debut work, “Theo’s Gaze” (2003) looked at the work of Greek director Theo Angelopoulos, while his award winning film “To Make an Example of” (2007) explored the reasons behind the death of the hundreds of people executed since the founding of the Turkish Republic. He has produced several awarded films such as “Housekeeper”, “Sisters of Lilith” and “The Trace of the Butterfly”. He is one of the founders of Documentarist Istanbul Documentary Days, which was launched in 2008. He is currently living in Istanbul and Cairo.



************


Venís Desde Lejos

Esta es la historia de un árabe que vino a Europa en la década de 1930, no para solicitar refugio sino para apoyar a los europeos a librarse del fascismo.

Necesitamos tu ayuda para completar la historia extraordinaria de Najati Sidki y su familia.

La historia

“Soy un voluntario árabe y he venido para defender Damasco en Guadalajara, Jerusalén en Córdoba, Bagdad en Toledo, El Cairo en Cádiz y Tetuán en Burgos”. 
El palestino Najati Sidki (1936)

Imagina que tu padre es un árabe palestino que decidió luchar contra Franco en la guerra civil española. Imagina que tienes hermanos y hermanas con los cuales no puedes comunicarte, pues no habláis el mismo idioma. Imagina que tienes familia pero creciste sin tus padres…

“Venís Desde Lejos” cuenta la extraordinaria historia de una familia palestina. El padre, Najati Sidki, comunista palestino, vino a España como voluntario para luchar contra Franco en 1936. La familia se dispersó como consecuencia de los acontecimientos ocurridos en el siglo pasado, desde la guerra civil española, la segunda guerra mundial, pasando por la nakba palestina o la guerra civil libanesa, etc. Era como si la historia de una única familia fuera la metáfora de lo sucedido en el siglo XX. Dulia (Dawlat en árabe) se perdió en Rusia después de la guerra civil española y quedó separada de su familia durante 20 años.

Este documental nos recuerda también que los árabes lucharon por el futuro de los europeos mucho antes de convertirse en refugiados no deseados en sus fronteras. Najati Sidki fue uno de esos héroes árabes desconocidos que pagaron un precio alto por sus decisiones.

Antecedentes

La historia normalmente ha asociado el papel que jugaron los árabes en la guerra civil española (1936 – 1939) con el de las tropas marroquíes que Franco trajo a España para reprimir a los republicanos. Esa imagen ha predominado a lo largo de las últimas décadas ocultando la existencia de otros árabes que participaron en el bando republicano.

De hecho, más de mil voluntarios vinieron de Marruecos, Argelia, Líbano, Palestina y Egipto para defender la República y la democracia contra Franco. Algunos fueron asesinados y otros desaparecidos, al igual que muchos camaradas, en Madrid, Aragón, Andalucía y Cataluña, mientras que otros volvieron a sus pay a defender la democracia orque Andalucmaradas a metreciste sin padres.

manos y hermanas con los cuales no puedes hablar porqueíses después de la guerra.

¿Quiénes eran esos árabes? ¿Por qué vinieron a luchar y a defender la democracia en un país lejano? El documental intenta responder a estas preguntas a través de la historia de Najati Sidki, periodista palestino y exsecretario del Partido Comunista Palestino.

¿Por qué tu apoyo es necesario?

La investigación histórica se llevó a cabo con el apoyo de la Fundación Euroárabe de Granada. “Venís Desde Lejos” ha sido seleccionado como uno de los proyectos que  recibirán apoyo de Screen Institute en Beirut. Ya se ha realizado el 50% de la filmación, sin embargo, el presupuesto actual no puede cubrir todo el proceso de producción.

Necesitamos tu ayuda para continuar rodando en Moscú, Beirut y España.

La película se terminará en 2016.

Los Realizadores


Amal Ramsis – Directora

Nacida en El Cairo en 1972, Amal Ramsis es realizadora de cine egipcia. Entre 2002 y 2005 realizó sus estudios de Dirección Cinematográfica en Madrid. En 2008 creó “Entre Cineastas” - Festival Internacional de Cine de Mujeres de El Cairo. En 2009 fue titular de la Cátedra de las Artes y Culturas de la Fundación Euroárabe en Granada. Sus documentales Sólo sueños (2005), Vida (2008),  Prohibido (2011)y La estela de la mariposa (2014)han sido premiados y proyectados en numerosos festivales internacionales.


Necati Sonmez – Productor

Ha trabajado como crítico de cine y periodista antes de empezar a realizar documentales. Su primera obra Theo’s Gaze (2003) contempla el trabajo del director griego Theo Angelopoulos, mientras que su premiado documental To Make an Example of (2007) explora las razones de la ejecución de cientos de personas desde la fundación de la república turca. Ha producido varios documentales que han sido galardonados, como Housekeeper, Sisters of Lilith y La estela de la mariposa. Es uno de los fundadores de Documentarist Istanbul Documentary Days (2008). Vive entre El Cairo y Estambul.


A detailed report on the project by Ahram Online
story_txt:
هذه قصة عربي جاء إلى أوروبا سنة ١٩٣٦ ليس طلباً للجوء وإنما لكي يتضامن مع الأوروبيين للتخلص من الفاشية
 نحتاج إلى دعمك لاستكمال الفيلم الذي يحكي القصة غير العادية لنجاتي صدقي وعائلته

النص باللغة العربية(Trailer y texto en español más abajo)
The Story 
“I am
an Arab volunteer, I
came to Spain to defend Cairo in Barcelona, Damascus in Toledo and Baghdad in
Madrid.” Najati Sidki (in 1936).
Imagine
that your father is a Palestinian Arab, but he had decided to fight against Franco
in Spanish Civil War. Imagine that you have siblings, but you can’t talk with
them because you don’t speak the same language. Imagine that you have a family
but you were raised without parents... 
“You Come
From Far Away” tells the extraordinary story of a Palestinian family: the
father, Najati Sidki, was a Palestinian communist who came to Spain as a
volunteer to fight against Franco in 1936. The family was dispersed by several turmoils
that steer the last century starting by the Spanish Civil War, and goes on with
World War II, Nakba, Lebanese Civil War, etc. As if the 20th century was summed
up in the life of a single family. Dulia (Dawlat in Arabic), the eldest
daughter, was lost in Russia after the Spanish Civil War and separated from the
family for 20 years. 
The film
also remind us the fact that the Arabs were fighting for the future of European
people long before they become unwanted refugees at its borders. Najati Sidki
was one of those unknown Arab heroes who paid a high price for his decision.



Background

History
usually has associated the Arabs’ role in the Spanish Civil War (1936–1939)
with the Moroccan troops who were brought to Spain by Franco in order to fight
against the Republicans’ government. This image has predominated during the
last decades, overshadowing the other Arabs’ existence among the international
volunteers.
In fact,
more than one thousand people had come from Iraq, Morocco, Lebanon, Palestine,
Egypt, Algeria, etc. in order to defend the Republic and democracy against
Franco. Some of them were killed or disappeared just like other comrades in
Madrid, Aragón, Andalusia and Catalonia, while others returned to their
countries after the war.
Who were
those Arabs? Why did they come to fight and to die defending democracy in a
distant country? The documentary tries to answer these questions, through the
story of Najati Sidki, a Palestinian journalist and the former secretary of the
Palestine Communist Party.



Why is your contribution important?

The
historical research of the story is already done with the support of Fundación
Euroárabe, based in Granada. “You Come From Far Away” is selected also among
the projects, which are going to be supported by Screen Institute Beirut. 50%
of the filming is already done. However, the existing budget is far from
covering the full production.
We need your
support in order to continue filming in Moscow, Beirut and Spain.
The film
will be completed in 2016.

The filmmakers


Amal Ramsis - Director
Amal Ramsis
is an Egyptian filmmaker who was born and raised in Cairo. She has studied
cinema in Madrid between 2002-2005. She has conducted numerous workshops around
the world with women who have no experience in filmmaking at all. Ramsis is the
founder and the director of Cairo International Women’s Film Festival. Her
films “Only Dreams” (2005) “Life” (2008), “Forbidden” (2011) and “The Trace of
the Butterfly” (2014) have got several international awards and been screened
in many festivals.


Necati Sonmez – Producer
He has
worked as film critic and journalist before starting to make documentary films.
His debut work, “Theo’s Gaze” (2003) looked at the work of Greek director Theo
Angelopoulos, while his award winning film “To Make an Example of” (2007)
explored the reasons behind the death of the hundreds of people executed since
the founding of the Turkish Republic. He has produced several awarded films
such as “Housekeeper”, “Sisters of Lilith” and “The Trace of the Butterfly”. He
is one of the founders of Documentarist Istanbul Documentary Days, which was
launched in 2008. He is currently living in Istanbul and Cairo.




************



Venís Desde Lejos
Esta es la historia de un árabe
que vino a Europa en la década de 1930, no para solicitar refugio sino para
apoyar a los europeos a librarse del fascismo.
Necesitamos tu ayuda para
completar la historia extraordinaria de Najati Sidki y su familia.

un voluntario árabe y he venido para defender Damasco en Guadalajara, Jerusalén

mundial, pasando por la nakba

familia durante 20 años.

sueños (2005), Vida (2008), 
Prohibido (2011)y La estela de la mariposa (2014)han sido premiados y proyectados en
numerosos festivales internacionales.


Necati Sonmez – Productor
