trabajado como crítico de cine y periodista antes de empezar a realizar
documentales. Su primera obra Theo’s Gaze
(2003) contempla el trabajo del director griego Theo Angelopoulos, mientras que
su premiado documental To Make an Example
of (2007) explora las razones de la ejecución de cientos de personas desde
la fundación de la república turca. Ha producido varios documentales que han
sido galardonados, como Housekeeper,
Sisters of Lilith y La estela de la mariposa.
Es uno de los fundadores de Documentarist Istanbul Documentary Days (2008).
Vive entre El Cairo y Estambul.

story:
Short Summary

Filmmaking became my passion when I realized the impact it can have on an audience. I never thought I can have someone tell me that I changed their life based upon my views. Through the art of film I've managed to expand my network and obtain knowledge I couldn't have received without the help of others. Telling a story is one thing, but having that story make a difference is what matters the most.

What We Need & What You Get

 The funds for this project will go towards film equipment and state of the art software. Adobe Premiere Pro has monthly fees which will help edit the films I make. HD SD cards run about $40 a piece. The camera itself is $1300 because it has a dual recording option for 4k and HD. The Ronin - M system is $1400, it is used to help with the stabilization of the camera. It has a motorized system to help with the pans and tilts. With these funds the necessary materials needed to create a professional quality film will be purchased.
The funders will receive all access on a private vimeo page to every project that is being created.

The Impact

 With this campaign I will be able to further my film career with the help of you. In the past I've managed to win multiple awards due to the support of others. Being able to make a powerful film can not only help me but help others too. With a small generous donation, I will be able to do what I love! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many other ways you can help too! Sharing this page and telling all your friends! Thanks!

story:
Her Turn: The Documentary is a LoveLight Productions documentary and brainchild of singer and author Myra Smith.  Her vision began in 2014 when Myra sought out to create a campaign that would empower women from all walks of life to own their stories.  This women’s empowerment campaign kicked off in March of 2014 with the unveiling of a body empowerment photo shoot for some of the women featured in Her Turn: The Documentary.  


After two years of false starts and setbacks the second phase of her vision, Her Turn: The Documentary, can come to fruition but not without your help.  


Her Turn: The Documentary tells the compelling stories of 13 women living, thriving, and surviving after experiences with domestic violence, rape, and mental health, and body issues.  Her Turn: The Documentary will give you, the viewer, the opportunity to connect deeper with the women in your own life, and even with yourself.  Through tears, rage, and laughter these women’s stories of heartbreak and triumph will leave you forever changed.  


LoveLight Productions believes that this documentary has the ability to not only change each viewer but the world as a whole, allowing us to give a voice to the voiceless and empower girls and women everywhere.  


In order to do this Her Turn: The Documentary needs your support.  


Over the course of 2016, three crowdfunding campaigns will take place.  This is the first and the funds from this campaign will be used to get Her Turn: The Documentary started.  


Your contribution to this first campaign will be paying for the following:


*Permits and Licensing

*Venue Securement

*Unit Production Manager and Staff Fee

*Down Payments For:

     Photographer Crews and Equipment

     Videographer Crews and Equipment

     Lighting Crews and Equipment

     Makeup Crews



Your contributions are the backbone to this project and we’re eternally grateful for your generosity.  If you believe in this as much as we do, please take a moment to not only contribute, but to share with your family, friends, coworkers, and passionate neighbors.  

Together we can spread these powerful stories and empower women everywhere.

story:
Short Summary

In this age of increasing entrepreneurship, art is more and more accessible. This is great news. We can choose to listen to whatever we want, watch whatever we want, and make whatever we want, instead of needing to rely on radios, TVs, or labels. We're all about that. 

We make the kind of music you can dance to. You can workout to. You can hang out to. We make positive music. Groovy music. VIBEY music. We want you to feel good! 

We're grabbing life by the horns on this next one. It's called "Flipside" and, with your help, it can get real crazy. I like making music, but my friends are the people who really turn this into something incredible. 

Our production team? They do things like cinematography and know about terms like "Dutch angles" and honestly, I'm not even prepared for what they have in store.

D'Angelo meets Trapstreet boys. It's turnt. Our boy Josh Zacher is doing the choreography, and he really doesn't mess around. 

The outfits?? Oh my god. 

We just like having fun making dope things. If that sounds like a good time to you, give us a shot. Join the Squad. Be the Squad. 

Love, 

Nic + the Squad

What We Need & What You Get

The generous Tisch School of the Arts is providing us with most of the equipment package. However, we need $2000 to help us cover the cost of the following: 

- Equipment: Camera Package and Additional Lights
- Trucking/Transportation of Equipment 
- Permits: Filming in NYC
- Costumes and Props
- Meals for the crew behind the camera 

The Impact

We have been lucky enough to know and grow up with so many talented people who aren't afraid to make the art that they want. In every community, there are people afraid to express themselves, artists who don't realize there are others like them. We want to encourage everyone to look within their communities and create something with someone else. It feels good. Let's work together more. That's what we're all about.

We really want to make music both intellectual and universal, something you can choose to dissect or just nod your head along to. "Flipside" is the embodiment of working together. In everything from the choreography to the lighting set-up, it's a melting pot of dancers, singers, producers, and visual artists all looking to meet one goal: inspire people while doing what we love, in the highest quality we can. 

Risks & Challenges

As with every film, we might run into some challenges. This could include technical issues with our equipment to entirely losing our shooting locations. Regardless, with the fiery determination of our hard-working team, we can resolve any of those issues. We've done it before.

Of course, our main obstacles right now lie in acquiring the funding necessary to make our dream a reality. At the end of the day, you are the one making this happen. We are very grateful for that.

Other Ways You Can Help

If funding us is not a possibility, that's totally cool. Feel free to share our campaign with all of your artistic and/or financially liberal connections!

story:
INTRODUCTION

Seat 25 is an ambitious project in which we hope to tell an extraordinary story.  It is also an opportunity for a group of young film-makers and actors to come together and create something for which they have full creative control and ownership.  We all have a passion for storytelling, film and art and we believe in the story we are telling.  But we need your help.

By investing any amount of money into our project you will be helping a group of young film-makers start a business at a time when young people are struggling to find investment for any type of business.  Please take the time to look at our promotional material and website and if you want to ask us about anything or just chat things through, please feel free to get in touch with us directly.  Thank you.

 

WHAT WE NEED

We are lucky that we have been given a huge number of favours which have enabled us to start principle photography.  But there are some things that are essential in order to finish our film and we have to pay for them.  Any money you invest in our film will go directly to:

 

  • Travel expenses
  • Food
  • Storage - computer hard drives to store and make safe the vast amounts of footage
  • Promotion 

In exchange for your hard earned money we are offering a range of exciting perks.  You will also join us on our film-making journey and become part of a group of people who together have produced a remarkable film.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Thank you for showing an interest in our film.  Even if you are unable to offer any financial help, you can still aid our production by spreading the word far and wide.  Any like, share, promotion on social media does untold good.  Please tell everyone you know about what we are doing and we will be forever grateful.

story:
Short Summary

A young woman, Hanna, comes home to her apartment for the evening. After a rather foreboding conversation with one of her friends involving recent disappearances in the area, and an old Native American boarding school that was burned down, she settles in to a seemingly hum-drum close of day. 


After hearing some strange noises, Hanna pauses her preparations for bed and goes to investigate other areas of her apartment. Ominous signs seem just beyond Hanna’s awareness, and she returns to her bedroom and goes to sleep. 

Her slumbers don’t last long however, and she wakes after a terrifying dream. Things take a horrifying turn for the worse as it becomes more apparent that someone – or something – has crept into her apartment. 


I began writing my Native American-themed short horror film,The Visitor, back in 2014. My objective was a pretty simple one: To make a scary film that had a Lovecraftian vibe but with a Native American twist. Having not gone to film school, I did as much research as I could and with a burning desire to make the film, dove right in. I formed a great group of people who became my crew for the project and after running a successful crowdfunding campaign for a little over $900.00, we created a film which in the words of my seasoned Director of Photography, Alex DelVecchio: “looks like it was made with a budget of around thirty times as much.” Alex was also kind enough to shoot using a RED Dragon at no extra charge.

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve done it – we've finished the The Visitor film, and the result was better than expected. However, as a novice to the film world I hadn’t anticipated the fees that come along with submitting films for consideration. What is needed are funds for various national and international film festivals. To get an idea as to how many horror film fests are out there, here's a list:

http://adriantofei.com/writings/top-100-international-horror-film-festivals.

I'm not asking for funds for all 100 film festivals, just the top 30, which average out to around the requested amount (minus the credit card and Indiegogo charges).
In return, backers are elligible to receive film posters, hand-crafted artwork and other merchandise, and even film credits at higher levels!

The Impact

This is the part where I need your help. I am very passionate about telling this story through the art of filmmaking, and believe that I have made a film that touches on subjects that need to be broadcast to the public, near and far.
As the writer, director, and producer of The Visitor, I have also also recently completed a screenplay for a feature length film which ties into The Visitor, titled The Black Sigil. This will be the first of a planned trilogy of creeping horror films which will also touch on Native American issues which are largely ignored or swept under the carpet (although viewers can also just enjoy them as pure experiences - it's not a heavy-handed thing).
Here is what people are saying about The Visitor so far:

Horrortalk: http://www.horrortalk.com/reviews/movie-reviews/5599-the-visitor-short-film-movie-review.html

TechZwn: http://techzwn.com/2015/06/the-visitor-is-a-return-to-classic-horror/

Dread Central: http://www.dreadcentral.com/reviews/105471/visitor-the-short-film/

Horror Society: http://www.horrorsociety.com/2015/06/09/trailer-the-visitor/

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks since this film has already been completed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can contribute to the campaign, you can always help to spread the word to your associates, friends, and family, in order to help us succeed! As independent filmmakers, we believe in transparent, organic, community-based support, and that each person can be play an integral part in making it happen. Here are some ways that you can help:

  • Share and 'like' The Visitor trailer (comments welcome!)
  • Give a 'like' on our Facebook page
  • Share this page on Facebook
  • Follow us on Twitter
  • Good ol' word-of-mouth

Use the indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/visitorfilm
Twitter: https://twitter.com/thevisitor_film
YouTube: https://youtu.be/sOAf79ivrUY
IMDb: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4759208

story:
Synopsis

"Lying in the Grass" is a neo noir revolving around Brendan and Frank’s search for the truth after Emily is mysteriously murdered. As the two friends start investigating, they uncover some shocking secrets that cause them to question each other and those around them.

About Me

My name is Jessica Rocco, and I am a graduating senior at Tulane University. This film will be the culmination of the skills I have learned during my four years in the Digital Media Production program here. I want to make the best film I can, which is why I need your help! 

Where will your money go?

While I have access to equipment through my program, I still need funds to help cover the cost of locations, the purchase of props, the rental of additional equipment, film festival entry fees, and, most importantly, meals for the cast and crew. I am lucky to have a team that is working for free, so my main priority is making sure they are well taken care of. 

About the team

Thalia Skaleris will be co-producing and ADing, and Frank Spiro will be the Director of Photography. Jessica Rocco, who co-wrote the film (along with the wonderful Mary Mac Jones), will also be co-producing and directing. Between the team are several successful projects, including "A Certain Identity," which was funded through Indiegogo. 

Why should you donate?

This film will premiere in May with the rest of my classmates' projects at the Prytania Theater, a popular movie theater in New Orleans. While this is very exciting, it also raises the bar for the level of quality expected, and some extra funding will provide the opportunity to make a higher quality production.

Help me, I'm poor

Like me, you may be a poor college student. I get it. Any amount donated is much appreciated, but if you can't donate, please pass this page along to your rich friends! Spreading the word is just as important!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ryan Khanna. I'm an upcoming director and writer here in Montreal, Canada. I've been putting out videos on RSKM productions (my YouTube channel) since 2013 and each one having a budget of almost 0$. I've been studying film for a long time now, with this project being the next big step for RKSM.

The film is called "Prey"; it focuses on a man who has survived an epidemic, which turns people into hideous creatures, and lives in the woods trying to survive. Although, what he doesn't know is that a monster has found it's way to him, testing the limits of who's the predator and who's the prey.

This is important to me because it's always been a huge dream of mine to make a monster movie in the vain of Alien, Predator, The Thing, etc. I've come up with a great story for this type of situation, putting lots of thought into it and I would love to make this come to life. 

Not only would it be a huge honour for you guys to fund this project, but I would try to make this a film that stands out from most monster movies and give you something you won't forget.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for 2,200$. This will be going towards editing software, VFX, crew, music, equipment and money for festival submission. 

Some of the perks you get for helping to fund this are getting updates on the film, signed exclusive artwork, a Skype call with me and the crew, executive producer status and so much more!

The Impact

There's a lack of good horror/creature films that have been released as of late and the goal of this project is to give the best film possible with a good story, character and... well, the monster itself.
I have been very accustomed to filming with no budget and working with a tight story to fit small situations. The small budget will let us really focus on the character himself, then saving the goodies for some truly memorable things sprinkled throughout the film.

Risks & Challenges

This will be a challenge, considering the fact that it's a very small crew, we're filming in natural light and not on sets, the budget is very limited without a lot of room for more and to try and get it done as soon as possible.

Although, with the small camera we're using, a vast territory to film in, the small amount of people being very fast to shoot with and a solid story, this will surely be challenges we can overcome.

Also, you know, money helps with that too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please share this project with friends, family, social groups, dogs, cats, aliens, anyone! The more coverage on this project the better!

You can use the sharing tools Indiegogo provides to make it easy to do so.

story:
Hi. I’m Bill Kellogg, marketing director for Tundra Comics, one of the fastest-growing newspaper comic strips on the planet. In February, 2016, three of my long-time friends and I—all passionate but recreational skiers—will film a reality TV series about the ultimate Alaskan ski adventure, showcasing the best Alaska has to offer, from the travel, lodging and dining, to the incredible skiing and Alaska's spectacular winter scenery.

Like you, I grew up watching all the incredible ski films, and they still get me all revved up for the season. But I don't relate to them as much as I used to. I’ve got a day job and a family, and although I still ski a lot, these days when I get big air, flip, or land backwards, it’s not on purpose.

So we’re going to make a show that appeals to all recreational skiers and snowboarders. We hope they’ll not only enjoy living vicariously through our experiences, but also start planning their own epic winter adventures. Think of PowderHunt Alaska as a cross between Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous and a Warren Miller ski films, but with old (ish) guys who are neither rich nor famous but who can still turn ‘em.

Here’s What We Still Need

Many people think that we'll make lots of money since our show has been picked up by a cable channel (GCI Alaska). However, local cable companies pay little to nothing for content. They will provide advertising for us to promote sales of our season 1 DVDs and products, but they do not pay us or help with our production costs. 

We appreciate donations of any amount, however, we are mainly asking for interested folks to help fund us by ordering a PowderHunt T-shirt, Sweatshirt or Hoodie, or pre-ordering our season 1 DVD or Blu Ray. We will also be hosting get-togethers with the cast & crew in Anchorage, Girdwood, Juneau and Fairbanks. For a small donation, you can join us at your most convenient location, Beer, soft drinks and snacks will be provided.

Our adventure will take more than two weeks to film and we still need more help to fund the following:

  • The film crew and film production (at their cost).
  • Travel to Alaska and between destinations.
  • Food and lodging.
  • The portion of heli-skiing and lift ticket costs not covered by our ski destination sponsors.
  • Insurance, permits and licenses

Other Ways You Can Help

There are a few other things we could use to help make this show a reality.

- Alaska Airlines Miles - We have to move a crew of 10 and a lot of gear in and around the state.

- Go Pro Cameras - We are looking to borrow several more Go Pro Cameras for our shoot. Cameras will be returned after filming.

- Two Way Radios - We are looking to borrow several more two-way radios for our shoot. Radios will be returned after filming as well.

- Business Owners - We will be trying to promote local businesses with our TV Show. If you have a restaurant or a product that you think might be of use on our show, we would like to talk to you. So far we have sponsors providing us with meals, hotel rooms, ski jackets, beer, coffee and more. In exchange, we will feature them on an episode of our show. And remember, there is no forced drama in our show. If we can't show your business in a positive light, we will not show it at all.

You can order a PowderHunt Alaska t-shirt here (or anything from this site), and all proceeds go towards funding our show. http://comics-more.myshopify.com/collections/all

story:
Prepare yourself for action adventure like you have never seen it before, poorly lit and starring people that you have never heard of.  The Adventures of Indiana James is an online web series produced by Thomas Pimentel and TNT LTD. PRODUCTIONS.  This action/adventure/parroty (NOT A TYPO), spoofs The Indiana Jones films while telling an original storyline wrapped around the music and influences of Jimmy Buffett.  Truly a one of a kind experience, Indiana James tips its fedora to some of the greatest films ever made including Young Frankenstein, Star Wars, Blazing Saddles, The Blues Brothers, Airplane and many more.   An action/comedy with a cast of hundreds.

Coming to Vimeo in summer 2016.  Join us for the adventure.  You'll be sorry that you did.  Thank you and Phinz up!

We are seeking completion funds to complete this highly anticipated web series, The Adventures of Indiana James.  Notable people from the entertainment world

including Jimmy Buffett and Frank Marshall, the producer of Indiana Jones, have seen rough cuts of our project and are waiting for us to complete it.  Our

production is also a part of a documentary titled, Parrot Heads, that will be coming out later in 2016.  Our goal is to have the web series stream on Vimeo

when the project is completed.  We knew that making a parroty (get it, parroty instead of parody!)  of the Indiana Jones movies would be popular since the
films have been so successful all over the world.

 

“All About the Show”

  Dr. Indiana James is a professor at The New England University of Mixology and is a favorite among the student body for his dedication to Mixology and adventures around the world.

The web series Chapters will be less than 30 minutes each and will be streamed on Vimeo in high quality HD with, premium sound mixing and original music by composer, T.J. Kross.  

 http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4581550/?ref_=fn_al_...


The series will be follow a story arc and will be concluded with a forty minute companion piece that ends at Area 51 in a climactic battle.

 

Our cast includes - http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1951148/)

Thomas Pimentel  starring as Indiana James

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1582660/


Jimmy Walker-Pearson starring as Dr. Marcus Denny

http://m.imdb.com/name/nm2800506/


Christina Rondano starring as Marion Greatwoods

http://www.take12tom.com/indianajamescast.html

Michael LoPresti as Captain Jack Ticketscalper

http://www.take12tom.com/indianajamescast.html


We knew however that it would be risky to incorporate the Jimmy Buffett twist but since I am a lifelong Parrot Head and Indy fan, it made sense to me.  The similarities between Buffett and Indiana Jones are pretty amazing and weaving the two genres was actually quite easy once we got started.  The web series is done in the style of the old Mel Brooks movies, Airplane, and Naked Gun.  The jokes and action are not forced but instead come naturally and move our story along.  You can also expect to see a few song and dance numbers along the way.  We recreated all of the set pieces from the original Raiders of the Lost Ark film.  It was monumental but it adds to the authenticity of the project which is something that we want the audience to feel.  This project has been ambitious to say the least but when it is completed it will be epic. 

 

We’re 98% Done and Need Just a Little More Gas

98% of the series is done in terms of shooting and post production.  This crowdfunding campaign helps us raise the funds we need to finish post production and editing so it’s ready for the world.


We have many ways of thanking you for backing us including full download access to the series.




We also have lots of cool swag for backers so pick the perks you like and we’ll ship them right out to you.  They’re already made, ready and in stock and ready to go.



 

Our Production company is also the largest military and law enforcement prop rental company in New England.  Take a look at our huge inventory that you can use for your next production.  We have some amazing Prop Packages available as perks.  www.take12tom.com

 $150 USD

FILM MAKERS! Prop Package

A 300 dollar Prop Package from TNT LTD. PRODUCTIONS. Choose from our vast inventory of props to use in your own production, film, or reward video. www.take12tom.com Standard prop agreement applies. 

 

We just need your help to get us to the finish line.  Please help us Indiegogo supporters.  You're our only hope!

stock and ready to go.  Our Production company is also the largest military and law enforcement prop rental company in New England.  Take a look at our huge inventory that you can use for your next production.  We have some amazing Prop Packages available as perks.  www.take12tom.com $150
      
        USD
        
      
    
FILM MAKERS! Prop Package
  A
 300 dollar Prop Package from TNT LTD. PRODUCTIONS. Choose from our vast
 inventory of props to use in your own production, film, or reward 
video.  www.take12tom.com  Standard prop agreement applies.  
 We just need your help to get us to the finish line.  Please help us Indiegogo supporters.  You're our only hope!

story:
No matter who you are, or where you come from, anyone can be radicalised...

Peace Be Upon Him is a 25-minute single drama in which a British man becomes radicalised by a white pride group following his brother's execution at the hands of Islamic State militants.

Celebrating TEN YEARS in 2016, Seraphim Pictures is going to bring you Peace Be Upon Him, a drama about the rise of Islamophobia in the UK, and the frustration that citizens feel in a world where the politicians don't seem to care.  With the powers that be ignoring the plight of the ordinary man, people are taking the law into their own hands, often with disastrous consequences.

SERAPHIM PICTURES is a UK independent film company based outside of Cardiff, South Wales.  The Company was accredited by the 59th Festival de Cannes for its short film The Things Unsaid in 2006, and has since then had worked screened across Europe, the Middle East and North Africa.  After producing short films the Company is now looking towards LONG-FORM SHORTS, straddling the space between feature films and conventional shorts; Peace Be Upon Him is the first of these projects.

The film will be produced in August 2016, with a view to taking it to the American Film Market in Los Angeles this November.  We need YOUR help in bringing this story to arthouse theatres, broadcast, online and mobile media.  We believe it's important to give a voice to the underrepresented on both sides of the divide.

Production will take place in CARDIFF and will introduce people from the Muslim community to the film world.  We will be offering paid positions to people looking to enter into the industry in all stages of the production process, so that people will have ownership of a story that directly affects them.

The film will be accompanied by a short MAKING-OF DOCUMENTARY showing the different communities of Cardiff that come together to make the film.  The documentary will be screened at the film's premiere and online.

But what happens if we don't meet our entire goal?  Well for starters we'll feel more than a bit sad...however as explained above we'll have other methods of funding to produce the film.  This would mean doing things cheaper with lower production values - we'd have to slash department budgets and pay people expenses rather than the wages that they deserve.  Peace Be Upon Him will still be made, but we know you'd rather we make it with as big a budget as possible!  So dig deep - this project depends on YOU to be the best it can be!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't commit money to the campaign there are other ways in which you can help us:

  • Add our twibbon to your Twitter and Facebook profiles - it's FREE!
  • Thunderclap our campaign to your Twitter followers - also FREE!!
  • Use the IndieGoGo sharing tools to spread awareness - again, FREE!!!

All it costs is your time and effort to get the word out.  We're grateful for every like, share and pound that we can get!

story:
Madrina is a short film that follows Maria, the daughter of an ailing mob boss, Gennaro. When denied the right to take over, Maria must assert her power over her husband, Anthony, and rival boss, Don Lo Russo, to become a Mafiosa. 

 

  Chad Cox | Writer/Director 

A native of Kennesaw, Georgia, Chad grew up being an avid film nerd, including riding his bike to his local Blockbuster to rent movies (R.I.P. Blockbuster). After dabbling with video production in high school Chad has gone on to study Mass Media Arts at the University of Georgia where he has served as producer of Picture Perfect, 1st Assistant Camera on Dell'Orto's Werewolf, as well as director/writer/DP/editor of a 1-minute short Awake. A big fan horror, mob movies, and Robert De Niro; he combined his film inspirations in writing the screenplay for Madrina. After graduation, Chad plans on moving to Los Angeles to become a filmmaker.

 

    Isabel De La Cruz as Maria

    Norio Nishimura as Anthony

    Barry Piacente as Don

    John Penick as Gennaro

 

 

 

We have carefully crafted out a budget to include all the necessary elements to make a great film. Your generous donation will go towards:

 

  • Equipment Rentals: We need a camera, lights, lenses and sound equipment in order to make this look and sound beautiful.
  • Craft Services: We have a dedicated cast and crew who are volunteering their time to be apart of this production. Since we can't pay the fee we must pay to feed!
  • Art Department: We need the guns, knives, blood and all the other props and set dressing in order to make this mob come to life!
  • Locations: While we were able to get some locations free of charge, we still have some that come at a price.
  • Festival Costs: The film will premiere in Athens, GA in May. After that we will be submitting the film to at least 5 local and nation festivals, but need to make sure we can cover the entry fees.

 

  Jana French | Producer

While Cleveland, Ohio and Marietta, Georgia native Jana Lynn French is late to the movie producing scene, she is not new to leading teams in completing other large projects. After two summers as Editor in Chief at The Red&Black, one year as General Manager at WUOG 90.5 FM and countless hours watching The Sopranos, producing a mob film seemed to be the next natural step. And seeing as she is graduating from the Mass Media Arts program at the University of Georgia in May of 2016, now seemed like the perfect time to take on a new project. Her work on Madrina comes from a place of love for helping people achieve their dreams and watching tasteful violence on screen. Plus, with family still in Youngstown, Ohio, she is the resident Italian food expert. While French is more of a James Gandolfini fan, she has mad respect for the work of Robert De Niro.

 

 

  Matt Audino | Cinematographer

From Perth, Western Australia, Matt has 2 Certificates in Film and Television Broadcasting and a Bachelor's Degree in Film. He has had experience working on Music Videos, Commercial and Promotional Content for small businesses, Multi-cam Broadcast Productions and Short and Feature films throughout the Perth Film Industry. He has a strong passion for film and early cinema and has been an avid film-buff since an early age. Matt has travelled across Georgia doing Freelance work for a Production House where he was challenged in a variety of different filming conditions. His strongest field is in the camera department, though efficient in multiple areas of film production. He is a committed crew member with a strong work-ethic and will always strive to achieve a high-standard of work. 

  Sarah Cooper | 1st Assistant Director

Nicknamed “Coop” by many, Sarah Cooper is a Mass Media Arts student from Duxbury, Massachusetts. An avid saxophone player, Sarah’s love of film soundtracks soon lead to a love of film. At the University of Georgia Sarah has produced her first short film, “Bad Influence.” When Sarah is not working on film projects she can be found at Grady Newsource pretending she knows how live new programs work. After graduation Sarah plans to become a filmmaker and travel the world.

  LeJoi Lane | Unit Production Manager 

  Greyson Guldenschuh | 1st AC

  Brad Gerke | Sound/Composer

 

  Katie Hall | Art Director

  Taylor Garland | Art Director

 

  Josh Remmele | Lead Editor

  Gareth Kanter | Assistant Editor

 

  Megan Catoe | Production Assistant

 

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand not everyone can financially support our endeavor, but you can help us out in other ways:

    • Sharing our page on Facebook or Twitter
    • Liking our Facebook fan page for updates and more!

story:
Short Summary

The Wretched is about three young actors who travel to New York for film shoots. While on their journey to New York they decide to be spectators to the many road side attractions, one being a Haunted Bed & Breakfast, which may be more than they bargained for...


Hello!

Who Are We?

We are the Bearded Dragon, A collection of filmmakers from throughout Oklahoma. We come from a multitude of backgrounds ranging in Film making to business. A few months ago we decided to embark on the adventure of creating a feature length horror film.


Each of us has done our fair share of series, short films, and commercial. We decided to make this film cause one of our own, Nathaniel Davis, made a feature last year (He did this before the collective was conceived) and did most of the shooting casting and editing himself. Later he met another member of our crew, Mia Riddle, and pitched her the idea of doing an "Out There" horror film. With this film they wanted to create a movie that has great production value, and that was character driven.

 From there we accumulated more people on our team and thus The Bearded Dragon was born.


If We are Able to Raise the Funds for this Film


We will be able to have the high production value that we need and, with any luck, distribute the film to the masses. The dream is get it to film festivals every where. We would love to have our little collective grow into budding filmmakers, editors, actors, and business people. We believe the funds will aide in our growth and will give us the ability to have a great production.

-Decent Equipment:


The Deets

What we really need:

Equipment that lets us do what we need to do

-camera sliders

-rigs

-follow focuses

-lighting equipment

-varies lenses. 

-Food: During the production we are going to spend long days on a set shooting in Oklahoma, in the summer which means triple digit tempatures.  We'd like to be able to always be able to provide our film family with cold beverages, and warm food.

-Pay our actors and crew (even if it's just with food, gas, and a place to crash for the shoot).

-Pay for housing for our actors: Some actors we have flying in from the U.K. most of us have families and really small houses, we would rather she stay comfortably in a hotel room that doesn't have kids running around.


What We Need & What You Get


We have had our math monkeys do some calculations and the consensus was that we will be able to make this film with a minimum of $10,000. This is mainly for the equipment and food. Our actors would get paid some but not much(about $50-$100)


Now, I bet you're wondering, "What in it for me?". See below or to the side...


Perks!







Risks & Challenges


Some of the risks and challenges that come with making a film on a low budget is that it's "low budget". Meaning you can't get too much for free or by donation and volunteering. When people hear that you are making a film, the first thing that usually comes to mind is,"What is it about?" then when you ask if you can use their place for shooting they then ask,"How much will I get" usually they aren't keen on just letting us use it. On the occasion that they are interested in letting us use the house they back out last minute because the story is...well... A little "out there". It helps if we have a little cash to throw down to give a little more credibility.


"I'd Love to Help But I'm Broke"


Chill! it's cool. If you are not able to help out this time there are other ways you can help!

-Share our Facebook page

-Follow US and our Characters form the film on Twitter

-Check us on Intsagram

-Also spread the word about our website


We are really excited to begin production on this film. Check out our progress and everything on our website, TheWretched-movie.com

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hey guys, if you are on this page then you probably know me. but here we go.

To continue playing in the magic the gathering grand prix this summer and continue chasing a cup, I am turning to crowd funding to hopefully help me out a little bit. The money is simply for a plane ticket to Providence, and a plane ticket to Dallas.

Unfortunately, it costs a fair bit of money to travel around and play this wonderful game if you aren't on the pro level or don't have a sponsorship. I have been playing for about 16 years of my life and want to continue to grow as a player and hopefully one day be a professional.

Thanks for your time!

story:
Hello!

Thank you for contributing and sharing  

        Twisted campaign.

Participating in sharing and donating includes you in the journey to create Twisted with us. Twisted is the next original film from Passion Media Productions.

If you just can't donate right now please feel free to share the link and spread the word!

 

  • Share the link on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
  • Send an email to family and friends

 

"I appreciate the help and support to complete my first feature film. I am excited to see the story come to life and I hope you enjoy the finished film. There is a long road ahead to make a feature film, having worked on other people's films I know all the hard work involved and I am prepared and ready to create a quality film you will be proud to have supported.' Leanne Campbell 2015

                             

Leanne Campbell the Writer/Director/Producer previously wrote, directed and produced the short film Love in Motion, more information about her is included at the end.

"Adrian had it all, a happy healthy family, good job and he loved being a father.
On top of the world, no one could have prepared him for the next journey his life was about to take, he didn't  expect it, what will he do now? "

Gerard Mack - Cacophony Audio/Post Production
 


Gerard Mack has come from an music and audio production background with degrees in classical music, violin performance and post graduate studies in composition at Melbourne University. He has had a long history in classical performance, electronic music production and live audio production for musical theatre, bands, opera, feature film, advertising, composition and recording of classical concerts. Gerard is the owner of Cacophony Studios, specializing in audio post and music production, location recording, and live broadcast. He is presently working several feature films as sound designer and composer and has recently
been asked to be come a judge for the AACTA awards.

Prolific Melbourne Actor Albert Goikhman starring as Adrian.



Albert is a huge supporter of the independent film industry in Melbourne and has appeared in many Independent film projects, student films and music video's. Leanne began working with Albert after seeing his performance in 'Deeper than Yesterday', a film that has won many awards itself. Leanne saw one moment in the film where she thought Albert could do a drama role and wrote the short film 'Love in Motion' for him. Having successfully producing 'Love in Motion',

Leanne started writing another short film, however the feedback from fellow film makers that she gained after reading her drafts, encouraged her to increased the short film into a feature.  Albert asked to audition for the short film before it was completed and was sent a draft of the short film Twisted. His passion for the film and his dedication and professionalism earned him the lead role.

Albert Goikhman is an actor, known for Goldfield (2013), Smothered (2012) and The Wannabe Secret Agent (2011).

Challenges

1. Develop a script that is solid. We are still working on the script atm to make sure we are ready to film. We don't intend to rush into filming which is a common mistake first time feature film makers make. We know it's going to be a long, hard process as most of us have worked on projects  that require a long commitment.

2. Assemble a team that is all working to the same goal. At this stage we have not completed our film team because we want to make sure everyone is on the same page and excited to be making the film. This is important because all decisions will be based on what is best for the film only.

3. Finding the right people to be in the film. It's always a challenge when you know a lot of actors who are friends to cast the right person for your film when friends want to work on it. We have chosen to use a panel of people for the auditions so that there is no question about the people that are cast are right for the film

4. Developing an audience. This is probably the most difficult aspect of a film. How can you develop and audience when they haven't seen the film. This crowdfunding campaign, the facebook page and the website will all be used to develop a presence and help people decide if this film project means something to them that they want to partner with us and be a part of the process. :-)

5. Securing quality locations for shooting. Each location must fit with the film to bring something of value to the project. We don't want to just use whatever we can get to make the film. It is important that all aspects of the film is strong.

6. The biggest challenge is how is my film of benefit to the people supporting the project. I would love to make sure that those who partner with us also feel valued and a part of the team


The Brotherhood of Fathers is a charity organisation to support father's and their right to be able to see their own children often in situations where the mother is unfit to care for her own children. This issue is causing men to suicide regularly, we hope our story in Twisted will highlight some of the pain good father's go through when they can't see their children.

Leith Erikcon is out there fighting against one of Australia's massive injustices. 21 fathers a week commit suicide thanks to custody issues. People lie to manipulate the system around them, and the courts do nothing to protect the innocent. Just because you're a child's mother, doesn't mean you're deserving. We need to change the thought that mothers are always the best option, there's a lot of dads far more deserving.
 

What we need the funds for

1. Feed the cast and crew. ( yep that's their wages till film is completed :-)  )
2. Hire equipment (only what is necessary)
3. Pay location fees (sadly because we need some specific locational set ups were looking at having to pay for them or make sets to replicated them)
4. SFX makeup (We need a lot of blood!)
5. Post Sound (Sound has to be awesome)
6. Advertising materials for the film (Otherwise no one will come and see it and what's the point of that??)
7. Film classification in Australia (We already know we are looking at $2,500 as a minimum to get film classification in Australia so it can be screened in cinema's)

8. DCP production. (As yet were not sure how much exactly it is going to cost but I know it is expensive
9. We are employing an Australian composer to create original music for the film.
10. Administration and transportation costs.

Miscellaneous items we haven't accounted for.

Justine Jones Composer
 


Justine Jones is a saxophonist, vocalist, composer and producer from Melbourne,
Australia. She recently released the album “That Fate” with Hammond combo on her newly established record label JJAS, which has also released her previous albums “As You Do”, ”Live on 3CR”, ”Themes to Assumption day”, ”Transversing” and vintage jazz recordings, her father Brian Jones, made in the 60s, 70s and 80s “Live at the Troika1973”

Sharing her musical knowledge, for years, Justine consistently produced and
presented radio shows, “Groovoire” on 106.7 PBS FM, 1999-2004, “Radio Mama” on 3CR 2004-2008, and Night Owl Jazz, on 103.5 MBS FM, 2008-11.
In 2007-8 she produced & presented a 6 part TV show, “The Jazz Show” broadcast
on Ch31 with Mark Fitzgibbon, which featured her compositions, and was nominated for 3 Antenna awards. In 2012 she became a composer for Studio 51 (USA) writing and producing music for film and TV.


 

Writer/Director/Producer Leanne Campbell has worked extensively in the last 6 years as a cast member and as a crew member on feature films, short films, TV shows including Wentworth and commercials.
 

      


Up until 2009 Leanne had never considered films as a career option but all that changed when she was on set for 'Knowing' a feature film staring Nicolas Cage. In 2010 she once again delved into the film area on the program 'Wifred' These two experiences sparked the journey she is now on.

Joining 'Metro' TV, a member group of Channel 31, she began learning all the aspects of film and TV production on the job. During this time she began developing ideas of what she wanted to produce in film and TV. Leanne has been working on perfecting her techniques so that her skills are of the highest quality. Not satisfied with just learning at Metro, began developing networks within the film community and started volunteering on student films to gain more experience and greater opportunities.

Six Lovers was her first break into crew work on an independent feature film where she learned valuable skills and set experience. Further developing her passion for the industry. This dissatisfaction with waiting pushes her to find ways to learn and she now knows her way around sets and has gained valuable knowledge regarding how the actors and crews interact with each other and valuable skills for both crew and on screen work.

In 2012 Leanne traveled to Los Angeles to attend the 'Taxi' music conference and met Lani Ford a singer/songwriter from New York and filmed and edited the music video for her song 'Lies I want to hear' in association with Justine Jones.

Leanne began her own production company Passion Media Productions because she wanted to create some memorable and life changing films where 'normal' is actually represented in the films. Her ideas for films are such that she is always looking for different stories to tell or a different view point. In 2013 Leanne began thinking about script writing wrote a short film script 'Love in Motion' which she also directed. Having never edited a film before she has been learning how to use the editing software to edit the film.

Currently she has 4 other scripts in various stages of completion with her first feature script 'Twisted' being assessed.Leanne has been working in the industry in various ways including some notable TV shows. Three seasons of Wentworth, various appearances on Winners and Losers and Neighbours. Films include, The Cup, 10 Terrorists, Healing, the award winning Tropfest film 'We've all been there'.

In recent years she has supported films here and in the United states.'Touch' by director Dawn Fields USA, 'Found' by director Dawn Fields USA, 'Short Distance' by director Nic Barker AUS, the award winning film The Dead Guy in the Trunk' directed by Lucas Scheffel AUS and Red Sky Candidate 5238 directed by Stewart Marshall AUS.

2016 saw Leanne saw the need for a premium diverse film festival and branch out, successfully run the POP international film festival which is now an annual film festival to complement the work she is currently doing, negotiating with regional locations to be able to run them in country Victoria in the future. Leanne is also a radio presenter in her local community on 99.1 Smart FM.

 

Her passion for creating stories that are different to the mainstream is evident in all the scripts she is writing. A prolific writer she has 4 feature film scripts at various stages of completion and all of them will leave the audience with an impression that they never thought the film would go that way.

Twisted is the first of the scripts that have been honed and finished read to go into pre production. Following Twisted (psycological) she has The Doll maker(Thriller), Booty Boys (comedy) and Broken Sunshine (drama) to create. Leanne developed her skills on set and is now supplementing her learning studying a Bachelor of Film at SAE.
 

IMDB links Leanne Campbell
Albert Goikhman
Gerard from Cacophony
Composer Justine Jones

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't donate right now please feel free to share the link and spread the word!

  • Share the link on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
  • Send an email to family and friends

Thank you for your support!

story_txt:
Hello! 
Thank you for contributing and sharing  
        Twisted campaign.
Participating in sharing and donating includes you in the journey to create Twisted with us. Twisted is the next original film from Passion Media Productions.If you just can't donate right now please feel free to share the link and spread the word! 

Share the link on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
Send an email to family and friends

 
"I appreciate the help and support to complete my first feature film. I am excited to see the story come to life and I hope you enjoy the finished film. There is a long road ahead to make a feature film, having worked on other people's films I know all the hard work involved and I am prepared and ready to create a quality film you will be proud to have supported.' Leanne Campbell 2015                               Leanne Campbell the Writer/Director/Producer previously wrote, directed and produced the short film Love in Motion, more information about her is included at the end."Adrian had it all, a happy healthy family, good job and he loved being a father.On top of the world, no one could have prepared him for the next journey his life was about to take, he didn't  expect it, what will he do now? "Gerard Mack - Cacophony Audio/Post Production 
Gerard Mack has come from an music and audio production background with degrees in classical music, violin performance and post graduate studies in composition at Melbourne University. He has had a long history in classical performance, electronic music production and live audio production for musical theatre, bands, opera, feature film, advertising, composition and recording of classical concerts. Gerard is the owner of Cacophony Studios, specializing in audio post and music production, location recording, and live broadcast. He is presently working several feature films as sound designer and composer and has recentlybeen asked to be come a judge for the AACTA awards.Prolific Melbourne Actor Albert Goikhman starring as Adrian.Albert is a huge supporter of the independent film industry in Melbourne and has appeared in many Independent film projects, student films and music video's. Leanne began working with Albert after seeing his performance in 'Deeper than Yesterday', a film that has won many awards itself. Leanne saw one moment in the film where she thought Albert could do a drama role and wrote the short film 'Love in Motion' for him. Having successfully producing 'Love in Motion',Leanne started writing another short film, however the feedback from fellow film makers that she gained after reading her drafts, encouraged her to increased the short film into a feature.  Albert asked to audition for the short film before it was completed and was sent a draft of the short film Twisted. His passion for the film and his dedication and professionalism earned him the lead role.Albert Goikhman is an actor, known for Goldfield (2013), Smothered (2012) and The Wannabe Secret Agent (2011).Challenges  1. Develop a script that is solid. We are still working on the script atm to make sure we are ready to film. We don't intend to rush into filming which is a common mistake first time feature film makers make. We know it's going to be a long, hard process as most of us have worked on projects  that require a long commitment.2. Assemble a team that is all working to the same goal. At this stage we have not completed our film team because we want to make sure everyone is on the same page and excited to be making the film. This is important because all decisions will be based on what is best for the film only.3. Finding the right people to be in the film. It's always a challenge when you know a lot of actors who are friends to cast the right person for your film when friends want to work on it. We have chosen to use a panel of people for the auditions so that there is no question about the people that are cast are right for the film4. Developing an audience. This is probably the most difficult aspect of a film. How can you develop and audience when they haven't seen the film. This crowdfunding campaign, the facebook page and the website will all be used to develop a presence and help people decide if this film project means something to them that they want to partner with us and be a part of the process. :-)5. Securing quality locations for shooting. Each location must fit with the film to bring something of value to the project. We don't want to just use whatever we can get to make the film. It is important that all aspects of the film is strong.6. The biggest challenge is how is my film of benefit to the people supporting the project. I would love to make sure that those who partner with us also feel valued and a part of the teamThe Brotherhood of Fathers is a charity organisation to support father's and their right to be able to see their own children often in situations where the mother is unfit to care for her own children. This issue is causing men to suicide regularly, we hope our story in Twisted will highlight some of the pain good father's go through when they can't see their children.Leith Erikcon is out there fighting against one of Australia's massive injustices. 21 fathers a week commit suicide thanks to custody issues. People lie to manipulate the system around them, and the courts do nothing to protect the innocent. Just because you're a child's mother, doesn't mean you're deserving. We need to change the thought that mothers are always the best option, there's a lot of dads far more deserving. What we need the funds for 1. Feed the cast and crew. ( yep that's their wages till film is completed :-)  )2. Hire equipment (only what is necessary)3. Pay location fees (sadly because we need some specific locational set ups were looking at having to pay for them or make sets to replicated them)4. SFX makeup (We need a lot of blood!)5. Post Sound (Sound has to be awesome)6. Advertising materials for the film (Otherwise no one will come and see it and what's the point of that??)7. Film classification in Australia (We already know we are looking at $2,500 as a minimum to get film classification in Australia so it can be screened in cinema's)8. DCP production. (As yet were not sure how much exactly it is going to cost but I know it is expensive9. We are employing an Australian composer to create original music for the film.10. Administration and transportation costs.Miscellaneous items we haven't accounted for.Justine Jones Composer 
Justine Jones is a saxophonist, vocalist, composer and producer from Melbourne,Australia. She recently released the album “That Fate” with Hammond combo on her newly established record label JJAS, which has also released her previous albums “As You Do”, ”Live on 3CR”, ”Themes to Assumption day”, ”Transversing” and vintage jazz recordings, her father Brian Jones, made in the 60s, 70s and 80s “Live at the Troika1973”Sharing her musical knowledge, for years, Justine consistently produced andpresented radio shows, “Groovoire” on 106.7 PBS FM, 1999-2004, “Radio Mama” on 3CR 2004-2008, and Night Owl Jazz, on 103.5 MBS FM, 2008-11.In 2007-8 she produced & presented a 6 part TV show, “The Jazz Show” broadcaston Ch31 with Mark Fitzgibbon, which featured her compositions, and was nominated for 3 Antenna awards. story:
Welcome To Our Crew!

My name is Barry Kirsch. I am the writer, producer and director for Chasing Photons, a steampunk genre film set in the 1880s. After 40+ years as an investigative photojournalist I am taking a radical departure to bring this fantasy story to life.


When an intellectually superior boy of eight decides to build a spaceship to race photons, he learns to trust in a few friends while realizing other, sinister characters desire his knowledge and his very being, so he must leave his friends, destroy his accomplishments and seek the freedom of space.

One of the primary goals for this film is to shoot the entire film without CGI (computer graphics). This entails a lot of building. Tank is real. The spaceship in the film is real. The people, costumes and buildings are all real. Most action/fantasy films today are at least 50% computer generated.
Your contributions allow us to make, purchase and otherwise acquire the props we need for the film. The better funded we are, the more enjoyable and realistic the movie.


We Need $230,000 To Make This Film

This is the minimum necessary to complete this film. There is a reason why you see so many names during a movie’s end credits. Simply put, it takes a lot of people to produce a movie. A larger budget allows us to bring more talent to the film resulting in a better experience for the audience.

Our Stretch Goal of $350,000

Reaching our stretch goal will allow us create better props, nicer costumes and more awesome effects used in the film.

So what do you get for your contributions beside an awesome movie experience?
  • Movie posters
  • Tank's voices your smartphone greeting
  • Chasing Photons DVDs
  • Own props used in the film
  • See your name in the credits
  • Spend a day on set
  • Attend the special world premiere showing of the film
  • And many more cool rewards

The Impact

In a world of blockbuster action hero films and animated characters, there is still room for a beautiful story to be told using "real" people, places and props.

Our budget may be small, but with the very talented crew and cast we have assembled we aim to bring filmmaking back to its roots.

Steampunk is a beautiful movement and is now finding it's way into everyday fashion, art and film. This will be one of the first feature length steampunk oriented films.

Timeline & Challenges

Our goal is to complete primary shooting by early November! This means we are on a very tight schedule both for pre-production and actual filming. Editing will commence at the same time as shooting starts. This is followed by scoring by our wonderful composer Matthew Jantzen. Scoring is followed by sound design provide by Bob Katz, the man who literally wrote the book on sound engineering.

The challenge is to have a finished film by the end of April, 2016.

With your help, we can't help but make it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us to get the word out and share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, the water cooler where you work and anywhere else you can.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Gist

Here are a few details you guys need to know:

  • I'm Alicia Quezada! I am a student filmmaker!
  • My film is a social commentary and satire on double standards that deter women from living and experiencing life's joys fully.
  • Contributors would make this vision a reality and, through the use of comedy and absurdity, it would help expose the unaccommodating culture women live in.

I want as many people as possible to see this film. Which means getting it on any platform including festivals, YouTube, and other social media outlets.

What You Can Help Me Get!

The breakdown:

  • The amount I'd like to raise  for this film is two thousand dollars.
  • This film will be an exercise in surreality! There are instances of extreme absurdity taking place with the use of sophisticated film tricks and special effects.
  • Funds would go towards paying actors, providing food for crew and all extra props.

The Impact

This film will be humorous and thought-provoking.

  • This is an opportunity for you to be a part of a work that has hope for a change. By giving people insight as to what it's like to be a woman and have to perform the most regular pastimes that men take for granted.
  • I have never raised money for past productions, but I am wonderful at making my visions become a reality so any contribution would give me an enormous head start.
  • Any interested parties are welcome to add me on Facebook, Instagram and Tumblr for more personal look at who I am, what I believe in, and what I'm doing with the project as I'm doing it.

Risks & Challenges

 Getting everything prepared and organized and ready to be filmed into certain time frames without wasting any time is going to be a serious challenge but does not deter my determination in making this film happen.

  • This is the 4th film I have directed and based off of the demands I've encountered in my filmmaking career, I believe that anything is possible.
  • I plan to keep an open communication with all parties involved in this production and ensure that every last goal is met.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has money to donate which is why simply spreading the word about our production would honestly mean the world to us:

  • Feel free to use sights like Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube to include people in our plan!
  • Indiegogo provides users with the share tools necessary to get the word out!

.Thank you to anyone who took the time to read this!
