story:
Short Summary

How can one person's contribution have the most impact on the betterment of people's lives?

On World Vasectomy Day, taking place November 13, hundreds of doctors from more than 40 countries are going to perform thousands of vasectomies.

A vasectomy is a simple and cheap procedure that can literally turn a family's life around. With just $30 you're allowing someone to get a vasectomy, someone who might not otherwise have access to reliable birth control.

By getting a vasectomy and having fewer children, men can give their families the chance to rise out of poverty. Smaller families also mean fewer resources are consumed and less pollution is produced. How much less? A whole lifetime's worth.

That's quite an impact for a such a meager amount.

Matching Donation

The goal amount isn't there just for show. A donor has already committed to contributing another $5,000 to World Vasectomy Day if we manage to do our part.

Technically this means that any amount you pledge is worth double.

What is a Vasectomy?


Vasectomy is a surgical procedure for male permanent contraception. During the procedure, the vasa deferentia are severed in a manner so as to prevent sperm from entering into the ejaculate. Vasectomies are usually performed in a physician's office or medical clinic. The procedure is not complicated, the incisions small, and the necessary equipment routine.

                        

                                   

Due its simplicity, a vasectomy usually takes less than thirty minutes. After a short recovery at the doctor's office, the patient is sent home. Because the procedure is minimally invasive, many vasectomy patients can resume their typical sexual behavior within a week.

Read more on Wikipedia.

What We Need & What You Get

All funds from this campaign are sent directly to World Vasectomy Day, which is a USA non-profit. The money will be used to produce the event that engages with men and providers around the globe. It will be used to spark conversation and ignite men to action for the benefit of themselves, their families, and the planet. 

If enough funds are available, World Vasectomy Day intends to expand the scope of the event to include more countries. Want your country to join in? We do too.

We are asking each of you to give what you can. If you give $30 that's about the cost for each WVD inspired vasectomy.  The event costs $120,000 and we expect to do 4,000 vasectomies. That’s $30 each. What does that mean? Well, for a man who had never thought to get a vasectomy, it might mean saving his wife’s life or making it easier to help his children emerge from poverty or it might lower carbon footprint 28 times more than a lifetime of recycling, reducing or reusing. In fact, I can't think of a more positive way to make a significant impact.

In exchange, you have our sincerest gratitude. We are a small team working hard because we really believe in this mission, and every little bit helps. Check out the perks we offer.

$5 - Thank you for your generous contribution!

This may not seem like much, but every little bit gets us closer to our goal and gives men around the globe the opportunity to get a vasectomy for their own future as well as the future of their family and their community. For that we will send you a special Thank You email from the WVD 2015 team.           

                                      

$20 - A WVD sticker to show your support.

For $20, we will send you a Thank You email along with a World Vasectomy Day sticker for your car, computer, or anywhere else you want to show your support!

                                         

$30 - Your name on a WVD banner at this year's International Conference on Family Planning.

For $30, you have funded a World Vasectomy Day inspired vasectomy. If the event itself costs $120,000 and we plan to do 4,000 vasectomies, that comes to about $30/vasectomy. For that, you will get your name included on a World Vasectomy Day banner that will fly at this year's International Conference on Family Planning in Bali.

                        

$50 - A World Vasectomy Day T-shirt.

For $50, you can get this World Vasectomy Day T-shirt, as well as a lot of attention when you wear it.

                             

$80 - A World Vasectomy Day tote bag.

If you donate $80, you will receive this awesome World Vasectomy Day tote bag filled with goodies inside.

                                            

$120 - "The Vasectomist" DVD.

Want to learn more about the origins of World Vasectomy Day? Check out this DVD of The Vasectomist, as co-founder Jonathan Stack documents the adventures of fellow co-founder, Dr. Doug Stein.

                                               

$300 - Meet the Doctor.

For $300, you have the chance to meet Dr. Doug Sein with a free Skype consultation!

                             

$500 - Personal letter.

You will receive a personal letter of thanks from a man whose vasectomy you helped support.

                                   

$600 - Personal video.

Receive a personal video from one man whose vasectomy you helped support!

                                         

$1,000 - Silver Donor.

You have our eternal gratitude! For $1000, you are a Silver Donor. We will acknowledge you on our website and send you a package with a T-shirt, tote bag, DVD, and a personal Thank You letter.

                           

$5,000 - Gold Donor.

Congratulations! For $5,000, you are a Gold Donor. We will acknowledge you on our website and social media and send you a package with a T-shirt, tote bag, DVD, and a personal Thank You video.

                   

Remember, every little bit counts. This is your chance to make a meaningful impact.

The Impact

We believe the world needs World Vasectomy Day. Here's why:
 

Here is an overview of our origin, vision and success from co-founder, Jonathan Stack:

During my life, I had witnessed two seemingly contradictory truths.  Truth one, there are a lot of frustrated and angry young men on this planet who easily gravitate to violence. Truth two, these same men, when encouraged to express their best selves and given the conditions to do so, choose the positive over the negative almost every time. 

We often hear that men don’t get vasectomies, and while in some places that’s sadly true, we also noted that what one man fears to do alone, he will not hesitate to take on when standing amongst a band of brothers.

So in 2013, I created World Vasectomy Day as a way to aggregate individual acts of love into a collective global movement for good. In year one, with a few friends, little resources but a lot of passion, we inspired over 150 doctors in 25 countries to do almost 1000 vasectomies in 24 hours.

Seeing the potential for success, for WVD, 2014, we set out to involve the global health community, and with Planned Parenthood, Marie Stopes International and many others, we partnered with almost 500 doctors in 32 countries who performed close to 3000 vasectomies. We were already the largest male oriented family planning event in history when India declared it an official day.

If year one’s theme was ‘lowering carbon footprint one vasectomy at a time’ and year two was ‘celebrating responsible men’, the theme for World Vasectomy Day 2015 will be ACTS OF LOVE.

Our goal, 750 doctors, 4,000 vasectomies, 40 countries and a strong and vocal presence at this year’s International Conference of Family Planning to be held in Bali, November 9 – 12. It is our chance to show all the major players in the field the possibility of overcoming the impossible. 

Risks & Challenges

As of writing this, there are 33 days left before our team heads out to Bali. As of today, I have no sponsorship deals, no corporate underwriting, no grant and no foundation money.  A number of individuals have donated generously and our own Dr. Doug Stein has offered a matching fund. To make our dream come true and never have to look back again with regrets on what might have been, we need to raise another $50,000. This campaign is one of our efforts towards reaching this goal.

We can't do it alone. I need you guys out there to help me by donating, by sharing and by spreading the voice about this year's goal for WVD.

We will get there and that's just the beginning.

Mission Statement

                          

We believe men are ready to make the choice to do right by themselves, their families and our future by becoming engaged in a conversation about family planning. World Vasectomy Day inspires these conversations, helping men become more informed about their choices, while creating alliances with governments, organizations, and individuals to help train providers, educate families, and offer services to men who are stepping up for their loved ones.   

Why Support World Vasectomy Day?

  • WVD promotes vasectomy awareness for the general community and uptake for men whose families are complete.
  • Provides an opportunity for men to have a properly informed discussion about family planning and contraceptive use.
  • Increases awareness about vasectomy being the safest, least expensive, and most effective contraceptive option available for couples.
  • Facilitates men sharing the responsibility for family planning.
  • Informs communities that vasectomy is less invasive than tubal ligation and has fewer side effects than any other method.
  • WVD does not deny the joy of parenthood–it supports improving the quality of life for those already living.
  • WVD works for a better future for our children and our children’s children.
  • Vasectomy eliminates the fear of unintended pregnancy.
  • Research has shown that vasectomy improves couples’ sex lives.  

 
Research has shown that vasectomy uptake worldwide trails other female sterilization at an average of about 8 to 1, even though vasectomies are safer, cheaper, far less invasive, and with fewer negative side effects than tubal ligation.  

There are many reasons for this disparity; the largest is the misconceptions held by men, women and health care providers across the globe. We believe that through a combination of education for families, training of highly skilled vasectomists, and increasing the availability of the procedure this method will receive greater acceptability worldwide.  

Limiting families through permanent methods including vasectomy helps reduce maternal death, prevents unintended pregnancies and averts abortions.   

A failed vasectomy results in a normal pregnancy; a failed tubal ligation can have life threatening consequences. 

A short History:

                
World Vasectomy Day is approaching its third year. Year One we were part of the Royal Institute of Australia’s Conference of Ideas, where co-founder Jonathan Stack invited vasectomist and AUA member Dr. Doug Stein, subject of the film “The Vasectomist”, to host a vasectomy-athon that took place simultaneously in 26 countries, and was live broadcast to over a half million viewers.  

                        

Year Two saw World Vasectomy Day reach a far larger audience, with over 500 doctors performing vasectomies in 33 countries in 24 hours, achieving around 3,000 vasectomies worldwide in honor of the event, making it the largest male oriented family planning event in the world. The live streamed broadcast from Planned Parenthood in Kissimmee, Florida reached over a million people worldwide and the organization grew through the support of global organizations such as Marie Stopes International, FHI 360, IPPF, PPFA, and other global family planning organizations. Our story was covered in media outlets around the world, and shifted from being about a one day event to the building of a movement that inspires men to join in the most important conversation of their lives.   


This year (Year Three), we are poised to stretch our global reach through international events, new partnerships and  our traditional vasectomy-athon.
                                                      
Activities will initiate early November in Bali, Indonesia, then WVD 2015 will kick off from New York City on November 13. Later in the month, our staff will travel to Dhaka, Bangladesh where we will present the rationale for World Vasectomy Day to more than two dozen Ministers of Health from the world’s most populous countries. Our planned activities are a true reflection of the growth and acceptance of WVD across the globe.  

Building a Coalition:

Many key organizations in international family planning already support World Vasectomy Day, including International Planned Parenthood Federation (IPPF) and IPPF Western Hemisphere Region, Planned Parenthood affiliates, Marie Stopes International, Pro Familia, Population Offsets, Population Media Center, Center for Biological Diversity, and several national urological associations.   

2015 Objectives :

  • Improve awareness of vasectomy as a secure and safe family planning option for men.
  • Celebrate and support all providers of high quality vasectomies, and encourage more doctors to offer this service.
  • Encourage men, whether they want a vasectomy or not, to participate in the bigger conversation about family planning.   
Implementing Word Vasectomy Day activities in 2015 will include the following action items:   

  • Develop messages that challenge the stigma of vasectomy through the WVD media advisory board.
  • Dispel myths and misconceptions about vasectomy.
  • Work with global partners to launch WVD 2015 from Bali, Indonesia, November 9 - 12th (International Conference on Family Planning).
  • Produce a 24-hour vasectomy-athon with live vasectomies on five continents and conversations global leaders in male oriented family planning.
  • Use social media campaigns, including webisodes, Facebook and Twitter, to engage men in conversations about their own reproductive health.
  • Spearhead NYC campaign to change the ‘mandatory’ 30-day waiting period to get a vasectomy to a voluntary 30-day waiting period.
  • With Partners in Population and Development, petition the UN General Assembly to declare an official UN World Vasectomy Day.
  • Create coalitions with other organizations that have a similar mandate or mission to support vasectomy training around the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute, and that's ok! Our biggest priority and marker of success is the quality of the conversations we help launch. Join in our conversation on Twitter @WorldVasDay with the hashtag #WorldVasDay, follow us on Facebook, and tell your friends. Send us your stories, pictures, and perspectives. 

The more we talk about sex and reproductive health, the more we can normalize male involvement, and the more men who will stand up and shoulder some of the burden for family planning.
story_txt:
Short Summary How can one person's contribution have the most impact on the betterment of people's lives?
On World Vasectomy Day, taking place November 13, hundreds of doctors
 from more than 40 countries are going to perform thousands of 
vasectomies.
A vasectomy is a simple and cheap procedure that can literally turn a 
family's life around. With just $30 you're allowing someone to
 get a vasectomy, someone who might not otherwise have access to 
reliable birth control.
By getting a vasectomy and having fewer children, men can give their
 families the chance to rise out of poverty. Smaller families also mean fewer resources are consumed and less pollution is produced. How much 
less? A whole lifetime's worth.
That's quite an impact for a such a meager amount. Matching Donation
The goal amount isn't there just for show. A donor has already committed to contributing another $5,000 to World Vasectomy Day if we manage to do our part.
Technically this means that any amount you pledge is worth double.
What is a Vasectomy?

Vasectomy is a surgical procedure for male permanent contraception. During the procedure, the vasa deferentia are severed in a manner so as to prevent sperm
 from entering into the ejaculate. Vasectomies are usually performed in a physician's 
office or medical clinic. The procedure is 
not complicated, the incisions small, and the necessary equipment 
routine.

                         


                                    
Due its simplicity, a vasectomy usually takes less than
thirty minutes. After a short recovery at the doctor's office, the patient is
sent home. Because the procedure is minimally invasive, many vasectomy patients
can resume their typical sexual behavior within a week.





Read more on Wikipedia.
  What We Need & What You Get All funds from this campaign are sent directly to World Vasectomy Day, which is a USA non-profit. The money will be used to produce the event that engages with men and providers around the globe. It will be used to spark conversation and ignite men to action for the benefit of themselves, their families, and the planet. 
If enough funds are available, World Vasectomy Day intends to expand the scope of the event to include more countries. Want your country to join in? We do too.


We are asking each of you to give what you can. If you give $30 that's about the cost for each WVD inspired vasectomy.  The event costs $120,000 and we expect to do 4,000 vasectomies. That’s $30 each. What does that mean? Well, for a man who had never thought to get a vasectomy, it might mean saving his wife’s life or making it easier to help his children emerge from poverty or it might lower carbon footprint 28 times more than a lifetime of recycling, reducing or reusing. In fact, I can't think of a more positive way to make a significant impact.
In exchange, you have our sincerest gratitude. We are a small team working hard because we really believe in this mission, and every little bit helps. Check out the perks we offer. 
$5 - Thank you for your generous contribution!
This may not seem like much, but every little bit gets us closer to our goal and gives men around the globe the opportunity to get a vasectomy for their own future as well as the future of their family and their community. For that we will send you a special Thank You email from the WVD 2015 team.            


                                       
$20 - A WVD sticker to show your support.
For $20, we will send you a Thank You email along with a World Vasectomy Day 
sticker for your car, computer, or anywhere else you want to show your 
support!

                                          

$30 - Your name on a WVD banner at this year's International Conference on Family Planning.
For $30, you have funded a World Vasectomy Day inspired vasectomy. If 
the event itself costs $120,000 and we plan to do 4,000 vasectomies, 
that comes to about $30/vasectomy. For that, you will get your name 
included on a World Vasectomy Day banner that will fly at this year's 
International Conference on Family Planning in Bali.                         

$50 - A World Vasectomy Day T-shirt.
For $50, you can get this World Vasectomy Day T-shirt, as well as a lot of attention when you wear it.
                              

$80 - A World Vasectomy Day tote bag.
If you donate $80, you will receive this awesome World Vasectomy Day tote bag filled with goodies inside.

                                             

$120 - "The Vasectomist" DVD.Want to learn more about the origins of World Vasectomy Day? Check out 
this DVD of The Vasectomist, as co-founder Jonathan Stack documents the adventures of fellow co-founder, Dr. Doug Stein.
                                                
$300 - Meet the Doctor.
For $300, you have the chance to meet Dr. Doug Sein with a free Skype consultation!

                              
$500 - Personal letter.
You will receive a personal letter of thanks from a man whose vasectomy you helped support.

                                    
$600 - Personal video.
Receive a personal video from one man whose vasectomy you helped support!                                          

$1,000 - Silver Donor.You have our eternal gratitude! For $1000, you are a Silver Donor. We will acknowledge you on our 
website and send you a package with a T-shirt, tote bag, DVD, and a personal Thank You letter.                            

$5,000 - Gold Donor.Congratulations! For
 $5,000, you are a Gold Donor. We will acknowledge you on our website and social media 
and send you a package with a T-shirt, tote bag, DVD, and a personal Thank You
 video.

                    
Remember, every little bit counts. This is your chance to make a meaningful impact.
    The Impact

story: We are raising funds to do 5 additional episodes to follow the case through to the final decision by the court.

story:
THE 'WONDERKIND' STORY

After his mother commits suicide, Logan Fairchild refuses to accept that she is dead. Imagining that both she and he are superhumans, he claims she faked her death.
 
Two years after, Luke, his closet-alcoholic father, takes him to counseling, concerned about his delusions. Luke also forbids him to go near his estranged brother-in-law, Logan's uncle Roman, who Luke believes fosters his paranormal delusions.
 
As Logan appears to be accepting that his mother is gone, Luke takes him on a weekend getaway to the family's cabin in the mountains. After Roman commits a violent crime and escapes into the woods, a series of bizarre, supernatural events occur, and Luke and Logan are pulled into a bizarre and treacherous conflict.

 

THE 2-MINUTE TEASER

The first 1:55 of the Wonderkind film. Luke remembers flashes of his tragic final night with Olivia.
 

 

WHO IS THE BIMACULATE?

Solomon Voegel, Roman's ex-comrade and a mercenary in the employ of the IIC, appears in the final scenes of the film to confront and ultimate kill Roman, Logan's uncle. The Bimaculate has more abilities than Roman, and he is twice as powerful.
 
The Bimaculate, The Extractor, swarms of IIC agents, and Solara Vanderweiss hinder Roman and the Fairchilds' escape from the clutches of the agency. They will stop at nothing to bring in 0-3-1-1 (Logan), and eliminate anyone who stands in their way, including his family.
 

 

 
      
 

WHAT MAKES THIS FILM SPECIAL?

Wonderkind is a powerful film. There are those works of art that inspire us to look deep inside ourselves and discover new strengths and places to grow; inspires us to hold on to faith in unseen things, to dare to hope, and about the curious power of belief. Wonderkind is exactly that sort of film, offering us the chance to look at ourselves and what we are are, in a brand new light.

It's DIFFERENT. It's not often that themes offering deep introspection about the human condition, theories on "metascience", telekinetic abilities, superhuman speed, substance abuse, grief, and childlike faith can ALL fit into one film, and do so in perfect harmony!

It's BOLD. The story explores all these themes faithfully and truthfully. It's a roller-coaster experience, with plot twists and turns all throughout, and treacherous danger at every point. Sometimes the story takes us to dark places, before the hope shines through. 

It's NEW. To our knowledge, and we believe you'll agree even after the first few scenes, we can't think of a movie that's ever been made like this. Though some critics who saw the full first draft made a few mentions of M. Night Shamalayan's Unbreakable (a fair comparison), there's still a vast difference in style, story, character, and aesthetic between the two. We trust that when we say nothing quite like this has been done before, no one will ever leave a theater skeptical about that claim.

It's GOOD. None of the above matters, if the film isn't well-made, or the story wasn't worth telling. It is, on both counts.

 

Once this film is done, YOU WILL HAVE TAKEN PART IN SOMETHING HUGE!

 

       

 

WHAT'S YOUR BUDGET?

 

AND WHAT'S YOUR PLAN?

 
We will be filming in the Dallas/Fort Worth area and then in Broken Bow, Oklahoma for 5-6 days in mid February (2017). Immediately after, we will edit the new scene and new footage into the final cut of the film, and make simultaneous submissions to Cannes, Sundance, and Toronto. 
 

      

 

OK! SWEET DEAL. WHAT CAN I DO?

1. SHARE NOW (please). If you like what you see, chances are so will your friends. If you do nothing else before leaving this site, please share this site link on your Facebook, Twitter, and social media accounts. It's difficult to really express how grateful we are for every share we get.

2. GET PERKS. We've got some awesome gifts of gratitude in return for those who financially support in this stage of getting the film made. Anywhere from $5 - which gets you an exclusive copy of our original soundtrack, complete with original production songs and score - to higher levels upwards of $1000 for some zany, memorable, exclusive once-in-a-lifetime kind of events.

3. GET IN THE KNOW. Make sure to like our Facebook page to keep yourself updated on the progress of the film, where we are, where we're going, and how we're getting there!

 

WE ARE READY. LET'S DO THIS, TOGETHER!

     

 

!!!PERKS!!!

Some of the cool things we're giving in return for small donations, from our supporters.

 

Featured Perk: The Red Carpet Connection, $20

Reserved seating at a few exclusive Red-Carpet premiere events of 'Wonderkind! Spring 2017. Premiere events will be held in Los Angeles, CA, Austin, TX (Alamo Drafthouse), and also in Dallas (The Angelika), on separate dates. One admission, plus another with RSVP while space is available. Press and public not admitted without invitation. All previous perks (listed to the right) will be included with this perk.

 

Novels in the 'Wonderkinder' Series

UBERJUDIN: After a cruel act directly followed by a miracle, a bizarre friendship forms between Katyas Dieffenbach and his prisoner, 7-year old Madeline. To save his wife from her cancer, the newly reformed prison camp commander must defect, and sneak her across the border. The 'Spurhunde' and his men are sent after them, as the Nazi regime hears of Madeline's supernatural abilities, and will stop at nothing to reclaim her.

 

WONDERKIND: See above.

 

METACHROMATA: Asher Carney’s wife Leigha became an invalid, after he found her scandalously pregnant with a black child. Sojourner, orphaned, is oppressed when he has visions of THE COLOR - a color that no one else can see. Solara Vanderweiss, claiming to be reformed, tells Asher that immensely powerful Sojourner is truly his son, and is in incredible danger. A struggle ensues as vying factions seek to either remove or consume Sojourner's incredible power.

 

CONTRA: The IIC has doubled their efforts to capture the body of Asher's abandoned son, Sojourner. The religious cult, The Glory, send their 'Immaculate' to retrieve the body. A powerful, alien force defends and protects Sojourner, for unknown reasons. Solara is tested, as these factions vie against her, and a powerful man who suspects she has ulterior motives will stop at nothing to kill her. A violent war begins, to discover the true power of THE COLOR, while Asher tries only to rescue the body of his abandoned son, believing all may not yet be lost.

 

Special: WONDERKINDER

A collection of short stories that directly pre-date and tie into the Wonderkind series, showing the origins of Die Wonderkinder, the research of Dr. Selinski (Roman), Olivia, and Dr. Voegel (The Bimaculate), the origins of Solara Vanderweiss, the beginning tests on Logan Fairchild, and ultimately, Olivia Fairchild's escape from the IIC.

 

       

 

TEAM WONDERKIND

Meet some of the top-notch, hard-working talent that comprises the Wonderkind crew.

 

MICHAEL CURYLO, Producer/Director/Writer

 

 

NICK SPRING, Executive Producer / "Luke Fairchild"

 

 

KARA RAINER, Producer / 1ST AD / "Solara Vanderweiss"

 

 

ROSS SKRUDLAND, Director of Cinematography

 

 

KRISJIAN VITATEAUX, Editor

Other Team Members:

* Brandon Maahs, Composer

* Peter Calvin, Producer

* Patrick Dean, Producer

* Brian Galyean, Producer

Night Shamalayan's Unbreakable (a fair comparison), there's still a vast difference in style, story, character, and aesthetic between the two. We trust that when we say nothing quite like this has been done before, no one will ever leave a theater skeptical about that claim.
It's GOOD. None of the above matters, if the film isn't well-made, or the story wasn't worth telling. It is, on both counts.
 
Once this film is done, YOU WILL HAVE TAKEN PART IN SOMETHING HUGE!
 
       
 
WHAT'S YOUR BUDGET?

 
AND WHAT'S YOUR PLAN?
 
We will be filming in the Dallas/Fort Worth area and then in Broken Bow, Oklahoma for 5-6 days in mid February (2017). Immediately after, we will edit the new scene and new footage into the final cut of the film, and make simultaneous submissions to Cannes, Sundance, and Toronto. 
 

      

 

OK! SWEET DEAL. WHAT CAN I DO?
1. SHARE NOW (please). If you like what you see, chances are so will your friends. If you do nothing else before leaving this site, please share this site link on your Facebook, Twitter, and social media accounts. It's difficult to really express how grateful we are for every share we get.
2. GET PERKS. We've got some awesome gifts of gratitude in return for those who financially support in this stage of getting the film made. Anywhere from $5 - which gets you an exclusive copy of our original soundtrack, complete with original production songs and score - to higher levels upwards of $1000 for some zany, memorable, exclusive once-in-a-lifetime kind of events.
3. GET IN THE KNOW. Make sure to like our Facebook page to keep yourself updated on the progress of the film, where we are, where we're going, and how we're getting there!
 
WE ARE READY. LET'S DO THIS, TOGETHER!
     
 
!!!PERKS!!!
Some of the cool things we're giving in return for small donations, from our supporters.
 
Featured Perk: The Red Carpet Connection, $20
Reserved seating at a few exclusive Red-Carpet premiere events of 'Wonderkind! Spring 2017. Premiere events will be held in Los Angeles, CA, Austin, TX (Alamo Drafthouse), and also in Dallas (The Angelika), on separate dates. One admission, plus another with RSVP while space is available. Press and public not admitted without invitation. All previous perks (listed to the right) will be included with this perk.
 
Novels in the 'Wonderkinder' Series
UBERJUDIN: After a cruel act directly followed by a miracle, a bizarre friendship forms between Katyas Dieffenbach and his prisoner, 7-year old Madeline. To save his wife from her cancer, the newly reformed prison camp commander must defect, and sneak her across the border. The 'Spurhunde' and his men are sent after them, as the Nazi regime hears of Madeline's supernatural abilities, and will stop at nothing to reclaim her.
 
WONDERKIND: See above.
 
METACHROMATA: Asher Carney’s wife Leigha became an invalid, after he found her scandalously pregnant with a black child. Sojourner, orphaned, is oppressed when he has visions of THE COLOR - a color that no one else can see. Solara Vanderweiss, claiming to be reformed, tells Asher that immensely powerful Sojourner is truly his son, and is in incredible danger. A struggle ensues as vying factions seek to either remove or consume Sojourner's incredible power.
 
CONTRA: The IIC has doubled their efforts to capture the body of Asher's abandoned son, Sojourner. The religious cult, The Glory, send their 'Immaculate' to retrieve the body. A powerful, alien force defends and protects Sojourner, for unknown reasons. Solara is tested, as these factions vie against her, and a powerful man who suspects she has ulterior motives will stop at nothing to kill her. A violent war begins, to discover the true power of THE COLOR, while Asher tries only to rescue the body of his abandoned son, believing all may not yet be lost.
 
Special: WONDERKINDER
A collection of short stories that directly pre-date and tie into the Wonderkind series, showing the origins of Die Wonderkinder, the research of Dr. Selinski (Roman), Olivia, and Dr. Voegel (The Bimaculate), the origins of Solara Vanderweiss, the beginning tests on Logan Fairchild, and ultimately, Olivia Fairchild's escape from the IIC.
 
       
 
TEAM WONDERKIND
Meet some of the top-notch, hard-working talent that comprises the Wonderkind crew.
 
MICHAEL CURYLO, Producer/Director/Writer

 
 
NICK SPRING, Executive Producer / "Luke Fairchild"


 
 
KARA RAINER, Producer / 1ST AD / "Solara Vanderweiss"

 
 
ROSS SKRUDLAND, Director of Cinematography

 
 
KRISJIAN VITATEAUX, Editor

Other Team Members:
* Brandon Maahs, Composer
* Peter Calvin, Producer
* Patrick Dean, Producer
* Brian Galyean, Producer

story:
ABOUT THE FILM

What's Left Synopsis: A young woman in prison for manslaughter is involved  in a pen-pal relationship with a young man, who's fiancée has been murdered. Both are in search of peace and redemption, but must let go of their pasts, together, for better or worse.

The film explores the questions: How do you move forward from the worst thing you've ever faced? If you can forgive, what's left?

This story is inspired by real life experience working with incarcerated men and woman. The challenges facing individuals exiting prison are without a doubt some of the most difficult situations ever faced. The challenges facing individuals trying to overcome the acts of violence committed towards them and their loved ones can be challenges that lead to more violence and crime. 

MEET THE TEAM

  

MARA LEE GILBERT (writer, producer, lead actress)

Mara is an actress/writer/producer living in New York City.  She has a Master’s in Forensic Psychology from John Jay College of Criminal Justice – an area of study she draws upon often in her writing and performing; and very specifically for this project, being inspired by her ten years of work counseling and teaching teens and adults housed in some of New York City's most restricted facilities.

Currently, Mara is also producing a one-act play, PASSAGE, which she wrote and will star in which will premiere with the New York New Works Theatre Festival. This festival connects the next wave of industry writing talent with current leaders of broadway and television production. nynwtheatrefestival.com 

She has also been commissioned to write a feature-length script project with a budget of $2.7 million to be spear-headed by one of Hollywood's established producers (details are not yet available for release).

Her one-act play, Steel or Pretzels, was chosen as one of the best plays of the Strawberry One-Act Festival of 2009 and is published in volume 6 of their anthology, The Best Plays of the Strawberry One-Act Festival. Her poetry has been published in John Jay’s Finest, volume 22 – a yearly publication showcasing the best student work for that year at John Jay College of Criminal Justice. She has also been published as the forward to well-known NY poet, Douglas Rothschild’s, recent collection: The Minor Arcana, which closes out his latest book of poetry, Theogony. View more here: www.MaraLeeGilbert.com 


JOHN BRODSKY (producer, lead actor)

John's last project, DAY 39, in which he stars, is currently a finalist of the student short films being considered for an Academy Award Nomination. www.day39film.com

He was born in Montclair, NJ and raised in Rumson, NJ. After singing most of his life in competitions, choirs, and bands John found that his musical talents could only take him so far. Not to be discouraged, a fellow band mate introduced him to an acting teacher and John was hooked. After studying in New Jersey on and off for a couple of years, John decided to leave college behind and pursue acting full time professionally in New York City.

After only a few short months of auditioning, John landed a co-starring role on Law & Order: Criminal Intent. In addition, John has worked on many short films, with directors ranging from Columbia University to NYU, with two films going to the Cannes Film Festival. Recently he got the chance to work with TINA FEY in the film, ADMISSION directed by Paul Wietz. In addition to acting, John loves networking and collaborating on projects with fellow actors, film makers, and musicians; discussing what it means to be an artist and navigate through “The Business.”

He is looking forward to pursuing more independent film opportunities, and is currently studying with Sean Folster in his Craft Gym Program. View more here: www.JohnBrodsky.com


JAMES REES (director)

James moved up to New York five years ago after being a pastor for three years. He has a background in the arts and after a hiatus, decided it was time to give it a go. As an actor, he has appeared Off-Broadway in Measure for Measure (Shakespeare in the Park) and in The Killer (Theatre for a New Audience). Directing WHAT'S LEFT was dream come true, as directing has always been a passion for him.

Currently James is starring in and producing a production of Mike Bartlett's play, BULL, to be performed the last two weekends of August at the Alchemical Theatre Laboratory on 14th St in Manhattan. BULL is a play about 3 co-workers who are awaiting a meeting with their boss, after which, one will be let go. It deals with the mind games that are played between them. At its core, it's an unflinching look at what bullying is in an adult context. It's a hard hitting hour of theatre.


ALEXANDER CROWE (director of photography)

Alexander is an award-winning cinematographer with his short film, ABIGAIL, taking second place at the Cannes Film Festival, 2012. This short is also a Staff Pick of what to watch on Vimeo. 

He resides on Brooklyn, NYC, and works passionately on films, web series, and music videos. He has an innate understanding of how to visually capture a story written on the page; finding the most artful and compelling images to accurately  portray a script. View his work here: www.axcrowe.com 


KATIE DILLON (editor)

Katie has been working in the film industry since she was 18 and has worked as a professional editor for the last 12 years. At age 20 she created and is the co-owner of the production company Beautiful Lady Productions bladyp.com. Films she has worked on have gone on to such film festivals as Festival De Cannes, Berlin Film Festival, and the Atlanta Film Festival and have starred such actors as Tom Sizmore and Eric Roberts. In 2015 alone she has edited 6 Feature Films, 7 Trailers, 2 Short films, and 1 web series.


RICHARD PADRON (composer)

SAMPLE OF MUSIC FOR WHAT'S LEFT: https://soundcloud.com/richard-padron/dreams-are-real

Richard Padrón is a guitarist and composer living and working in New York City. Having recorded and performed with such artists as Paquito D'Rivera, Chino Maurice, Michele Rosewoman, Lauryn Hill, Michael Phillip Mossman,  Zé Luis Oliveira, Benny Reid, Antonio Hart, Will Calhoun, José José, Tony DeSare, Fabio Morgera, Francis Mbappe, Stacy Dillard and other artists of many genres has reinforced his versatility and made him a growing influence in the New York music scene.

Richard was born in Havana, Cuba in 1982, emigrated to Miami in 1988 and lived there until 2003.  Although the only musician in the family, there was an overabundance of both music and support.  Growing up listening to Beny Moré, Fernando Alvarez, Tchaikovsky, Irakere and Billie Holiday instilled within him a musical appreciation from an early age that would later provide a rich musical foundation to draw from.

At the age of 12, Richard began playing guitar and attended the prestigious New World School of the Arts in Miami, where he began formal conservatory training when he was 16. Before graduating he began playing with some of Miami's most reputable musicians and ensembles such as Ira Sullivan, Othello Mollineaux, Gary Campbell, For If the Flies and Carlos Averhoff.  Intuitively utilizing his musical heritage as well as the musical diversity Miami had to offer, he developed a unique style of both playing and composing.  Drawing from many genres he breathes new life into the guitar and brings an inventive approach to his compositions. View his work here: www.RichardPadron.com

YOU - the donor. 

Ever want to be part of the filmmaking process? Get a peek behind the scenes of how a film actually gets made? With every donation, you can be added to our email list where we'll be sending out weekly updates from the perspective of every part of production. See how the film comes together so that when you finally see WHAT'S LEFT premiere online, on DVD, or during its festival run, you'll be part of the experience. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

This $7,500 will complete our post-production costs including:

- Finishing the editing

- Re-coloring the film

- Sound-mixing

- Original music composition (We support hiring other artists in our projects as opposed to using stock sound and music!) 

Please review the PERKS to find out what comes with your contribution as our way of saying THANK YOU!

Risks & Challenges

There is very minimal risk in becoming involved in this film. As the footage has already been shot and assembled, and our team is already on-board, with your support, this film WILL be completed! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute, but feel passionate about supporting our film, please help us spread the word!

story:
(key art by Benoit Penaud)

Welcome to Virtual Revolution's crowdfunding page! Here you will have the opportunity to be a part of our adventure, by helping us making a gritty, dirty sci-fi feature film about a dystopia where entertainment in general, and virtual reality in particular, have become a new way of life...



Virtual Revolution is a sci-fi feature, which could be described as cyberpunk. An interesting definition of cyberpunk is: 'High Tech, Low Life'. Most cyberpunk stories are dystopias set in our future, and they tend to raise questions that our societies will have to deal with in several years, decades, or centuries.

Virtual Revolution is also a bit of tech noir, with some of the typical codes from noir films (the investigator, the Femme Fatale...etc), but in a European environment.

(concept art by Jeff Brown)

Finally, Virtual Revolution will be a very visual film, as there will be cyberpunk elements, but also medieval fantasy ones, and post apocalyptic ones.



Paris, 2047. Technology has progressed to the point where virtual reality has become as realistic as reality itself. But when you can be a hero, a legend, when you can pilot spaceships and discover new planets, ride horses against orks and conquer lands, board pirate ships and explore islands, when you can get fame, pleasure, and wealth without risks, what's the point in sticking to reality?

Paris, 2047. 75% of the population spend all their time online, and don't care anymore about reality anymore. They are the Connected. Some have decided to stick to reality. The wealthy, mainly, since real life has reamined pretty comfortable for them. But also other people, for various reasons. Philosophical, religious, or just because what they do in life just matters to them more than virtual worlds. They are the Living. Finally, a small minority never could make a choice, spending half of their time connected, and the other half awake. They are the Hybrids.

(concept art by Benjamin Sjoberg)

Nash is a Hybrid. He is also a killer, paid by multinational companies to track down and eliminate terrorists who threaten the system. His new investigation takes him from the most opulent parts of Neo Paris to its dirtiest slums, but also through different virtual worlds he needs to log into. But when he finds himself in the middle of a dangerous game between the multinational companies, the terrorists, and Interpol, choices have to be made...



 


And, most of the crew that worked on Cassandra is already also working on Virtual Revolution.

Below is some of our cast.

We will be revealing more of the cast throughout the campaign.

The budget of the film is around $900,000. We've secured almost 50% of it. $300K are for post production, which is less urgent. For the shooting itself, we still need $150K to do things well. We are in touch with several small investors, so we're confident we will have $50K more by the time of the shooting. But $100K are still missing.

We will be shooting in two months. Not having these $100K would mean having to make several sacrifices that would affect the film. We want to use great cameras, we want to have everything we need for the lighting, and we want to secure locations that are definitely a part of the soul of a movie! Here below are some examples of locations we found and that we want to use.

And, of course, we need resources to decorate these locations. So, to sum up, your help will allow us to give the film the production value it deserves.


Here are some of the perks we are offering:



If you want to help but can't afford to contribute money, you can still pitch in by sharing this campaign with as many people as possible: with friends and family, on your social media, and all over the Internet. You will help raise awareness for this campaign, but you might also help someone who wants to support cyberpunk and sci-fi movies, find out about the project and make Virtual Revolution a reality.

story:
My name is Sarah Rosenkrantz and I am the writer/director, as well as star of All is Forgiven.  All is Forgiven started as and continues to be a passion project that is very close to my heart. All of the contributors to this film - actors, crew, post-production, have worked tirelessly and with full commitment. 

We are very excited with the final cut and want to share the movie with the world.  We are in the final stages of color, sound mix and titles, and love how everything is looking and sounding.

You can help us get this film out to festivals and have it be seen in theaters worldwide - hopefully one near you!

Here is a list of some festivals we intend to submit to:

Chennai Women's International Film Festival

Heartland Film Festival

Tacoma Film Festival

Newport Beach Film Festival

Rhode Island Film Festival

Athens International Film Festival

Jeonju International Film Festival

Lausanne Underground Film and Music Festival

and many more, with your help! 


To submit to a film festival there are costs. There is usually a submission fee ranging anywhere from free to $150. These costs are what we are seeking help with.

We have some unique gifts for you such as seeds, a metaphor for our film to grow and prosper. Check out the perks, and help us spread the word of All is Forgiven.

story:
Contribute for Bibles to be given away to fallen and lukewarm Catholics and bring them back fervently to The Lord! 

  • Gabriel's Messenger Ministries, Inc. is a ministry devoted completely to its goal of saving souls and changing lives through it's efforts to evangelize. "Preach the gospel to the poor, proclaim release to the captives, recovery of sight to the blind, and to set free those who are oppressed"-Luke 4:18
  • GMM is run by Nicole Abisinio, a Faith Based Film Producer, Casting Director, public speaker, and Evangelist.  GMM is a nonprofit in process for its 501c3 status.  GMM will not receive ANY portion of this funding as we are doing this as a volunteer mission. 100% of money contributed to GMM's campaign will go to Lighthouse Catholic Media and Indiegogo for the New Testament Bibles and the crowd funding usage fees. 
  • The more we pool our resources together here for this endeavor, the less expensive each bible will be (dropping from 5 dollars to only 2.15 per bible), and the more people in need will be gifted with God's word.

How Did this Begin?

  • Nicole's Story: God put it on my heart a year ago to get the four gospels into the hands of every fallen or lukewarm Catholic to bring them back fervently to Jesus.  Then, Pope Francis showed the same mission as he handed out new testament pocket bibles to the crowds in St. Peters Square.  Following that movement by the Pope,  the USCCB starting holding contests for churches to win new testaments in bulk for their parish.   We are praying that bibles will be given out in every Catholic church nationwide at Christmas and Easter Services, and even available in the back of Sunday masses for those who have not read the bible for themselves.  Now we have been blessed to partner with Lighthouse Catholic Media to make this Holy Spirit led mission come to light.  I pray and hope that the support will be even greater than any previous program now that it is for the Holy Bible, the sword of the spirit, the word of God!

Track Record

  • The program started with one church last month and Nicole had the opportunity to share in providing 2500 New Testament Bibles at St. John Vianney's Easter services to people who only see the inside of a church once or twice a year.  The response was overwhelming. 
  • Nicole's previous "Bless it Forward" Campaign raised $9200 dollars on Indiegogo and another $40,000 from individuals and churches offline for tickets for the film "The Investigator" and was able to evangelize thousands of people, including teens and homeless nationwide.   I pray and hope that the support will be even greater when it is for the Holy Bible, the sword of the spirit, the word of God!
  • Nicole Abisinio, Director of Board at GMM, has previously been responsible for millions of dollars at any given time in both her work in the financial industry as well as the film industry throughout the past 15 years.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to buy as many bibles as possible and GMM will coordinate them being handed out to as many Catholic churches possible nationwide for distribution at Christmas and Easter services (and possibly on Sundays). 
  • If we raise at least enough for 1000 bibles for each location, they will only cost 2.16 each. With shipping, it comes out to 1.89 per bible for 1000 bibles. Finally, we include the indiegogo fees (of 14%) it totals  $2.16 per bible (for 1000 bibles). The indiegogo fee drops down if we make our goal so if there is any surplus from that it will go to purchase more bibles.  
  • There is nothing more important or valuable in this life that saving a soul-it could be your family member, your friend, or your neighbor. Even better, it could be your enemy.
  • Thanks to our wonderful partners and supporters on this campaign-Lighthouse Catholic Media, Movie to Movement, renowned actor Jim Coleman, Catholic singer Annie Karto, and Everlasting Memories photography, we have some exciting, enriching and heart warming perks to share with many who contribute and will have strong social media presence!
  • Whatever we raise will 100% be spend on bibles, S&H costs from Lighthouse, and the Indiegogo usage fees of 9% and 3-5% for credit card processing.  The fee drops down by 5% if we make our goal.  Any surplus from a decreased fee will be used toward more bibles.
  • If you look below, you can see from the cost list to see that the more we raise, the more bibles we can buy because the price goes down with higher quantities
  • Here is the total cost (INCLUSIVE of shipping and Indiegogo fee.)

We go from $17 total for 1 bible, down to $2.16/per bible for 1000 bibles!!! 
1 Bible=          $19.50 
25 bibles=      $94

50 bibles =    $174

100 bibles=   $290

250 bibles=   $693

500 bibles=  $1,232

1000 bibles =$2155 

The Impact

All of us are feeling the difference in the world as we continue to fight for our faith and for the truth of Jesus Christ.  The persecution is increasing and so is the hatred in the world, on all fronts.  The best way we can battle this is through love and through the word of God.  The worse it gets, the more strength, love, and good deeds we need to do, with no strings attached.   

Risks & Challenges

The only challenge we face is those who don't understand how life changing the word of God is and how having a bible is the most important gift we can give. Let people read and learn for themselves who Jesus is and what he did. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute financially due to your circumstances right now and we understand completely.  We've been there before!  The great news is you can still help with your time and be part of this amazing mission for Christ:

  • Please share this link and post to everyone you know.  Personal individual emails are always more powerful so that time would be a huge help!
  • Also, if you are willing to be a volunteer and hand out bibles in your community or church, please email us your contact info: GabrielsMessengerMinistries@gmail.com

FAQs

Am I able to just buy a bible for myself or my family?
Yes, if you would like to buy a personal bible for yourself or a family member, they are $17 a piece w/ shipping and are available: ​http://www.lighthousecatholicmedia.org/store/title/new-testament-paperback?promoCode=1380

Am I able to have the bibles sent directly to my church?

Yes, as long as you contribute a minimum of 100 bibles (300 dollars), we are able send them directly to your church for you to hand out at masses.  If you would like this option, when you contribute, please also email us at gabrielsmessengerministries@gmail.com and give us your instructions including church and priest name.

How exactly are you deciding which church's receive the bibles?

Unless you specify a specific church for a contribution of 100 bibles (300 dollars) or more, they will be given out in large quantities between 250-1000 per church and will be on a first come first come basis after emailing our Catholic Church contact lists in the country and asking which churches would like them.

story:
“One’s destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things.”             - Henry Miller


Hello!  We are a team of four filmmakers from Milwaukee, WI planning a documentary project through Southeast Asia.  This part of the world is changing extremely fast. It will not be the same even five years from now. We want to capture the stories of locals through food, culture, livelihood and the art of observational documentary. 

Our team will meet up in Bangkok, Thailand, the starting point. Our tentative plan is to head south via train through Malaysia to Singapore, and eventually Indonesia, Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos, and the Philippines.

 It is almost always a facet of documentary filmmaking that plans will change, that we will come across things we could not have anticipated. For this reason we are keeping our options open. We will frequently stop in towns where we will search out fascinating individuals who are willing to share their stories with us.  With our collections of stories we will assemble a moving portrait of Southeast Asia, consisting of some of the world's most culturally diverse citizens.

Our team consists of four Midwestern filmmakers.  Everyone does a little bit of everything including videography, editing, sound recording and collaborative planning.

Brenton Wildman is from Milwaukee, WI where he earned his BFA in filmmaking. For the past year he has been living in New Zealand filming his experiences and sharing them through his blog.

Eric Grycan is from Sheboygan, WI on the shore of Great Lake Michigan; relocated to Milwaukee where he eventually pinpointed his interests in science and storytelling.

Aaron Hamer is also from Milwaukee where he began developing an interest in the art of post-production. He has been traveling New Zealand for the past year documenting his experiences.

Skyler Kroschel grew up in Afton, MN where her love for filmmaking began as a child when she came across her parent's old video camera and began to document her experiences.  She earned her BFA for filmmaking in Milwaukee, WI.


We all love the art of storytelling through documentary. This campaign will help give us the tools to achieve the best possible result. We want to share these stories with the world, hold informative screenings, and submit the finished project to festivals.

What You Get

The most important thing you will be getting out of this is a unique perspective of the citizens that make up one of the most culturally diverse places in the world.  We sincerely appreciate any support that you give us and we will do our best to make your donations worth it! If we don't reach our goal, we will use whatever has been contributed to make the best of it. In addition, the success of this project will encourage more like it in the future.

What We Need

Because we want to give you the best video experience possible, we are asking for your help. We’re not asking for help paying for travel fare, food money, or lodging expenses, but rather we are asking for other vital equipment, such as:

  • Sound Equipment including various mics and cables

  • Tripod

  • Editing Materials that require monthly payments

  • Extra Batteries

  • Hard Drives

  • SD Cards

  • Accidents!

Every bit helps!  We sincerely appreciate your support, like, a lot.

The Impact

While we have the skills and ability to produce images that will be entertaining and fulfilling, we do not have the financial means to attain access to all of the equipment that leads to quality. The money collected from contributors is essential to realizing images and stories.


Getting these stories to an internet audience around the world will surely have a positive effect on everybody involved, by sharing and giving people the means to learn about new cultures for free.

Risks & Challenges

Anything that can happen will happen. An eternal quote, sure, but as such, it always applies.

We will undoubtedly run into good luck, and just the same we will come across problems and challenges. With little to no contributions we will be unable to stand up to many challenges, such as equipment failure. However, if we meet our goal, we will be sufficiently prepared for any foreseeable technical or logistical problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot or do not wish to contribute money but still want to help, we would greatly appreciate simply spreading the word. Fortunately, it is mighty easy these days to spread information, just a few keystrokes and a couple of clicks can make all the difference between little contribution and meeting our goal. 

Truly, from the bottom of our hearts, we thank you.

story:
'Every generation has the power to be great, you can be that great generation'

That’s How It Is, or THIIS, was live during perhaps the most significant period for youth in South Africa. THIIS was significant in its ability to so subtly and powerfully pair the ways in which ordinary young lives connect to what is often seen as spectacular and out-of-the-ordinary political outbursts. Through the writing, photography and drawings of young thinkers, THIIS spoke of how love, sex, going to school, trying to find a job, parties and parents relate to the vast political troubles of our world.

Thought We Had Something Going is a collection of some of the most poignant posts over the 4 years of THIIS online magazine. As South Africa looks at 21 Years of Democracy through ever more jaded eyes, this book points clearly to how life goes on, broken but beautiful, and that freedom is something to be continuously sought – not born with.

We launch the narrative called: THOUGHT WE HAD SOMETHING GOING or #TWHSG for the book and documentary. The book and documentary will only coming out when people have shown commitment to wanting it. And what’s It? Ownership of our own realties. Well… also when we’ve raised enough money.

Now it’s up to you. Do you want to know what YOU have going?

Excerpt of Zakes Mda's Preface  - Thought We Had Something Going 

When Thando Sangqu approached me out of the blue to write this Preface I was reluctant at first. Many people ask me to write Prefaces for all sorts of things, just as many others send me their unsolicited manuscripts, expecting me to attend to them pronto. I have learned to turn down such requests; otherwise I would spend all my life reading and commenting on other people’s writing instead of attending to my own work. My first instinct then was to reject Thando’s request. But when he outlined his purpose and objective, I was impressed by his initiative and the clarity of his vision.
  This anthology with contributions from a number of writers, photographers and artists, he told me, aims to explore how young South Africans confront their truths and their inner political struggles in quest of relevance. “The book ultimately looks at how in a society that seeks so much validation in brand and social affiliation that perhaps young people need to learn to be their own greatest assets and favourite brand,” he added. “We launch this book in the 21st year of South Africa's democracy as I think it is important that we finally ask the question: where to from here? We have neglected to confront our truths and perhaps this book is that turning point for South Africa to wake up by reading the socio-political musings of young people in the infancy of their careers who have either just graduated or about to graduate.”
  Who could say no to such noble objectives? 
They write facilely about sharing apartments in Clifton, about attending expensive private high school, and about club-hopping and encounters with bouncers. In the same breath they decry the combination of money and ego, and the sense of naivety and entitlement that develops in young people of their social and economic standing. 
Sometimes a writer reflects on the meaning of freedom in post-1994 South Africa. It is telling that these writers talk of a “post ’94 South Africa” rather than post-apartheid. The legacy of apartheid is still very strong in today’s South Africa. In some instances it is not just the legacy but the practices and the economic arrangements of the past still pertain – including what one of the writers refer to as “apartheid constructed geographies.”
  These writing will take you on journeys of self-examination, self-criticism and self-discovery.  You will find in this trove interesting analyses of racial and sexual relationships, and of deeply embedded attitudes, biases and prejudices that manifest themselves only when friendships are tested. You will discover the different ways racism manifest itself among the peers.
 Zakes Mda, MA, MFA (Ohio), PhD (Cape Town).
 Professor of Creative Writing,
English Department,
Ohio University.
USA

           

Here is a collection of short writing by young people that offers us intimate insight into what being young feels, smells, tastes and looks like in South Africa's cities today. Humorous, pained, strained, witty and awkward, the writers in this collection sneer in the face of hyped up caricatures of apathetic young folk. They write for themselves as well as for those older readers who dare give in to their curiosity. A remarkable collection. -  Prof Pumla Dineo Gqola 


www.thoughtwehadsomethinggoing.com


Press Coverage: 

http://www.702.co.za/articles/3270/thought-we-had-something-going-young-south-african-voices-captured-online

http://vuzu.dstv.com/2015/06/16/youth-day-social-currency-activism-and-labels/

http://www.news24.com/Opinions/Born-privileged-not-free-20150616
